text: These cups are amazing. My kids don't look like babies with them and I don't have to worry about their teeth or spills. Win win!
Bought this heater to warm up my daughters breastmilk, and after a month no longer heated milk.
The best there is and so convenient getting it through Amazon.  I was conserving what personal stock I had, but now I don't have to.  Don't quit carrying it!

I bought this for a 12 month old outgrowing her infant seat and have used it for a couple of months. I don't know how it will be with a larger child. It is nicely enclosing for a small child, and the higher base makes it easier for a baby to see out the windows. Both of these benefits could end up being drawbacks with a bigger kid. I like the headwings for comfort and possible increased safety. The cover has the feel of an upholstered seat, rather than just a car seat cover. The harness/headrest adjustment is ridiculously easy, just pull up on a headrest tab, and everything moves up, and there is a pad covering any openings in the back, so there are no temptations for little fingers to dig into the mechanism or seat foam. Installation is also very easy. I switch this car seat to a caregiver's car once a week, and it is just a matter of loosening straps, undoing the latch, and then redoing it. I haven't tried a seat belt install. The crotch strap has two positions, but the padding flap is sewn on, so it is not clear how it would work with the outer strap position. I chose this seat over passing on an old Radian in use by an older child because it seemed cushier and cozier for an infant and better for sleeping in, and, even though it was expensive, I will be OK with moving my child to a dedicated forward facing harnessed seat or a Radian when she is older if this seat isn't working well. I hope that its extra safety features add something, but as we all know, even the least expensive seats pass the same safety tests.
I'm editing this review to highlight a limitation of the seat. It does not seem to be good for tall babies. You can only use the lowest 7 harness positions for rear facing, and my daughter has been at the top one since about 15 months. I'm not sure how far I can let her shoulders get above the harness slots, but she is basically outgrowing this seat with its 45 lb RFing weight limit when she weighs about 25 lbs. She is longer than most (100th percentile), but I still figured I could RF her till at least 2 without worrying that she was outgrowing the seat. For my daughter, this seat turns out to have not been a good purchase.

We are very picky about coffee and I'd never been able for some reason to make an awesome cup of coffee....finally...this coffee is fantastic!

See...it wasn't me, it was the bad coffe I'd been using ðŸ˜¼

I came across these crackers in a local market and decided to give them a shot. I had tried several other brands of rice crackers (ka-me, sesmark, back to nature), and they all have this distinct burnt rubber after-taste to them that I just cannot swallow. Not these! Diamond's have the most pleasant taste, and are really addicting. When I found these in the market, they were half the price of the other brands I mentioned. Not sure if this applies for all places.
all new flavors with black, green and spice teas.  I think the price is well worth the trial of these teas.
Candy was real hard and not fresh. It was not the way it is suppose to be. Very disappointed. Love this candy by Brach's and was looking forward to enjoying an old time favorite.
Not good at all. Tasted stale.  Would never purchase again.  Awful quality and just bad taste. Would not recommend to anyone

I have twins who generally like this toy. It has lots of sounds, lights, and everything a developing baby could want. However, I am giving this product three stars because its easy for tiny baby fingers to get trapped between the sun and the tab that changes the settings. We eventually had to tape it down to prevent anymore injuries.
These bids are great!! they wash amazing and look adorable. My son did fugure out how to pull it off so many times I just dont use it
I bought this for my son's lunch.  I put warm water in it for 5 minutes and then add the food.  It stays warm until lunchtime and seems very durable.
Found the candy not easy to eat, like it wasn't fresh, I just gave up on it. Its one of my favorite, but very disappointed with his brand.

even though i am not nursing, i am a first-time mom and i can't imagine sleeping well at night without this bassinet! the BEST feature is that you can see into to bassinet while laying in bed.  i can't tell you how many times i have reached in and placed the pacifier back into my son's mouth @ 3:00am and then rolled over to go back to sleep.  no getting up- no worries as to why he is fussing.  i can see right in and i know he is alive and well.  the light/music and most importantly vibration unit is also great.  vibration is key because my son goes right back to sleep when i put it on.  i read that babies are soothed by vibration and my son loves it.  i have no trouble w/ the sheets smelling, fitting or washing (which worried me because the other reviewer said she had a problem)- and it was really easy to put together.  i have reccomended to all of my friends- nursing or not.

The first 3 nights with my newborn baby I hardly slept. I kept having nightmares that I would find him dead in his cot. Then I bought this product and have slept wonderfully since - well as good as you can sleep with a baby! This product is very reasonably priced and I would have paid so much more for it. I have no complaints and my baby is now 5 months old.

My husband loves unfrosted Blueberry Pop tarts. This product is difficult, at best, to find in any store so I decided to order them through AMAZON to get the product when I want to receive it, but the last order was delivered 12/22/13 (Sunday) and when I opened the box the very first box of Pop tarts had no Pop tarts in it. I have been unable to find a method of contacting responsible parties, so I am writing this review. Beware. You may not get what you paid for. I will search for what I need.
These bars are dry and crumbly.  They are almondy and taste ok, but you need something to drink with them with EVERY bite.  And don't try to dip them because they will dissolve :)

A friend and I went to the manufacturer's website and ordered it there. Its half the price for the same size and they have a 5 pack there. As far as taste goes. I love love love my creamer in my coffee. I have to have it. I'm on a low carb diet and have been using heavy cream for my coffee for a while that does work but sometimes you want a bit of variety that being said I love the fact that this has zero cals or carbs. OMG I dont know how they make this stuff but Im thinking coco powder and magic. =)- but i will be ordering again but not from amazon sadly to much money.
This was a great buy for me..  Cheaper than the store and it came in a timely manner..  Thanks
These cloth diapers are wonderful.  Highly recommend.  They are becoming more and more popular and we love the selection available on Amazon.

I'm a tea drinker and I love loose tea.  I've tried several types of tea balls and even bought my own cloth tea bags.  I can tell you this tea infuser really is the Ultimate.  It's so easy to use: just put infuser in your cup, add the loose tea into the infuser and pour the boiling or hot water over.  I use the little metal cap over the tea while it's steeping to keep the heat from drifting out and then I use it to set the infuser in when I take it out of the cup to keep any additional water from getting on the table.  I love this product and it's price is the best on Amazon.

After our Safety 1st monitor bit the dust last week, we had to rush out and buy a new one.  So far, we have had no problems.  The phone does not interfere with it, nor do I have any of the random beeps or static that I did with our old monitor.  My only real complaint is that the base on the Parent's Unit is very narrow, causing us to have to prop it up at times.  It is quite unstable.  But, I really like the fact that the batteries on the parent's unit are rechargable.  I was used to chewing through 4 AAA batteries a week with the other one.  Also, the range on the parent's unit is wonderful.

Bought this for my 11 month old son as a xmas stocking stuffer, but when he saw it, he wanted to play with it right away. It is a big hit because if you push car back it winds up and takes off and he just laughs seeing the car move.
Great buy. Looking for more colors.

The bottles are great! They heat up nicely, they look great, they feel good (the silicone sleeves keep your hands from burning!) in your hand, and my lo loves them!  The only complaint I have is the openings of the bottles.  I wish they were bigger to make it easier to get scoops of formula into the bottles.  That is really the only thing keeping me from giving these 5 stars.

I purchased these chips for my mobile vending cart. Because I have Amazon Prime the cost per bag is really good as far as a reseller goes. Each flavor is really good in its own right. These chips the Asian Sweet and Spicy are just so tasty. Its just the right amount of sweet and the slightest bit of spice that makes these a fantastic tasting chip.

Lets talk about details:

Chip thickness (+)
These are gourmet chips and the quality is there from the moment you open the bag. Each one is crunchy and not too thick but just enough to let you know you didn't buy a bag of Lays.

Grease (+)
These are NOT greasy chips. Depending on the flavor they are just mildy seasoned and not coated in a heavy grease or oil.

Flavor (+)
Each flavor stands completely on its own. You could do a blind taste test of each one of these flavors sold by Deep River and I bet you could tell what it was. None of the flavors are overpowering except maybe the Jalapeno flavor which is honestly too hot and I love hot food.

Resale (+)
You may not resell these but at the current price and using Prime shipping the cost per bag allows you to make a decent profit.

Overall:
These are great tasting, unique flavored chips that are hands down better than the ones you can get in bulk at a Sams or BJ's. Do yourself a favor and try a bag or two. I bet you'll love em like we do.

Thanks for reading my review.
My son eats so many of these organic squeeze packets.  He seems to love this flavor.  I have it on auto subscribe and love the savings!
This works with LATCH and for the price it is awesome.  Does the job!!!!  I highly recommend this product.

I use boullion  cubes for soup stock because I can keep them in the cabinet and they impart a very good base for what ever else I'm making like soup or stew or a rice dish. McCormick Brand Spices has improved in quality quite a bit. This boullion is fresh when I receive it and has a good flavor.
Easy transition from Bottle to sippy cup. My son is picky with his milk bottle and when he saw this it was a perfec match!
This is some seriously good white miso, and it's gluten-free! I would recommend this sweet miso to anyone who wants to enjoy the health benefits of fermented soy bean paste without gluten.
I'm not gonna lie, these kinda smell and taste like dog food would, but I weirdly got used to it and mix them with my mulberries for a granola-like snack. Super healthy!

My friend mentioned his favorite candy bar was Twix. I stuck this monster bag in my glove compartment and grabbed one of these every time I knew I was going to see him (weekly), and gave it to him. He now associates me with good feelings.... and hunger...

My husband loves this coffee.  I heard it is going to be discontinued soon so I bought a bit shipment.  I may buy some more before it goes away.  Ugh Oh ... Am I becoming a hoarder?  Oh well ... what can I say ... the coffee is supreme.

We were not interested in buying any stroller but the BOB Revolution Duallie until I started checking out the +one's features. We had a BOB Revolution Single for our one child and loved it. The +one has almost the same footprint (slightly larger) as the single BOB, but can accommodate two children- one can even be laying down. We are a one stroller family, meaning a stroller has to be able to fit all circumstances including running trails and roads, walking busy sidewalks, cruising the airport, etc. We were out and about in this stroller within days of our second child's arrival. It worked great since our toddler could sit up front and our newborn could be completely flat. Within 5-6 weeks we were able to run with both kids in tow. We were able to switch our infant to an upright position at around five months as we continued to run 3-5 times a week. (I'm not sure this is recommended, but our son was pretty strong from an early age and his neck was more than able to support his head even while bouncing around a bit).

It collapses fairly easy, although ours gets stuck sometimes. It won't store as small when you are using it for an infant and toddler because of the bassinet-type insert. It should be noted that my toddler is very large for her age and quite picky, but she will switch from the front seat to the back and back again without caring that her legs must be very bent to fit in either seat. (This was a big concern for me before purchasing the stroller). The sun shade is huge and awesome. The storage below is roomy.

It does not go over the bumps quite like our BOB would, but I don't think that the +one is actually considered a jogging stroller and I am also comparing a single stroller to a double stroller. Overall, this is a great stroller and I almost wish that it had been around when we were searching for a single stroller knowing that we were going to have kiddos fairly close together (22months apart).
looks awesome!  very happy with the hat and my little man loves wearing it!  Great buy for a great price.
This coffee is getting harder and harder to find. We are going to upgrade to a Keurig hope fully soon.
This stuff tastes great and has better ingredients than ensure.  I would recommend this to anyone who drinks ensure on a regular basis.

Great potty.  Especially for boys. Most other potties he would pee out of the potty, but this works and holds it in.  Love the back support too,  He is really hyper and the back support hugs him so it has a calming effect.  Only negative thing, is that the potty is small and my son is 3 years, he is a big boy.  I wish they made this bigger.  I would get it anyway!
I have been a Peanuts fan for many years. When my daughter announced she was having a boy, I decided this would be the theme for the baby's room!
Hard to find locally outside of Christmas.  These nuts were much fresher that what I could buy locally and should allow me to eat non-processed nuts year round.

This is so cute!!! Easy to put together. Amazingly durable. I weigh over 200 pounds and I can sit on the chair. My 2 year old grand daughter loves it and uses it all the time. She climbs all over the chairs and table and never once have they even looked like they would tip over!!!! Great product and low cost. I would recommend this to any parent.

I have made it most of the way through sample pack and so far I have been happy with it. Except the apple pie a la mode. I had nightmares about that flavor for two nights and anytime I catch a whiff of that smell they reoccur. I hesitate to try the banana foster for the same reason.
I have been using Bob's Red Mill mixes for years and have never been disappointed!
This Tiger coffee was new taste for us but has turned out to be one of our favorites. Coffee was priced right, shipped fast and we will use this vendor again.

I love this product, its a large container and is a great price for the size!! I recently purchased a different brand in the store because I happened to walk past it, and I HATED it.  I use this for everything, and I was not able to wiht the other brand I bought. :)

Cute little book for baby.  Lots of nice noises, pages crinkle, rattle, squeek, etc.  Bright colors and different textures that baby will love.  Like all Jellycat products this seemed like is was designed just for my little guy!  You can see in the picture that this book has a little loop so you can attach it to stroller, shopping cart, etc....the loop has velcro so you can attach it easily LOVE this!  Also every other fabric soft book I have got has very rough \\"adult\\" velcro on it....this book has micro velcro so when my son chews on it (which he does a lot) he wont scratch his gums!!!!!!!!  Top quality
My baby liked it for a couple weeks only......after  that he liked it as a toy more than a pacifier! however i liked how it stayed close to my son so he could suck on it anytime!

i didnt use these for my baby as a bottle bc the nipple is way too small for his preference... didnt know what to do with them and I hate wasting things, so one day I had no clean containers to store the milk I was pumping and decided to use this 5 oz bottle...  THIS BOTTLE SCREWS ON PERFECTLY TO MY MEDELA PUMP!!  OMG, its a dollar!   Ive been using them ever since. just popped out the latex nipple and the lid created a perfect seal. very happy to have discovered that!

This bunny is so soft and huggable. My grandson loves it.

he sleeps wth it whenever he comes to visit.

Don't be disturbed by not being able to read the front of the package because these gummy lychees are the absolute best I have ever tasted. There seems to be more juiciness in them than the fruit itself would have! It's very rare to find a strawberry candy that doesn't taste fake, and this is definitely a good example of something that tastes real.

Our bedroom is literally less than 20ft away from our daughters room, on the same floor. Right across the hall. We have to have her monitor as close to her door as possible, and ours is as close to our door as possible, and still, the reception is HORRIBLE, it constantly cuts out and back in as if I'm at max range. We have to adjust it often just to make sure it's in some perfect position that it might work all night long without cutting out completely and making the loud buzzing noises to let us know it's not working. We have the same problem with our parent unit we keep downstairs, horrible reception and occasionally decides to stop working all together! For such a pricey piece of equipment, it is HORRIBLE. Wish I would've saved my receipt. Never buying electronics from this company again.
These tasty wonton chips are great for salads! Individual serving bags keeps them fresh until you need to use a bag or two.

This was easy to assemble, but once done, it's a little flimsier than most. A selling point of this bassinet is that it's portable but once you scoot it from one room to another more than a few times, the legs get a little wobbly.    Also, the \\"pin\\" that is supposed to keep the cradle in place falls out too easily, and catches against the wood, which of course scratches it.     Another time, the pin goes in, but the pin is so thin that the cradle moves about. So if baby rolls to the side, he will be on a slight incline, which may wake him up because the pin comes out so easily and is the wrong girth. Also, my son got his foot stuck through the slats.
My fave snack that I keep stocked in my kitchen for me and the kids. They are both Healthy and delicious.
I love this carseat and got it for a pretty good price on amazon!  A little heavy & bulky with the base....but, It does not really bother me!!  I would purchase this again!!
At a 1.33 each is not such a good price.  I found these at Sam's club at 6.88 for a box of 8.

I bought four frames as Xmas gifts and can tell you it's been an uneven experience.  By no means am I a crafty mom, the main reason I bought the product was because it's not only \\"easy to use,\\" but it doesn't look cheap.  The frame is lovely, and I appreciate the molding?/cutouts that will frame the actual photo/print.    The first try was a mess, and it took a few frustrating tries for the lightbulb to go off and get a successful imprint.  The rolling pin is useless as the clay stuck to the thing immediately.  So I flattened it out to a reasonable dimension w/ the palm of my hand.  Then I stuck my kid's hand into the clay, and the clay stuck to her hand terribly, ruining the imprint every time I tried to remove her hand.  Frustrating!  Why did it stick to her hand while not sticking to mine as I rolled it....?  Aha! Slightly dense, I know, but it finally occured to me that I should roll it on her no-longer-willing hand a little bit before sticking it into the clay for the umpteenth time.  Moderate success!  Exhausted, I put off the other 3 prints for the next day.      Feeling wiser and more confident, I set out to complete the project the following rainy afternoon. Seeing the stuff, my kid knew what was up and tried to hide behind her dad.  Happily, the following two imprints breezed by with nary a cry nor a curse.  Success within my grasp, I confidently ripped open the fourth and final package and met what nearly became my Waterloo.  The stuff stuck to me bad.  Words can't describe the panic-inducing mess as I struggled to free myself of this thing that was like wet bread dough and taffy rolled into one.  What had happened?  Was I really so arrogant?  Couldn't the gods let me have this one win?  For the entire length of time it took for my fella to win an online Halo match I struggled.  Concerned, my child offered to help me, but I would not sacrifice my offspring to this horror.  If I went down, I wanted my kid to live the rest of her life knowing her mommy's sacrifice every time she saw the empty shadow box on the wall.  I finally managed to scrape the stuff off my hands--I guess after 20 minutes' worth of air time, it finally hardened into something that was almost manageable.   Afraid of being trapped again, I put a light coating of olive oil on my hand to flatten out the clay.  Fearing for my kid's psyche, I did the same for my daughter, and I must say the image was the best one yet.  I don't know if any discoloration will result, but I figured I might have the kid paint them when ready.      Easy?  Sometimes, but this product is definitely not for the weak.  You've been warned.

I prefer the ergo and my husband prefers the mei tai but I use it at times as well. It's really nice to both.
But for me since I'm a petite frame the straps are too long and the knot formed at my low back bothers me or too much extra fabric hangs down. This is partly why is works better for my husband. He loves it.

This is the second time we are purchasing these clips. These are for the stroller for the baby we are currently expecting. We were very happy with our previous purchase that we didn't have any second thoughts of buying another pair.

My puppy just LOVES this ball! She loves anything that makes noise and this ball squeaks as it rolls around...and if she bumps it with her head it squeaks even louder....she a great time chasing it all over the house .....now its her favorite toy!

I'm writing this at 3:30 am because this poorly designed product has the regrettable feature of keeping me up all night.  For some reason they designed the emitting unit so it is pretty much a five inch block of bright blue glowing light.  It literally lights up the entire room at night when I am trying to sleep.  There is no way to dim the light.  And now it is starting to flicker incessantly all night.  I can not understand why they would make a product that would be used at least 12-hours a day in darkness as a night light.  It is very frustrating.  The receiving end is also very bright in my child's room.  Perhaps I am just a light sleeper but then please consider this if you are one, too.

These gummy worms are awesome!  They came super fresh and were perfectly gummy for my wedding candy bar.  When you can get the bag this large the price goes down per pound drastically.  I have purchased many times from here and will continue to do so.  This is the best way to get a ton of candy for a function, school event, party or just over all for candy addicts.

We usually get a prime rib for Christmas dinner from Omaha Steaks but this year I decided to try Burgers because their hams were so good. I have got to say this prime rib roast was the best ever! You have got to try it! Our roast was almost 10Lbs and we fed 12 adults and 5 kids, the left-overs tasted as good the next day! We had Philly cheese steaks with au-jus. You will not be disappointed!
I've got to stop buying these "add-ons". What I got was OCD unfriendly. I got 3 blue cups and 3 red lids, 2 green cups and 2 orange lids, 1 yellow cup and one yellow lid. You only get 1 cap.

I am generally a Seattle's Best coffee fan, but this competes well and is a bargain compared to some higher priced brands. The first bag impressed me with really oily fresh beans. The smell was somewhat off-putting when opening the bag for the first sniff. However the first batch through my French press was delicious! Upon sharing this with a few colleagues at work, the opinions were favorable. We like our coffee dark & strong with no acidity. Cafe Altura French roast is a winner and will also produce a fine espresso or a stout iced coffee. Okay- this is an update to the above: Upon trying an espresso grind, the coffee is still tasty but the oily beans finally killed my cheap burr grinder! If you are going to have freshly roasted, dark roasted, oily beans coffee, then use an inexpensive chopper-grinder or invest in a commercial grade, conical burr grinder. This is good coffee, but tuff on cheap grinders!
This product closely resembles the gluten free variety and does not do enough to demonstrate the difference. My wife has celiac disease, we bought this inadvertently and cannot return it.
This pump works great. I bought it to go on a DaVinci 750mL syrup bottle and it fits perfectly. Two pumps in my iced coffee and it's like I'm in a coffee shop.

Pleased with the product, delivery time was quick.  I bought it as a gift for a duck themed baby shower so I won't get to see how it works.  I saw some other types at a Uwajamia store recently but this one is cuter than what they had.
These olives retain the slightly bitter taste of uncured olives. They are an excellent choice if you want to stock up on canned olives.

Best stroller yet.  I have three kids, two under the age of four, and have bought way too many strollers.  This is not the most expensive stroller I have purchased, but to date it has the best build quality, rolling characteristics, and ease of opening and closing.  It is larger than the four wheel umbrella types and some others when folded up, that is what you get with a jogging style three wheeler.  If this were lost I would immediately replace it.  Keep those umbrella strollers for the occasional dash to the supermarket, but for your intentional longer walks, trips through the shopping mall or just strolling, this is the one we prefer.

This is terrific coffee for the price. How they can sell an expensive varietal coffee like Yirgacheffe(some of the best coffee in the world IMHO & many coffee writers)for these prices is a mystery. The roast is right in the middle so people who like the \\"Charbucks\\" roast(which I do) may be slightly disappointed but I found plenty of good flavor in this, didn't really miss the dark roast. The icing on the cake is the wonderfully fast delivery time-my package's roasting date was 4 days before I got it!! Can't really improve on that unless you have a roaster in your neighborhood. Buy it direct from FRC, same price, freshest delivery!

overall i really like this blanket a lot and i have used it regularly to help keep my baby warm but due to the relative thickness/stiffness of the material i tend to use it as you would a regular blanket (i.e. simply laid on top of sleeping baby) vs. as a swaddling blanket. it's also great for laying out flat to protect baby from surfaces and vice versa (e.g. floor, couch, bed, etc.) and i absolutely love the subtle color/pattern due to my minimalist, modern stylistic preferences.

for swaddling my husband and i preferred to use the muslim cloths (e.g. aden + anais) as they were thinner/more flexible/had more stretch - for us they worked better to really cocoon our baby snugly as she is a little houdini and wrapping her in the swaddledesigns receiving blanket didn't work well at all. while the material is actually more similar to what they were using in the hospital it just didn't work well for us to keep her contained and wrapped up. also, our apartment tends to run warm vs. cool even though we live in a very cool-year-round city so the heavier flannel also was a touch too warm for swaddling use.

that being said, i do still highly recommend this blanket because as already mentioned, it has a ton of other uses and is made from good quality material and has a great overall design. it holds up beautifully through multiple washes and i know i will be able to use it for many years to come for my baby. when we were still swaddling her we would use this one as an extra layer when needed on top (the hospital always swaddled her twice, we just swaddled once and then placed a second layer over her in her bassinet) and now that she's past needing to be swaddled i use it as a lighter blanket for crib naps during the day - the material is soft enough to be against baby's skin but stiff enough that i'm not concerned about it being a suffocation hazard in any way.
Love this pak n play!  Cute, fun and colorful!  Has a great changing area for newborns and also has useful diaper and wipe storage.  Love it!
My 5 month-old grandson enjoys this toy.  He quickly learned how to make the music play and easy for him grab on it with the handle.
Love the bedding..it is exactly as shown..light weight. Washes good..fotted my sons toddler bed perfectly.
Very nice idea of tower with many boxes, but even when it was packed in to a pocket - all boxes were in dust outside.... don't liked much because it was a gift.
This is the one and only ORIGINAL Maggi, made in Germany. Simply the best. Makes everything taste better, no matter how good of a cook you are.

$18 for a 15-lb bag of delicious brown rice is already a good deal, but what sold it was Prime shipping and it was at my doorstep in 2 days for free. Other vendors with similar sized products charge $10+ S&H due to weight of the item. Basically, if you have Prime, this is totally worth it. :)
This is so nice for chilly days... I have 2 for our double stroller.  It's warm and cozy, my kids never complain about being cold when they're bundled up in these!

tasty expensive but worth it.
PACKAGE comes from mail in small pieces. THe shipping people abuse the package and I get bits and pieces of cookie.

Horrible, ridiculously thin, I used them once and now they sit in the linen closet.  Don't be sucked in by the cute design.  Buy towels at Target or Toys R Us/Babies R Us that you can feel before you buy them.  Trust me- avoid this product!!!

Maybe my taste has changed but these don't taste as good as the ones my daughter purchased somewhere in Encinitas, Ca. Hers were in a 6 ounce package and the crackers were smaller, ideal for cheese spread.

This is as close to the Sharwoods tandoori mix I used to love. It isn't exactly the same, but, after searching the world for the Sharwood's and finally realizing it is not on the market, this is the closest. So if you are partial to the Sharwoods you will like this ( almost as well).
The roast date was July 14, I received it on August 19.  The coffee tastes stale.

when you want something low in calories and filling and very healthy you should try these. i use these to make sandwhiches with and use with  dips and just about anything i can think of.  i even give these to my dogs as a healthy treat and they love them
The Good Sense organic dried apricots are large and juicy when soaked. They do not have a bitter aftertaste like other brands. I make a puree and eat it like jam.
Thought they were gonna be a little bigger but actually for favor giving turned out to be perfect and packaged beautifully.
I LOVE this coffee. It has the best taste. And to order a  bunch at once is the way to go.
This  is a wonderful source of nutrition and energy, with antioxidants we all need, especially us vegans!

It's everything you'd expect from a "milk" "chocolate" flavored candy bar that has never been within 500 ft of a cow or a cocoa bean. If you want a giant piece of matter that has been genetically altered to resemble the properties of a candy bar then you've come to the right place.

I was wanting to switch to an organic chemical free shampoo and I chose this one.  I will tell you it is difficult buying an object online that has a smell to it not knowing if you will like it or not.  Well....... I love it.  It smells amazingly enticing.  My hair is getting smoother and smoother by the day as I'm no longer suffocating it in chemicals.  I love this shampoo.

Great product. I absolutely love it because there is no white noise. Used this to replace the camera monitor from babies r us which the white noise was just driving me crazy.

Update

I drink a ton of Matcha, and have tried just about everything under the sun that claims to be ceremonial grade. Many fall horribly short of the mark. Was on DoMatcha and Matcha Ippuku which were working really well for me... until I found this.

This is the sweetest most well balanced matcha I've ever tasted straight, short of permutations that cost $60 per ounce. The color is fresh and vibrant, again the best I've seen retail. It holds an ultra fine froth for an absurd amount of time, to the point that it feels like you are drinking a creamy beverage when there is no milk present. Properly prepared in the right concentration, it is almost like you are drinking a properly served Guinness.

Packaging is great. No annoying pouch inside. Pop the top and the powder is there, waiting for you to dig in.

Cooking with matcha and making matcha lattes is all fine and good, but do that with your second harvest stuff. Consuming this as anything less than a straight up cup of tea doesn't do the product justice.

Yes, it is that good.

I did quite a bit of online research before purchasing this BEE for my 20 month old daughter. I have been wanting to get a ride-on toy for some time, something she could use inside. We got the LARGE version (she is currently 24 lbs and average height) and was given to her as a 'prise' one morning. She immediately got on it, and started wheeling around. Each day she rides on it around the house and is always saying 'BEEE.\\"     Last week, her grandmother bought her an electric Dora car, which she did enjoy. But after riding it a few times, she got off, pulled out her BEE and started riding on it. She likes the Dora electric car, but LOVES the Bee. I highly recommend it as a non-plastic, very friendly toy and I wish I had gotten even a few months earlier.    UPDATE: 1/26/2010. Our daughter is now almost 2.5 years old. We had rain rain rain over the last few weeks so had one of our playgroups meet at an indoor mall. All the kids brought their ride on toys. Kettler push bikes, Radio Flyer, you name it. Every kid wanted to ride THE BEE. The little girls all around 2 years old took turns on it -- my daughter became quite upset because she wanted to ride it too and sharing at this age is more of a concept than reality. We love this BEE.

btw, the honeys taste all depends on the types of honey and flowers and environment, but I will buy YS and White gold again

I will start by being kind, It is a good idea to save money with an item or concept like this. It makes good sense to use your own coffee beans and avoid the cost of the pre-filled commercial K-cups you buy at the store.  Now, I received my DisposaKups over a month after ordering them and put them to use.  I was immediately disappointed, filters did not hold very much coffee, It was a struggle to get the lids to fit together with the filter and outer plastic cup.  The coffee was very weak.  This product actually creates more waste in a landfill than the commercially made K-cups. The body and lids are plastic.  Normal K-cups do not have a plastic lid.  Notice they say 100% disposable....So put them in the trash. They are not recyclable = landfill.  They are not convenient, they are a bit messy, a pain to put together and still expensive.  Not worth it! There are better alternatives out there that will save you money, make better coffee and not go into a landfill.   Sorry, I wish I had better news, I think I will return these.

Krave cereal is an interesting concept. Kellogg's seems to be targeting both kids and parents with the promise of whole grains as well as a chocolate center, plus somewhat unique branding for a broader appeal. This is in contrast to Special K Chocolatey Delight which is aimed at grown-ups or Froot Loops which is marketed to kids.

From an appearance and texture standpoint, the cereal consists of little pillow-shaped bites with a small amount of \\"chocolate spread\\" inside each one. Without milk, they are fairly crunchy, but after adding milk, the oat content (and lack of a waxy milk-resistant coating) makes it easy for them to start to get soggy in much the same way that Quaker Oat Squares do, with the outside layer becoming soft first. When eating it, the texture is just slightly course, perhaps on purpose to highlight the whole grain content, but not unpleasantly so.

Flavor is rather oat-like with some sweetness and a touch of chocolate flavor. I would describe it as similar to Oat Squares, but smaller and with a little less crunch, plus the added chocolate. It's different, but can kind of grow on you, and kids seem to like it. The box was gone quite quickly.

I like the cereal, but would prefer to see a little bit higher fiber content per serving and perhaps a touch less sugar. 3g fiber is the same as Multi-grain Cheerios, but Oat Squares has 5g per serving. It's actually very close in both fiber and sugar content to Froot Loops, surprisingly.

Overall, I would describe Krave as a cross between Oat Squares and Cap'n Crunch (and somewhere between the two in size), plus a touch of chocolate. If the way that Oat Squares get soggy from the outside in bothers you, you probably wouldn't like Krave, but otherwise I think most people who like oat-based cereals and chocolate would enjoy it. Kids like it too, so it might be a reasonable option if your kids are sick of Chocolate Cheerios or Life Cereal, and with about the same or a little more fiber (though also a little more sugar).
With my 1-star reviews on their two other items, I am not going to risk horrible taste memories by even opening this. I do feel sorry for the homeless guy I am gonna dump these packets on. Poor soul.

If you like Special K cereals in general, you're probably going to like this. The strawberries are the same dried wafers that they use in their regular strawberry cereals, no big surprise, and which I've always thought were a little tart for my taste. The chocolate comes in tiny rectangles about an 1/8th of an inch wide and 1/2 an inch long, and taste like semi-sweet dark chocolate. Together, they don't taste too bad - Special K has never been a very sweet cereal anyway, and even with the chocolate, its still pretty mild.

If you look close at the picture on the front of the box, it shows a detailed picture of a bowl of this stuff, and it's pretty misleading. The chunks of strawberry look like they just came out of a garden, and they chocolate looks much bigger than what you really get. I don't suppose we should be surprised that a pictured designed to sell us cereal is less than honest, but still, I wish I had the bowl on the box rather than the bowl I ate this morning.

The worst thing about this cereal (and again, it's really not that bad), is that the chocolate chunks tend to congregate toward the bottom, so when you pick up the bowl to slurp the milk out because all the flakes are gone, you'll find out where all the chocolate was that you thought you'd be getting THROUGHOUT the meal. As I said, Special K really isn't that sweet of a cereal, so if the makers were depending on the chocolate being well-dispersed throughout the flakes to give it a little bit sweeter taste, they failed. Instead, you'll get the taste of Special K for about 90% of the bowl, and a whole bunch of mini-chocolate bars at the end. If you think of it as a reward for finishing your cereal, then I guess you'll do all right.

First of all I have to say I love Uppababy products. I own both a Vista and G-luxe and I have rarely had issues with them. Most of the problems were from 3rd party participants and UppaBaby CS has always been helpful which is why I continue to purchase their accessories/products. HOWEVER, I purchased this for our G-Luxe and the material/workmanship is horrible. Within a week the rain cover tore around the holes where you snap it in to the stroller at the bottom. I ordered it Dec 10 2011 and to day it's torn around all areas that have a velcro snap and the plastic has come undone in several places from the fabric lining. To pay another $25 for a replacement cover that will likely tear again in 30 days is just not worth it!! I am not careless with the cover either, I would take it off and fold it up nicely when it was not in use and it still disintegrated with normal wear and tear. I am going to look for a cheaper replacement. Uppababy should really come up with a more sturdy rain cover. Maybe it fits the G-lite better but at least for my stroller it just didn't hold up.

Pamela's products have a long gluten free history and some are better than others like everything else. The reviews here run the gammut from great to disappointing. Too often I think people don't manage there expectations when they are buying a product where all the nutrional information is available. These bars are what they are, don't buy them if you want something vegan or low in sugar. Based on what's in the bar they're an ok, relatively healthy snack. My kids eat them if they're hungry but would likely reach for something less healthy given a choice. These aren't supermarket snack bars, I and they can deal with that. I bought this stroller with the car seat and have been using it with my now 15 month old son since his birth, so I figured I would chime in on some of my feedback on this stroller.

Pros:
- Comfortable seat, my son really likes it
- Pretty sturdey
- A good value for the price

Downsides:
- VERY heavy
- Not to be used for jogging, despite the three-wheel design
- Does not fold very compact at all. Putting in the trunk of a car often requires removal of front wheel (which is pretty easy)
- Not that durable. The seat folding bar snapped off on me at about the eight month mark and still I can't adjust the seat up or down without removing the fabric cover and manually adjusting it
- The basket sucks. If you put even something slightly heavy in it (like a sweatshirt), it will fall off the two small hooks on the side and land on the brakes, which engages them
-The sun shade could be bigger. I always feel like it's too far back or too far forward but there is no in between position

If you are looking at this stroller you are probably thinking, like we were, that we want something reasonably priced that will grow with our child and allow us to do occasional more rough and tumble strolles on unpaved areas. We also don't live in a city but a suburb so the walking isn't as necessary - we usually walk a few times a day on our street, probably a mile or two a day, occasionally more if we go places like a mall or the beach or something. ANd it works for that.

We are having a 2nd child now and are switching to a City Mini double stroller. It is much nicer than this one, but also costs almost $200 more - so it's up to your budget. This stroller gets the job done but like anything you get what you pay for.

For all this, the stroller has been OK. It has travelled with us several times (four flights) and been fine. It's just

After suffering with purchasing many suction bulbs (6) different types, I wasn't able suction the poor thing until I looked online and behold the solution to my boogy problem was here! With arm and hammer normal saline spray for children, I would spray into each of my babies nostril and suction away. It was clearly heaven sent. For the winter season I use it everyday and with putting the heat up comes dry air making it easy for bacteria to get the little ones sick a lot quicker. Since two month olds don't have many options to medication, I went homeopathically the first time and now this time, and to help my baby recover, I used humidification with a vapor inhalant throughout the night, keeping him hydrated, cuddling, and suctioning. Remember these little babies are nose breathers so keeping an open airway for their nares is important to in the process of recovery. FYI the reason my little one got sick is because my two year old coughed and sneezed in his face and mommy was too late to avoid it. My two year old also probably got sick because he's frequently putting his hand in his mouth no matter how many times I tell him not to. So with the use of this thing, all the above,  hand washing, hand sanitizer, and Clorox wipes, you will be on the road to recovery. As for my two year old I have used hylands cold tablets and it helped him to recover. Now my next journey is to get elderberry to build his immune system and vitamin c gummies. Hope this helps. Sincerely from an RN and fulltime mommy.

I ordered these as soon as our twin boys pulled up and started toddling. Even though they aren't tall enough to reach the door knobs, yet, I would rather not be surprised when they discover they CAN reach. The bonus confirmation came a couple of weeks later at the boys' birthday party. I saw a couple of our friends' 6-year-old children trying to get into our bedroom to search for \\"the missing cat\\". They tried several times to squeeze and turn the knob, but couldn't get it to work and finally gave up. Well worth the investment, and our cat was happy, too.

Seriously, this has been a superb product for us. We do live in a 1-year-old house with perfectly round doorknobs throughout. I don't think these would work as well on small or narrow door knobs or older, sticky doors.

UPDATE -- Knocking off one star... These worked great through early toddling, reaching, and grabbing. But before the boys were 3 they figured out how to pop them by either whamming the door into the wall (no doorstops on most of our interior doors) or whacking the cover with something. We've switched most of the doors to latches that hold them slightly open. I still think this is the best version of this product, and the best value for money.

It is very sturdy and cuter in person I didn't get a crib set just bought a crib sheet that had jungle animals of the same color scheme and it went very well together on the side of the crib. I just had to buy a hook to place on the crib so I could hang the diaper stacker
We throw two in her crib when we put her to bed.  And she smiles and waves every time she sees that little pink bear!
Love Love Love !!! Perfect for our pet and beautiful to look at. Easy for everyone to use including our 3 year old. Easy to put up and no issues so farðŸ˜„

I do like this pillow a lot but I wish I had gotten the more donut shaped breastfeeding pillow because in the long run its more versatile. My biggest complaint was the strap that comes round your back to snap you in, I found it useless most the time and just annoying to deal with when you have a hungry baby. I ended up just taking it off.

This is an easy way to create a salad that looks fancy. You boil the grains, add the dressing and cranberries, and the salad is done. My family really enjoyed this salad although it is a little sweet.

I will agree with the first poster, these are not the best Pistachios around but the chocolate coating and overall price per pound make this an amazing deal (I paid 17.21) and well worth it. The chocolate is not a cheap chocolate and the salt and sweet go well. Some pieces the pistachio is overpowered by the chocolate but on most I get both flavors. Very happy with it.
Very good product - K-Cups are our only choice now and this coffee is our only coffee.

We have several of Avent's 'regular' pacifiers at home, which my daughter likes and uses on a regular basis. When I purchased these, the glow-in-the-dark feature was not important to me, as I really didn't expect the glow to last for long (c'mon folks, it's glow-in-the-dark - the technology hasn't improved much since 1985...haha). As other reviewers have noted, the glow really does not last too long after the lights go out.

I'm sure most parents who use pacifiers for their babies would agree with me on this - we have pacifiers floating all over the house, but it seems whenever you want one, none can be found. For this reason, I did like the nighttime pattern on the pacifiers; it helps my husband and I to remember that those are the 'bedtime binkies' and when we find them around the house, to put them back into her bed, so we *always* have a pacifier for bedtime. Yes, the base of the pacifier is larger than Avent's 'regular' design, but I find that the larger base prevents the pacifiers from falling through the slats on my daughter's crib, which happens to the 'regular' design frequently. Perfect if she wakes in the night; she can find her binkie and replace it herself - which she does. I'm really pleased with these, as I have been with all Avent products I have purchased.

Our 7 1/2 month old grand baby likes this toy.  It moves and makes cute sounds.  Wish that it moved more on carpet but it will work on very low pile carpet and works excellently on wood or linoleum floors.
My wife uses this gum for dry mouth do to medication.  Nothing we have found works better.  She uses 100 pieces per day.

Great concept and product!  We ultimately returned this version and purchased the smaller Peapod since our main objective is to use this as a bed for our 17 month old while traveling internationally and space is a huge concern.  This was large enough for me to get into, not comfortably of course but more to encourage our LO to get into it.  I am 5' 4'' and 110 lbs for a size reference.  Our LO has always been an "easy" baby and adjusts to new situations well so she was comfortable in this from the get go.  I'm not sure how other children would take to it but I would assume that once they got used to the idea, they would consider it fun.  The pad seems a bit thin but she didn't seem to mind it.  The pad on the Plus a bit thicker than the smaller version.

Worked great for a coolant flush for a Mercedes, this is more of  Granules rather than a powder. If purchasing this to use as a coolant flush heat a gallon of water until small bubbles form on the bottom of the pan then pour in 1lbs of citric acid and it will readily dissolve with a few stirs. What a great value as well!

We purchased this item thinking it would be a great way to keep our 2 years from wanting to stay up late and get up early. The intructions are extremely difficult (and we are intelligent people).  We have had it for a few months and every time we think we figured it out, we wake up and it didn't work, or the alarm went off, or the am and pm have been mixed up.  The only way to get the lighted background to work was to flip the whole clock up-side-down and prop it up because we cannot seem to fix the am/pm situation (even when we tried to reverse the whole operation).  I'm now going to find another brand of the same type of clock.  Ugh!

Well done! I am so glad that I bought the large case, for I now have enough to share these wonderful wipes with my children's households! The 'How To Use' suggestion sheet is a winner which I copied to gift my son + daughter! With a lifelong awareness of personal skin issues, these wipes really fill a need. I adore the hOMe Cottage feel to this service and Well run business with attention to small details; esp,. Fine ingredients you could wipe a new Borns butt, nose or hands with! Thank you

This product works very similarly to the Soothies gel pads, but I prefer this brand because it can be rinsed off under running water, which is essential when you're leaking milk everywhere!  Soothies have a fabric backing, and are not recommended to be rinsed off.  Ameda gel pads were a soothing, cooling, healing lifesaver in the first difficult weeks while breastfeeding was being established.  They provided necessary relief to cracked, sore nipples.  Put them in the fridge while you nurse, and enjoy the cooling sensation when you replace them after the feeding session ends!  They will be an absolutely-must-have item for all subsequent pregnancies!

It doesn't work for crap! On the second or third use it somehow switched over its read to Celcius and I can't get it to switch back to Farenheit. My son had fever and it read normal every time I used it.

First this candy does not taste like rocky road. It taste like chocolate caramel.. The candy is way to expensive for so little. There is nothing special about this product to justify the price.

Absolutely just amazing. We recently took it on a trip to Seattle it was a life saver! It was crazy easy to attach to my graco4ever. It was able to stay attached thru the flight since I bag my car seat and check it plane side. It was a lot more stable than i thought it would be. The wheels did angle in a little not much (just stopped once) just paused and tap the wheels wide with my foot and we were off again !
if fat is where its at then this is great as a small snack??? the jerky is a great filler & you do not have to eat half of the bag. a few pieces will do just great, in fact I'm eating some now ?????

My baby is now 18+ months and I've been using these scissor to get her nails since she was only a few months old. I have never ever tried the baby nail cutters that are available (was given a pair, but it looked quite scary to use). These scissors weren't intimidating at all to hold or use. So far, I've found them very easy to use; no mishaps (yet). I find cutting the nails the most easy after giving my baby a bath (this is true for adults too) as the nails are nice and soft, therefore cutting away very easily.

There's a slight curve to these scissors - useful for placing the flat part at the finger tips and allowing for a single continuous cut across the nail. The ends of the scissors are rounded, a good safety feature, especially when my little one starts to squirm around. The cover/sheath is nice to have to cover the scissors when not in use, but also as a nice distraction for the little one when I take the scissors out to cut nails.

Lastly, the scissors seem to remain sharp despite my regular use. Wonderful!

Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase and would highly recommend everyone to give these a try.

Product perfect, like to eat them out of the bag.  Might want to be carefull, the shelf life of white chocolate is shorter and the box I got is supposed to expire june 2009, so about 4 months from purchase and 12 bags is alot.
Horrible. Not at all what I expected and did not work. Such a pain to use and clean and definitely not worth it. Don't waste your money

The color is true to the picture. So thrilled it was on time and already assembled! The seat is pretty firm so I think it will last a long time. The back cushion is soft and comfy. The swivel and gliding is smooth. The arm rests are at the right height for nursing. The seat is very roomy so I will put some throw pillows for my lower back and maybe on the sides for a more snug seat. I just received it so don't know about durability, but it feels very solid.

This sound machine is AWESOME.  I would gladly pay much more.  Our baby loves the white noise, it stays on all night, and it's plenty loud.  My wife and I hear it through the monitor and we're both sleeping much better as well.  Very very very great product!
I LOVE this guacamole mix! Simple to make and tastes exactly like guacamole should taste. You will not be disappointed.

This is advertised as a stroller toy but it's HUGE. I put it on my son's stroller and it was basically sitting on his face. I gave the 3 stars because it's still a neat product, makes noises and is engaging to my son, but I have to hold it up to his face. Maybe when he gets a little older, it'll be good to play with.

This set is very cute, my son really likes it.  However, he will not sleep with the comforter because it is two "scratchy".  Even the sheets & pillow case is not very soft.  It's a shame that the quality is not that great.  If you child is used to soft blankets & sheets find something better than this.

Super soft and cozy. Baby loves it. We have been using it for night and naps since 5 months old. My only complaint is that he chews on it and it holds onto the smell. It is really hard to get out. I have to soak it in vinegar overnight and wash it twice to get it out.
ARRIVED WITHOUT LEAVES, NOW CAUDEX IS SOFT AND MUSHY, AND PLANT IS DEAD. NOT HAPPY WITH THIS SELLER'S PRODUCT.

Used this to replace a normal trash can, this smells worse and the smell has gotten stuck to the inside so it smells even when empty.  Horrible product, whole nursery smells horrible still, waste of money.

When my baby was born this was the first toy I introduced to him. When he was about 3 months old he started to really love his \\"Marty\\" (We nicknamed it.) Now at 5 months, it's his buddy. He carries it around when we go from one room to another. Marty's jingly bells, and squeaker helped distract him during his 4 month vaccinations. Marty keeps him entertained in the car, and he loves chewing on Martys ears, and rings. I think that this is going to be his buddy for a long time. I think I might get the peacock too, just to see how he likes that one since he loves this one so much.

I was curious about this Jam as I can't find anything like it in my area...An ordinary  jar usually lasts me at least 6 months--this one is almost gone--it's that good....!!!! (and it hasn't even been a month\\")

Until you discontinued Better Cheddars about 3 1/2 years ago, it was the best
snack cracker on the market. The Better Cheddar crackers just released do not

The biggest change I have detected is the sour dough has been omitted. Also,

I paid for 12 ounces when you discontinued them. I will not buy anymore as

I got this from Influenster in my mom voxbox,  it was very soft and tasty my husband said, as he was the one who ate it lol!
Do not order if you are expecting Members Mark coffee , you will receive Daily Chef coffee the same coffee you can get at Sam's Club for a lot less. Also the taste is not even close to the same.
It really should be made clear in the listing that it is only for one toy. I purchased thinking it was a set of 3. I shouldn't gave to read reviews to find this information.
handy wth churro taste in a bag you can take any where and any time.  stays fresh and yummy.  easy open

This was the easiest baby accessory I ever installed. It came packaged flat and compact. All you have to do is unfold and figure out that the rubberized ends below the table top grips wind up and down - BINGO.

We have a wooden French kitchen style dining table - unfortunately it would not fit around the majority of the table, so beware: If you have a lip like mine that is fairly thick (not the distance from the table edge to the lip but that the lip block itself is thick +3.5cm) then it won't fit in that little U-shaped space properly. Also it says on the package that if your lip is more than 3.5cm away from the edge it won't fit either - at least not safely. Luckily enough our table has two curved ends where there is no lip at all and it fit just perfectly there.

I bought the beige (Fiordilatte) because I did not want a super bright color - my baby's toys and such are taking over the decor anyway. I was a little concerned it may be a little too light but so far it is great - not too light to show all the stains and not too dark to be frumpy. The cover comes off anyway and can be machine washed - it wipes easily too.

It has two little slot clips on the arms (on the aluframe just under the textile before the table top grips) so you can 'easily' clip the chair on and off without unscrewing - that system makes no sense since it is much easier to un-clamp/-screw and leave the grips on the chair, than to un-clip (putting it back in was a major exercise in finger strength pushing those little clips back in). I just have it as a permanent installment though so I don't care much for taking it on and off unless we have a big party around for dinner.

My baby is only 5 months old and just only figured out how to sit up. He was sitting in this thing was before he learned to hold himself upright. This is because it is just the right size and padded really nicely both on the backrest as well as the cover for the clips in the front. Thecanvas base/bottom seems flimsy at first you think 'will it hold?' but in actuality it is great because it is thickly padded and gives way just enough to feel soft, yet pretty sturdy. The belt is secure and easy to use (I love the padded covering so it is more comfortable when the little one leans forward to eat), though for now our little guy seems secure in the seat without them; but that may be just because he doesn't know to try and climb out yet.

It is so small and compact, and blends in so well, it is entirely unobtrusive. I do think however that if he grows a lot more he won't fit any more - it seems like it won't work for the 15mth-olds I know. However, since we will likely have him sit in a proper chair with an addition with belt or such when he is too big for this, rather than a separate high chair, this is a great little piece of equipment that does not take up any space and has him sitting at the table with us at dinner playing around without much of a fuss at all. Golden!

UPDATE: My little man is now 22 months old and still uses this - so I guess I was wrong and this may be the only high chair we ever have to buy since it goes up to 35lbs and he is just under 30lbs now. One tip - we now have a food mat under the grips (not recommended for safety but never impacted the grip on our table).

This is hard.  First loaf I put in my machine, destroyed the machine and burned out the motor.  I finished the loaf in the manual/oven and it was acceptable.  With 11 more boxes, I now have to break out a new machine, and hope it doesn't get trashed too.  We'll see.
This is a great diaper cover! Good quality, easy to clean or wipe down, I like the extra layer of velcro to keep leaks in, and easy to put on & off.
Sturdy and works well for our two new lab puppies.  We have two of them -- one for each dog.
this product was exactly as described. It had a variety of candy in various sizes.  Very satisfactory!

ITEM WAS SENT IN A PAPER PLASTIC BAG INSTEAD OF A CARBORARD BOX AS BY OTHER VENDORS, ITEMS WERE OILY, THE PACKETS HAD TO BE WASHED OFF. THIS IS MY THIRD ORDER AND FIRST TIME I HAVE BEEN REALLY DISAPPOINTED SO

He does enjoy chewing on them, since they're right at mouth height, but they seem to be holding up pretty well despite this.  Overall, the small size is mostly made up for by the lower price.

My baby enjoys this food from Gerber . . . Thanks to Gerber . . . I prefer fruit mix oatmeal cereal to plain oatmeal cereal . . .

We won't be buying any more Dave's bread and I'm taking the loaves I have back to the store
Excellent! What you see is what you get. Servings were smaller than I'm use to, but I just ate two.

I agree with those saying the coffee is a bit weak.  Def not a dark roast.  Very smooth though, but for those who are use to and enjoy a more traditional espresso brew, you will probably be disappointed. I have brewed it as an espresso, cappuccino and through my aeropress. The aeropress was the only acceptable brew making a regular american coffee.

This came stale, beat up, and broken. It's obvious that this candy was very old. I have to wonder what the health codes are on that. This seller is way to expensive to expect anything other that the highest quality product from them, but what I received was something that I wouldn't even buy from a second rate seller if I had foreknowledge of the bad quality.
I bought these for my daughter when she was teething and she would bite chucks off!! All babies are different, these just did not work for my daughter.

I happen to suffer from migraines but love my tea, so breaking the chai habit was hard when I started to get sick.  As you may or may not know, not all 'decaf' products are 100 percent decaffinated, which can be a problem for those like myself who can't have it and the percentage of caffine is high for a 'decaf' product.  This chai, while not only tasting great, has never given me problems while most other 'decaf' varieties do.  Great in the morning to get warmed up and get going, but also great for night time as there is no caffine to keep you up.

I've used this product for 2-3 years, tried others, and this is the best of them. It is 10% truffle, is small grained, easy to sprinkle, and the taste is not only wonderful, it remains infused in the salt til the last pinch is gone.  Try it on softly scrambled eggs - I put mine in a fresh, warm flour tortilla - and you will never wonder again what to have for lunch. Then you will discover how it lifts a dish from pedestrian to exceptional.  Creamed soups of all types, simple non-tomato sauced pastas, baked chicken, fish, can all be raised to the next level.  Just don't succumb to using it on everything!  You'll be tempted.
Excellent quality, well thought out safety trap door, so it doesn't slam shut on child.

My wife's father, who retired a few years ago, was a potato farmer. He knows a thing or two about potatoes. When he was operating the farm, he sold most of his potatoes to Frito-Lay where they ended up as Lay's Potato Chips. He would always \\"test\\" the new crop of potatoes by making his own potato chips. He'd use a mandoline slicer to create nice thick slices of potato and then would deep fry them. A couple minutes later there would be these awesome, thick sliced, perfectly cooked chips which then got a sprinkling of salt. Best chips I've ever had.

Sorry for that long story, but these Gradma Utz Handcooked Potato Chips taste just like the chips my Father in law makes. They are awesome. They hold up to thick dips without cracking and breaking like some other well known \\"thin\\" chips do. I don't think chips could be much better than these.
For me, these tasted terrible.  The kale chips are so dry, they turn to powder in my mouth. And the ranch flavor does very little to help the over powering kale flavor.
We love how our nursery turned out with this set along with the wall border from the Eddie Bauer \\"Believing in Dreams\\" pattern. I love the quality of the fabric and the pattern is beautiful.

This tea smells and tastes like tea that has a lemon slice put into it. The pyramidal design lets the leaves expand and float freely inside the bag, allowing for more of the tea flavor to diffuse. The downside is that the bag is made of nylon or some kind of plastic mesh, making it non-biodegradable. The pyramids are also just boxed together, not individually sealed for freshness.

The black tea taste does seem weaker than the traditional flat Lipton tea bags. Maybe I've had the box open for too long (but it's well before the Best Before date of 10/24/11), or it's being masked by the lemon juice concentrate and marigold petals. For iced tea (with honey), however, I can't really complain about the taste. If you don't have real lemons around, this is a good alternative.

Curiously, modified corn starch is listed as an ingredient. I don't know what this additive does for tea and it's the first tea product I've seen it in.

One bag 110mg of flavonoid antioxidants and 55mg of caffeine.
I love this base! It's easy to use and works with both the latch and the lap seat belt modes. It's sturdy and looks good.

I have eaten these regularly for years, even though they are on the dry side. I can get them at my grocery on a regular basis, so I stopped ordering them by mail. I have also found another brand of cookies I prefer, made by Udis.

This review is for the Red Edition (cranberry). No funny aftertaste! I just had a nice, frosty can of this and chugged it down in about 2 minutes (hey, I was thirsty). I started to get the same caffeine buzz I get when I have a 7 oz cup of coffee (and the caffeine's about the same = 80 mg). My preference is for sugar free beverages of this type because some of the \\"sugar\\" ones are so sweet they hurt my stomach. Red Bull doesn't go overboard with the sweetness here. Yes, it is sweet, but not to the extreme end of some other beverages. The tanginess of the cranberry flavor was my favorite part.

5 out of 5 stars for a product doing exactly what it says. Your taste buds may vary.

Disclaimer: I received a free sample of Red Bull Red Edition (cranberry) for testing purposes.
Very delicious and healthy. because it's loaded with yummy stuff.  Careful, there is a lot of calories in it than you would think.

These are really tasty! When you open the box and get ready to pop a bag you will be pleased. The bags pop in a fun way. Once they are popped you open them from the side to create a neat little bowel. I'd order more for sure!!!

This is a great option for keeping bottles clean while traveling.  I am able to fit 2 of the Dr. Brown's standard bottles along with all of my breast pump components (flanges, valves, bottles, etc.) on the drying rack.  I use this along with the Medela Quick Clean Micro-Steam Bags when traveling to keep all of my breastfeeding supplies clean and sanitized.
Great little set of rattles, teethers, etc.  I bought it for a new nephew and think he'll use this stuff as he continues to grow.  Great shopping experience.

This thing is amazing. Non-permanent, non-damaging, and the bane of every toddler. Other locks are left within reach of the child, but you can put this one at your head level. You can take them anywhere with you - we take ours on vacations to keep the munchkin out of dangerous rooms. If you're OCD about your doors being closed completely every time, be warned, they'll all be just slightly ajar, but you forget about it after a while.

Highly recommended.
The reason I purchase this was the \\"SPLENDA\\", which I have been looking for. We enjoy them and will certainly purchase them again.
Tasted like it was laying in the warehouse for a year.  No date on bag

This monitor is great!  It really offers peace of mind being able to see my daughter so clearly that I can see her breathing.  I absolutely recommend this to anyone.  We will probably use it well into her toddler years.

I was extremely disappointed in this soup.  The box had the word \\"noodles\\" on it more than actual noodles inside.  Amazon was great to deal with.  I could not, however, find out how to contact the manufacturer to give them feedback.  Chicken fat water is not my idea of a good boxed soup.  Yuck!!

Having lived in Spain for almost six years, I know the importance of Saffron being kept in a glass jar. Having depleted the supply I'd brought back with me; I decided this product would be a suitable replacement. The moment I opened the shipping box, I could smell the Saffron! I knew I had something spectacular, but held off using it till I cooked a dish of Paella for a group of friends. The spice did just I felt it would, and more, imparting the lovely golden tint I love, and giving my dish a smokey taste. The mortar and pestle were perfectly sized, and I showed one friend how to use it; she was amazed! My friends had never had anything with fresh Saffron in it before, and were blown away by how wonderful it was. I will be ordering this again!

I think that the product is great. It serves its purpose. However the company I bought if from was terrible. They never notified me when it was lost. It took 2 extra weeks to get to my home. I was communicating with an unknown source and that unknown source refused to tell me what part of the company she worked with and refused to give me a telephone number to the company so I could be sure that she actually worked with them, even though she was asking me to give out personal information about myself.
