They have good grip but i was looking for something for my 3 year old that was deeper that can hold more food. These are going to be his play toys now. What a waste!

This is the perfect first baby doll for any little girl, or boy.  My new granddaughter loves it.  She was four months old at Christmas this year and this doll is just right for her now.  I know from past family experience with the First Years Eden dolls, that it will continue to be a favorite for years to come.  They are a very high quality product and worth the price.  It is soft, cushiony and has very well stitched seams all over.  With the past boy dolls our family has had, I know that it stands up to many years of machine washing and drying also.  The only part on this particular doll I'm not sure of yet because this style is new, is whether the bow, little satin neck trim and hair will be as resilient in the years to come.  I have high hopes that it will and have purchased them in the past and will again anytime a baby gift is needed.

These brushes are the best I've tried so far, particularly the nipple-cleaning brush, as it reaches all the way.  I tried every kind made, it seems, and these do the best job.  The foam hasn't torn or anything yet either.

I absolutely love my Baby Bjorn! It was my husbands idea to list this on our baby registry, and I'm so glad he did! It makes doing everyday tasks so much easier! Your hands are free and yet you are right there to interact with your baby instead of letting him/her just sit in a carrier or bouncer. Great for multi-tasking moms and dads!

I like the product. The ones I got straight from the UT were badly melted and stuck together so bad that I couldnt' get them separeted. The ones that came in a box from McVites here in the States were just fine. They work well, although they give me a bit of gas. However, I do like the effect and it does help digestgion.
These little candies are sweet and chewy, but there is a little ZIP in each one.  They are the perfect pick me up.  You are certain to become hooked after chewing just two.

These flanges helped me be able to pump more breastmilk. Better fit than the default ones that come with the pump. Not a great deal more, production wise, but enough to provide for the baby daily when I had to go back to work.

FANTASTIC!!!! Absolutely WONDERFUL quality for an even better price. This is by far the best coconut oil I have ever bought, and I have been buying it for years (way before it was "a thing"). Just excellent quality, very good clean taste, easy to access, overall an excellent buy that I plan on making again after this batch runs out!

Though I generally review entertainment products on Amazon I do occasionally review food products and after returned from the Fancy Food Show in New York , this product was sent to me by the manufacturer for an objective review.

This was one of a number of products from the Back To the Roots brand. As they say on their label, they like to keep it simple. I was really impressed. The flavor I got \\"Blueberries, Almonds & Buckwheat\\" is not on Amazon currently but I hope you'll have an idea of what to expect by my posting this review of that flavor. The FULL ingredients list for this product - at least the flavor I got) is simply: Organic Buckwheat seeds, Organic Almonds, Organic Blueberries (freeze-dried). That's it! Nothing artificial or even the words \\"natural flavor).

The product can be used a number of ways and I tried a few. I added some to the wonderful Stoneground flakes cereal that BTTR makes (see my review on Amazon) and they don't add a lot of calories and you get 3g of fiber per portion. The cereal itself gives you 5g of fiber. So together you get 8g of fiber and only 240 calories at most.

I also added to plain nonfat yogurt to make a tasty- health snack. There are 80 calories and 2g of \\"healthy\\" fat in one 3 tbsp. serving and the container has 8 servings (but I didn't need 3 tbsp for the yogurt - or, frankly, for the cereal.

I had never heard of BTTR but- based on these two products, I like their philosophy as well as the products and I'm glad I found them.

I hope you found this review both informative and helpful.

Steve Ramm

This specific sunflower oil is really good. It is a bit of similarity with olive oil, as it smells and tastes, that is unusual, and it is wonderful with boiled potatoes (add green onions and dill weed), Mediterranean-style  salads, or for frying.

Let me say this first:  our family of 6 keeps a high protein, low carb diet, and we eat a lot of jerky each month ( avg 30 lbs).   We have tried a vast majority of jerky out there, and can tell a good jerky from bad.  I have no idea how can anyone leave this jerky a positive, not to mention gleaming review.   Must be the first time trying jerky.  FIRST:  there is NOTHING natural about this jerky.  Few noticed, but their packaging used to say \\"all natural\\", but NO MORE, because they know it is not.  Now it says \\" naturally hickory smoked\\", or the like.   WHO CARES.   your jerky has so much cr_p in it that naturally smoking it makes no difference.  This jerky is full of salt.  this jerky is packed with MSG - and i mean PACKED!!!  This jerky is quite greasy. NOTE:  Bulk packaging ( 1 lb bags) are a bit better than smaller bags, and meat type in bulk bags is different.  YES< this company has absolutely zero consistency.  If you take 20 chunks out of a bulk bag, you will see that there are 4-5 different kinds of meats there.  some wil be moist and chewy, others will be nothing but rubber, some with thick tendons running through, and some are quite marbled.  Just when you find a piece to your liking - you are back searching for a lucky chunk again.  smaller bags, especially teriyaki is very greasy and has so much coating that you taste all the chemicals way before you get to meat flavor ( if you can call it that).     i'd give this jerky a 2 if there was meat consistency, but its a total crap shoot.   you can find LOTS of other - better tasting jerky in the same price range, here on amazon.   even the middle of the road obertos is much better than this stuff.  WILD RIDE JERKY IS A JOKE and IS GROSS.  Buy at your own risk, but know that you are buying a truly chemically processed and preserved jerky - full of MSG and 0ther additives.     OH, and those 1 lb cowboy stips bags?  Well,  there was exactly 10 oz of strips in a bag - rest was jerky shavings and bitsNpieces - similar to what oberto sells as bulk packages salad topper shavings of jerky - NO STRIPS!!!  we tried every flavor in their bulk=-packaged variety and this holds true for every single package.

THESE ARE SO HARD TO FIND, THEY AREN'T DOUR AT ALL, JUST THE RIGHT OF TANG. NOTHING LIKE THOSE SOUR WORMS THAT I CAN'T EAT. PACKED VERY GOOD & CAME QUICK, YES I WOULD GET AGAIN & RECOMMEND THEM/  I ALSO GOT THE BUBBLE GUM. REMINDED ME OF BAZZOOKA  GUM, I REMEMBER GROWING THEY WERE FIVE CENTS A PIECE.. IT'S SO GOOD
Great product my wife loves crazy cups wonderful assortment a must have if your crazy about coffee I encourage you to buy this product you won't be disappointed .

I have many kawaii baby diapers and I love this print and got it as soon as I saw it was available. The new liner is so much softer and wicks away moisture very quickly, I am so happy with this new design! I recommend it highly versus the older kawaii baby diapers.

These pack well, are easy to clean, and the kids like them.  We have a different brand that has suction cups, which is nice for the phase when the kid wants to pick it up and toss it on the floor, but other that that these are better due to cost and packability.

When I saw these at our local Target store I had to buy one. I purchased the stage 2 for my son who at that time was drinking from another bottle that supposedly had the same amount of flow. My 17 month old daughter has had her giraffe set since birth and she still loves them! One for the back pack, one for the crib and one in the wash! We give these sets as gifts to all of our friends with new babies!
Don't expect to walk away from the table with a full belly. This is a fun and novel product, but too expensive to use on a daily basis, it is more of a treat and makes an amusing gift.

Our 3 year old is starting pre-school and wanted a backpack like her older sister.  This one is the perfect size for her.  Just big enough to carry some books and doo-dads to class without pulling her over backwards or seeing her get swallowed by the straps. Btw, this seems to be mostly a Toy Story 1 themed backpack, none of the bigger characters for 2 or 3 are represented and the Buzz on the back isn't one of those shifty 3D images, it just flat and static.  Some of the Toy Story 3 backpacks have Buzz on the back like that so I thought I'd mention it.
THESE TASTE SOOOO GOOD. alittle less chewy than a starburst candy, flavoring is like a mix of coconut water and melon juice DEFINITELY recommended. Arrived in three weeks

These are the best breath mints I've found.  I like them because they don't leave a weird aftertaste like Altoids do for me.  At first I was a little worried the xylitol would not work for me because I have gut issues and sugar alcohols are not recommended for people with SIBO and IBS.  The small amount of xylitol in these mints does not cause me any digestive problems, however.  So happy to have found a mint that freshens your mouth and does not leave a bad aftertaste from the use of sugar!

This mobile attaches pretty well to our Graco car seat. I like that it has a lot of adjustment points. He's strong enough now that he just pulls it to him and plays with it. Love this.  Much cuter than ones I've seen in the stores.  A little too big at first for her, but she is almost 5 months now and has plenty of room still to wear it.  Soft and comfortable.
Don't let the age indicator guide you.  This size is perfect for 18+ month olds. My 3 year old granddaughter loves these.  I keep a couple at my house 'just in case'.

this make it very easy to buy baby food, the local mega mart doesnt have much of a organic selection.  and the baby loves it!

We just got the joovy playpen (black)  i read the comments about the smell but still we went ahead and bought it becuase of the size, we have a big baby 30 inches tall @ 6months :-) I tried airing it out for 2 days but the whole house smelled like a barn:( I was nauseous from the smell let alone put my baby in it!! Love this product. With my first child I used a cheaper, inferior pram caddy product - my coffee spilt every time in the small cup holders because the straps holding it to the pram were flimsy and the caddy swung and moved with the pram. With the arrival of baby number 2, I have been looking for something more substantial and the StarPack Stroller Mate is perfect.

I love how sturdy it it when it attaches to the pram. And I am yet to spill a drink.

The amount of storage is amazing - plenty of room for two drinks, wallet, keys, phone, snacks and nappies.

The detachable purse is really handy too. Often I've found myself wheeling the whole pram around the playground to keep my valuables close-by, but the detachable purse means I can just zip off the section with my money, keys and phone.

I have recommended this product to the mums in my mothers group, and it would also make a great present for mums because of its flexible design (meaning it can attach to almost any type of pram without being on an angle).

Overall, it is a great design and has been manufactured to a high standard (much much higher than my old one) and is great value for money.
Thanks again!

I have been using the blanched almond flour from Honeyville, but what I don't like about that brand is that it feels more grainy and granular when used â€“ it just isn't finely ground enough to pass as a flour in recipes. So I was absolutely delighted when this brand sent me a bag of their almond flour to test, and I opened it up to find that it has a much finer texture than Honeyville. It really feels fluffy and light, like a real flour, unlike almost every brand I've tried in the past. Having a blanched flour in a fine grain like this is a godsend when making paleo pancakes, cookies, and coatings over baked chicken. I will absolutely continue to purchase this brand now that I've discovered it. It also has a particularly fresh flavor in comparison to other brands I've purchased. It has that wonderful nutty fresh almond flavor, and I'm even considering trying to make marzipan or something with it, because I'm inspired by the flavor.
I like it, but I wish it had latch hooks so that when it's not in use it won't become a projectile should we ever have an accident.
Just used this for the first time and was pleasantly surprised at the light but moist and well formed results!

Perfect attachment for my mountain buggy pram which lacks nooks and crannies for stashing your things. Holds my morning coffee with sturdy Velcro straps, pockets for keys, wallets, phone, even for nappy wallet and wipes. Love it :)

We started with Avent bottle such a waste of time and money.Our baby had such a hard time with colic, but once we switched to the Dr. Browns it was almost night and day. It was just funny because the bottles were about the same size a she was.
very strong smoke taste - little goes a long way. Like it in chilli and on pork chops.
They have a hole in the nipple that results in baby swallowing a ton of air.  Not sure why it was designed that way but i am definitely not using this product.  I would not recommend it.

I absolutely love this bag! I have it in the pewter which looks much nicer than the black and goes with anything. It's held up very nicely over the past year. There have been no problems with it at all, no tears, snags, or anything of sorts. It looks good and no one would ever think that it's a diaper bag. I've gotten compliments before from younger girls in their 20's who like this style. When I tell them it's a diaper bag they immediately ask the brand and say they'll keep it in mind for later :)

When I first had my baby, I got the Charlie II bag and back then being a first time mom who carried a pump and everything else daily, the bag was good and served the purpose but it wasn't very good looking and parts started falling apart very quickly.

When my daughter got a little older and I didn't need to carry so much stuff - plus I had gotten a handle on being a mom - I switched to this bag. It's perfect for when you're out of the newborn stage and need to carry less. Plus the ability to wear it around you frees up your hands which we all know is a must once your little once becomes mobile.

I'm still using it now and my daughter is 2. It's perfect if I just want to put a diaper in the bag with some wipes and a cream. Plus I've always loved having a purse with many compartments so I can keep things organized so it works perfectly as a regular bag.

In fact, you really don't need to have a baby to use this bag :)
Good pricing, nice that it comes in a jar. The corned beef I made with a little of it was exceptionally good, much better than that at the supermarket.
This along with the mutli-function caterpillar are great additions for our baby's toy closet.  She loves this and the other equally.
I bought this for a girlfriend who just had her 2nd.  Not sure if she's used it yet, but I really like it.  Definitely usable!  Wish they had these when my two were little!

I love it! I bought these for my son's daycare to put his soiled clothes and sheets in. They were always sending it hom ein a plastic bag. They are small. Think a little smaller than the size of a cloth shoe bag. It'll comfortably fit his toddler sheets or one set of clothes.  They'd be perfect too for cloth pads when you are traveling.

gritty with a sour sweet taste and turns to powder instead of melting in your mouth.  Ingredients are powdered milk and oil, does not contain cocoa butter.  Go with guittard choc au lait chips, they are smooth and rich and contain cocoa butter.

VERY SATISFIED ,Delivery was on time ,and my Daughter loves  her Michael Kors baby bag .Thank you .

When I was searching for a mobile for my twins, this one had everything I was looking for, and they loved it!  We used it every night and at naptime. The nighttime light show is great, and for the parents the remote control is very handy for \\"repeats\\" without going all the way into the room.  The crickets tune seemed to really soothe my kids.  They also liked the different little creatures, especially the butterfly with crinkly wings.  We used this mobile until my son started pulling himself up in the crib. Love this ! It has sturdy attachment straps both upper and lower and is very well made .
Have to say I like the Blood Orange better, but that's not to say the Cherry is not good. I also like the Honey. Wonderful to find a good, flavorful candy with no chemicals or dyes.

I ordered this bassinet for a relative's baby shower; happy to say she loved the bassinet. We were all suprised at how well made it was, and that it had all the little extra's like the music module, night light and a storage mesh. It was easy to assemble out of the box and appeared to have cost way more than I paid for it. C. Hannon

I really like this popcorn, so I gave it 5 stars.

However, the product Amazon is shipping is only a few months away from the \\"Best By\\" date code. In fact, it's the same date code as the box sold from Amazon Warehouse Deals, and that sells for nine dollars less. I should have gone with that, instead.

Now I understand date codes are usually just a suggestion and the product is still good for a reasonable time after that date, but it does provide a pretty good indication of when the product was \\"made\\" and packed. I feel like Amazon should be shipping fresher product for this premium price over their own Warehouse Deals - which seems to come from the same crate in their warehouse.

Crunchy & tasty.  It's a granola bar, not an fancy widget... not much to say other than they are:   - tasty  - there's lots of crunch  - variety pack gives you 3 delicious flavors.    It's a nice snack to tide you over until the next meal.  Try dipping them in vanilla yogurt as you eat 'em for a delicious change.  Or try eating the Peanut Butter granola bars with carrot sticks and/or celery sticks.
This has worked out really well for us.  The little light is clutch!  We wait until our son falls asleep after feeding, then clip a few nails at a time.

I know some have bashed the price on this, but I think it's a great deal. Ranch packets at the store generally cost over $1 per packet and unless you divide up the contents, its harder to control how much based on the amount of ranch dressing or dip needed.
I make all my own ranch dressings since pretty much every kind in the grocery store aisle is loaded w/ vegetable oils and sugar/corn syrup. I make 1-1.5 cups of mayo w/ egg yolks and olive oil, then add a 2-3Tb of this stuff and another 1-1.5 cups of milk and we have enough ranch dressing for the week.
Great in smoothies for protein boost! No added flavor. Not sure why container is twice as big and same amount as gelatin.

I have 2 of these racks. They work great for Dr. Brown bottles. The straw holders hold the blue air valve of the Dr. Brown bottles perfect. The only reason why I did not give 5 stars is because I felt the need to drill holes to allow the water to drain. I know in the description of the rack, they state they made it without holes so the counter would not get wet, but I'd rather the water drain out than build up in the base of the rack. I hang mine over the edge of the sink so the water drains into sink.
I have had these chips before.  I love super hot foods, and this is probably number on on the richter scale.
Good knee pads. A little tight on the thighs but they do what they're supposed to do, protect the knees.

I bought this because it was an amazon
Best Buy but it works way better than we expected and the price is great

It is a very healthy cereal with 7g of fiber per cup! I eat 2C at breakfast and I am full until lunch time. And depending on how much and what kind of milk you use it comes to 240 cal per 1C. It is shipped to us and costs half the price that we would pay at our health food store. Try some you'll love it!!
A decent cheap, standard granola. It didn't amaze me, but it didn't cost much either. I enjoyed eating it with full fat yogurt (and sometimes blackberries).

French Crystal Creams   I used to look forward to French creams every Christmas. Nothing compares now, except those I ordered from Amazon.  They were crystal sugar crackly on the outside and creamy on the inside.  I enjoyed the treat.  Just like old times!
I sent this to a close friend and she and her mother were well satisfied with the taste and quality of the variety of the goodies received. They absolutely loved it. She said all of it was fantastic.

I absolutely love these inserts. They're thin and very absorbent. We use Fuzzibunz one size diapers (before their 2014 remodeling). They fit in the diaper great. When our baby was around 14 months she became a heavy wetter, and we kept having problems with leaking with the microfiber inserts. We use one of these inserts with one of the fuzzibunz microfiber inserts. Compression leaks (from sitting in the car seat, high chair, etc. for extended periods of time) are gone. Our daughter can easily wear a diaper for up to 5 hours at a time. I just wash them (after the initial prepping) along with my cloth diapers and hang dry. We use Rockin Green Detergent. We've been using them for a couple months now. Still work great and look great. We will be ordering more.

I think that Beech-Nut Organic Stage 2 Purees - Just Apple, Raspberry & Avocado are great! The color and its amazingly smooth but not runny texture had my baby eating every drop. With it only being pure fruits and veggies with no additives or preservatives I have no problem feeding it to my baby. I also give it a try myself before I feed it to my baby, I can tell 80% of the time if shes going to like it or not. The taste was pretty good, better than most baby foods that I've tried. It also made me feel like a great mom while feeding it to my baby. I've never known a brand so pure and healthy! Best of all I received free by being a bzzagent! I will continually buy this brand from here on out! #GotASample

it fits. cheaper than store's. get it. save money! i think u even get a pair more than the brand's package at the store.

I love this pump.  I spent a long time trying to decide between this and the Medela Freestyle, and eventually chose this one.  I based that on the reviews I read, as it seemed this one had less people saying it didn't work for them, and since you can't return it, it seemed less risky.   I have not actually used the Freestyle, so can't truly compare, but I LOVE this pump and am 100% happy with my purchase.    The 2 best features of this pump are the memory setting and the power of the motor.  When my daughter was first born, bf'ing was EXTREMELY painful for me.  \\"Sore\\" was putting it mildly... as I told my mother I found it infinitely more painful than labor (which in all honestly I did not think was that bad - and I had no drugs).  Given the issues I was experiencing on one side in particular, I ended up only feeding her on one side exclusively while I pumped the \\"bad\\" side for about a week.  Being able to control the strength and rythem of the pump, to minimize pain, was CRUCIAL for me.   Having this pump allowed me to maintain my supply and I am now still going strong 6 months later.    The power of this pump is great.  I also own an Avent Isis Uno (single) pump which I use at home in the morning and there is NO comparison in terms of power.  I can only use the Uno in the morning when I'm completely full, otherwise I get almost nothing.   The duo , on the other hand, is actually more effective than my daughter feeding directly, and has kept my supply up great.  My daughter ate a lot from 3-6 months before she started with solids ... with this pump I was able to pump over 16oz in only 2 sessions at work, each session taking less than 10 minutes.   Before you have a baby, I know this number means nothing, but trust me this is a lot of milk to pump in such a short time.    My only real complaint with this pump WAS that you cannot get spare replacement parts, which is really useful to have at work so you dont have to wash them between sessions (i.e. you can just throwthem all in a bag and bring them home to clean at night), but I called the manufacturer today and you actually CAN order spare parts right off the website now, so that is great!!     One thing I will say that this motor is very heavy.  If you plan to carry the pump back and forth to work every day, I think it's very heavy for that.  This hasn't been a problem for me though since I brought it to work once 3 months ago and have left it there since.      So in summary -- if you are going to bring it to work and leave it there, or use it regularly at home and don't need to carry it around much, you cannot go wrong with this pump.      Extremely comfortable & powerful. However, if you can't handle high power, you can make it as light as you want with the memory feature.  Highly recommended!!
Shipment was extremely fast!! Bag was great, lots of pockets and spacious. It will be perfect for my expecting sister. Satisfied customer!
Oh man! I am a diabetic and this is like a gift from above. They taste just like the sugar kind-crunchy and peanut butter-y. Amazing!

As someone who has trashed 3 diaper bags, this one being washable and well made makes it worth the price! My ONLY warning on this bag is that if you have a newborn or more than 1 in diapers, it may not be big enough.  At least it wouldn't have been for me.  I have 1 in diapers and 1 that only needs a sippy cup and a few toys.  I am so happy I found Ju Ju Be bags!  I can fit diapers, wipes, diaper cream, a few small toys, 2 board books, a few snacks, 2 sippy cups, a rubber roll up bib, my keys and phone and a water bottle for me if I don't zip it.  The fuchia blossoms is so pretty and I love that this is washable!  My last diaper bag bit the dust after an apple went bad in it so this is a huge plus for me!  Great features... the organization is outstanding and the pattern and hardware is really great looking.  wearing this cross body really makes things a bit easier for me when I have 2 kids, this bag and my purse. I have to pack size 4 diapers and I really have to push them all the way down in the pocket to zip the bag, not an issue for me but it took a bit of getting used too.  Overall, this is my favorite diaper bag I ahve ever had! would not have been big enough for me with 2 in diapers, but it is cute, well organizied, well made, washable and easy to carry.  GREAT mom bag!

This is spicy version of Willingham's seasoning-IE specifically states -CAJUN. So if you don't like it spicy, get the regular, otherwise, this is really good. We have had it for almost a year, using it more sparingly as we could not find it in our local stores. Now that we have found it online, are using it a lot. We prefer the milder version for some things, but this is great on pork ribs. We have tried several different rubs and seasonings, but this is just enough spice to make it hot, but very flavorful.

For some reason, this does not "cake up" in the container the way the milder version does. It is really not an issue though as a quick run though it with a fork solves that minor problem. We love them both.

My order arrived in a cardbox. Inside the glass jars are broken and damaged.  I bought many items from Amazon, most them are books, which arrived well protected 99% of the time. This time, it is glass jars and they were packed improperly, definitely a lot worse than how the books were packed. The cardbox hoding the glass jars is five bigger than all the 5 jars added together, and there is only piece of thin plastic in the box (you could think of 1/2 of a Von shopping bag with five glass jars inside a big box; the jars must have flown all over and knocked one another during shipmment.)    Amazon Customer Service says will sent me replacment soon, but it says has no way to talk directly to the packing group. I am waiting for the replacement and wondering if the glass will arrive in one piece.

I have to focus on the aspects that I can detect (taste and smell) and not ones on which I could only speculate (potency of antioxidants).    This tea has very little flavor.  It smells as if it will have a rich, fruity flavor but that is not at all the case.  There is no raspberry in it.  The name of the tea is \\"Green Tea Superfruit (Red Goji and Respberry)\\".  It contains (green tea, natural flavor, soy lecithin, blueberry juice solids, concentrated goji juice solids)    No raspberry at all... So I guess the \\"natural flavor\\" is raspberry flavor?  Why not just include raspberry juice solids or concentrated raspberry juice solids?    Anyway, the net here is that it is green tea with a questionable attempt at being true to its name of \\"Red Goji and Raspberry\\"... It does not taste bad, it simply doesn't taste like much at all.  I will continue to drink it (and the other 5 boxes I bought in my six-pack), as there is nothing in the ingredients list that I specifically disapprove of and I will trust the antioxidant counts they provide, that come from the green tea itself.  I might turn it into iced tea in the summer and add lemonade to it so it will have some flavor.    I would not buy this again but would try another variety of Lipton (or other) Green Tea.  Other Lipton teas (like the Pyramid Bedtime Story) have been excellent.
Just doesn't taste very good.  This is clearly a \\"cheese product,\\" as opposed to actual cheese.  Stick with Tostitoes brand.

I wanted to love this car seat.  I feel like I really tried.      Our friends swear by Recaro and have used the Como for both of their children, so when we found the Como on sale for more than half its list price, we bought it sight unseen thinking it was going to be the be-all-end-all of convertible car seats.    I don't know if it's the make/model of our car (2003 Ford Taurus) that is making this car seat impossible to work with, but I'm ready to light it on fire.  It sits so high in the back seat (rear-facing) that maneuvering my wiggly 8-month old son into it is a fight every time.  The side-impact protection wings mean that I have to turn him sideways and practically scrape his face on the ceiling of our car to get him in and out of it...which he is obviously not pleased with.  Additionally, the size of this thing is monolithic, and has almost totally occluded my vision out of the car's rear window when placed in the center (as recommended by the CHP)...this, combined with the giant blind spots that are created when I have to check left and right while driving makes me feel like I'm driving with my eyes closed.  Perhaps it's just the slope of the rear window.  Perhaps out car has lower ceilings than others.  Our friends drive an SUV, so perhaps it works fabulously in that scenario.      I also don't feel like it's designed well to stay securely in place.  Even using the LATCH method, it was extremely hard to tighten down the belt and still wiggles all over the place.  I installed a Britax Marathon 70 in my mother's Prius earlier tonight, and it doesn't move a millimeter when secured in place or obscure the driver's vision from the sides or out the rear window.    If I can return it, I'm going to.  If I can't, maybe it's better as a front-facing seat with the additional top anchor in place.  But at this point...I hate our Como with a passion after about 3 weeks of regular use, and my son does too.  Recaro is just not for everyone, I guess.
We used to get Wise Dip Mix when we lived up north.  Unfortunately, in Florida we couldn't find a dip mix as good as this.  I was so happy to find it on Amazon. I will continue to buy it.

I also think it carries flavor better as well. It doesnt require as many added flavors to enjoy a bowl...so, less sugar, honey, fruit, etc...is needed to enjoy whatever type of oatmeal you prefer. The stars are misleading... the product itself is excellent, but the care in which it was packaged by Amazon caused the plastic bottles to break in transit.  UPS has a habit of throwing things around, and the top layer of bubble wrap did NOT protect the bottles.  (They should be ENTIRELY wrapped!)  This is the third time we've had to \\"eat\\" the cost of a food product that was broken in transit, so we figured we should say something.  The caps broke off, so only two of the six bottles were left with intact caps.  The sealing protector came off of one of the bottles without a cap.  Two bottles were \\"squished\\".  I have photos if anyone wants to see! Grrrr!

We have used it in all types of restaurants, at friends homes, while abroad and it is SECURE and our baby has always seemed comfortable.  We share a nanny and the other baby at our house eats in it almost daily without a problem or complaint. I have to disagree with the previous writer about the legs; they DO lock in place if you push them up after opening (you'll hear a snap).  I agree about the straps being too long.  My biggest complaint is of the size (not very compact even when folded) and the difficulty in snapping in the tray. I work in a cubicle that gets very little light and I was looking for a very low maintenance plant that would work well in that type of environment. The Tillandsia Air Plant is just what I'm looking for. It is a cute little plant that needs no soil - you stick it in the sea urchin shell it comes with - and very little watering (you soak it for one hour once a week. I love this as now I have no fear of overwatering it.). While it is rather small when you first get it, it does grow - I've had it for two months now and it has grown so much I'm having a hard time getting it out of its shell when it is time to water it. It is a unique plant and I'm getting lots of compliments about it.

I really like the Tillandsia Air Plant and I'm thinking about ordering more for my cubicle.

Fantastic idea, my kids loved it the first few nights. Unfortunately it's just a cheap piece of junk. The light only stays on for about half an hour before automatically turning off, which causes my daughter to wake up yelling for someone to turn it back on just when she was about to fall asleep.

A week after we started using it the belt system started to squeak. A week after that the squeak had become so loud one night she came out of her room in tears asking me to turn it off. I had to take it apart to oil the moving parts, which fixed the problem but also caused the thing to stop moving.

Long story short, we've had it for a little over a month and I've had to completely disable the motion features and now only 2 of the 3 sets of lights work. I would send it back and try to get a replacement, but I just don't have the heart to go through this whole process again.

I was excited when I received this kit because I love sushi and have been looking for a way to make it at home. I would not recomment purchasing it - instead, do your homework and find a local asian grocery store - the quality is the same but the price is much more palatable!

We bought this for our first child to use when our second child needs our convertible car seat.  The older one is 19 months old and about 35 inches tall.  He already needs the harness straps to be in the highest position available.  For this reason, I'm a little concerned that he'll have to go to the belt-positioning mode before we're really ready to have him out of the five-point harness.  (Straps are to be at or above child's shoulders.)    This is what the instruction manual says:    5-point harness:  22-40 lbs, 34-43 in, and over 1 year old  Belt-positioning booster:  40-80 lbs, 43-52 in, and over 1 year old    Regarding installation:  the other two car seats I have are a BabyTrend FlexLoc infant carrier and a Britax Boulevard convertible car seat.  Once we figured out how to put the harness straps through the correct slot (has to be done through the back), this seat installed as easily as either of the other two.  The model we got has a buckle for adjusting the anchor tether, and does not appear to have the \\"threading\\" problem mentioned by previous reviewers.  My child was comfortable and didn't seem to mind being in a different seat.
This seaweed caviar product is virtually tasteless, not a hint of wasabi and not even salty.  It just has a grainy texture, and we were at a loss for a reason to eat it.

I have been using this monitor multiple times a day for 2.5 weeks now, and am very pleased with it. The 900ft range is excellent - easily reaches from baby's room on the 3rd floor all throughout our condo, as well as the driveway outside. The display is very crisp and clear, both during the day, and after dark with the night vision. The pan/tilt/zoom is very handy to keep an eye on the little guy as he squirms in his crib. We have not experienced any issues with interference with our wireless networks. I also like the ability to pair a second camera to the receiver when we have a second child. Monitor battery life is as-claimed and can be extended by turning the video screen off and just using the audio - however neither mode lasts through the night on battery life so you have to plug the monitor in regardless.

This is the first baby monitor I've used so cannot compare between models, but I did extensive research before purchasing and this monitor (so far) does NOT have any of the major complaints of other monitors (going "out of range" and unable to fix; interference with home wireless networks; extremely short battery life).

The only thing I would change is the melody that the monitor plays when you turn it on - it is pretty loud, and from what I can tell, unable to be turned off/turned down. Not a deal-breaker - just make sure you turn it on outside of baby's earshot. However that would be the first thing I'd change when the next model is developed.

Overall this is a great monitor and I'd purchase it again.

I had tried this Wheat Grass Powder and liked it very much, but the price being high switched to another sold here on Amazon. I have been mixing it into green smoothies and it sure does seem to help with energy, etc. The scoop is small so even though you pay $$ you don't use much in each server.

Oh yes, please ignore any reviewer who complaint because this power is fine and can make a mess if not handled carefully. I ordered both the Bumkins liners and the Bummis Bio-Soft in order to compare the two and see which I preferred.

The differences I noticed most about the Bumkins were:
Larger (can actually split each sheet into 2 if you have the patience to do that, making the box last twice as long)
Noticeably softer
Pop-up style, like a tissue box, seems easier for one-handed use than the Bummis tear-off sheets. In practice, however, I found that it made little difference, because I still needed 2 hands to get the liner properly folded and positioned on the diaper! For this reason, I generally find it easiest to get the liner out and position it in the new diaper before I take the old diaper off of the baby.

Bummis pros:
Smaller footprint on the changing space (a consideration for us because we have limited space there)
Also large enough to possibly split into 2 liners per sheet for a smaller baby, but not for a larger one

Both brands seem to flush equally well, and both do an excellent job of staying in place. I cloth diapered without liners for my previous baby and with this baby until he started solids, but I definitely prefer the ease the flushable liners add and wouldn't go back to not using them at this point unless we had a septic system that couldn't handle the flushable liners. I do recommend letting the soiled liners sit in the toilet for a couple of minutes or more before flushing -- it supposedly helps them break down more easily and reduce the likelihood of clogging the toilet, though in practice I've never had either brand's usage result in a toilet clog.

All in all, I do slightly prefer the softer feel of the Bumkins, but the differences are minor, and I like the smaller footprint for the Bummis. For personal preference the Bumkins win out by a hair, but both brands are similar enough that I wouldn't hesitate to buy either.

I originally gave this tub 4 stars, but the more I use it, the more I hate it. It is ridiculously too shallow. As a newborn, it was pretty shallow but okay. Now, my baby is 2 months old and has already outgrown this ridiculous tub.
(1) The insert is terrible. It gets stuck. The base to it is metal and is already starting to rust in places where the paint is rubbed off. It is difficult to unfold and will collapse (with baby in it!) if it isn't exactly right, which isn't easy to do. Bathing a baby, you typically don't have a lot of free hands for setting junk up. You'll need both hands to set up the sling.
(2) It is so shallow. Ridiculously shallow. The water goes cold by the time you get the sling set up and then get the baby undressed and ready for a bath. Then the baby is laying there getting cold because he isn't at all submerged in the shallow tub. You have to set it in the bottom of your tub and fill it to overflowing to even make it workable.
(3) The insert doesn't dry well, even when you hang it with the velcro loop. It just stays kind of mildly damp and cold. It has to hang a long time before it is dry.

Save yourself the frustration and just buy something else.

I love PB2 and Chocolate PB2 and have been happily purchasing them for over a year. The 16oz packs are a great deal- sometimes the tiny little jars retail at $5 each. Don't be intimidated by the picture which makes it look like you're preparing for a peanut butter apocalypse- these really aren't that big, and they're very tightly packed. I usually just put mine in a kitchen storage container for easy access and it works out just fine.

The flavor is delicious, and I add it to a ton of stuff for that wonderful hint of peanut butter without the excessive amounts of fat. Some things it works great on/in include:
smoothies, asian cuisine, sprinkled on top of ice cream (arctic zero yo!), sprinkled on an english muffin that has been spread with laughing cow cheese...omg... and lots of other things.

However, I do not recommend the weird, mix with water thing. I mean, why waste perfectly good PB2 concentrated powder on some bland un-spreadable mess. You have to remember that PB2 is defatted peanuts that have been ground to a flour consistency. Mixing water into it is literally replacing what used to be oil with water... and what do we all know? oil and water don't mix... and thus while, naturally occurring oil + peanuts = delicious, water + PB2 = the most unexciting (not) peanut butter the derivative of which is wasted PB2.

Also, if purchasing this for the lower calories, please take a moment to consider just how much you love this stuff. The serving size of 2T dry is about 45cal and I'm sure more than enough peanut butter flavor for many enviable individuals. That being said, it is VERY EASY to end up sprinkling copious amount of this stuff all over everything, and before you know it you're right up there with regular PB minus many of the health benefits and brain satiety that come with consuming the regular stuff. Peanut butter fanatics beware :) this stuff could be your demise.

I have faternal twin boys and both drank out of bottles differently and they drink out of sippy cups differently. One can handle a fast flow and not make any mess and the other needs a slow flowing or will whatever is in the cup or bottle all over his clothes and where ever he is drinking out of the cup. So for the one who requires a slow flow, 8 prefer the think baby bottle and sippy cup. It does not have a vent so it allows for him to get what he wants at his speed. However, the one who requires a faster flow will make the nipple or lid sink in on the Think Baby bottle or sippy cup. As an older infant and toddler I prefer a different brand for him.

I love key lime pies very tart and tangy, but I haven't been happy with my lime desserts since I ran out of this company's product. Using just the zest of fresh limes doesn't have enough zing for my taste buds. I would use the zest AND the oil together. And if you hate the chore of zesting a lime, you can easily say goodbye to that job and just use the oil. I can't remember exactly how much I used per pie--doesn't seem like it took too much to satisfy me, but then I would also use the zest in my food. Recommended amounts are listed on this site and I'm sure on the bottle or box of the lime oil. Though I think you will have to expertment a bit with how much you want to use in your cooking.

I just discovered that Amazon sells my beloved natural LIME oil by itself in a 5oz. bottle! When I tried this product previously from a speciality food catalog the package contained three 3 oz. bottles of lemon, orange, and lime. While the lemon and orange oils are very fine products themselves, I didn't need nearly as much of those two oils. But if you are interested in trying all three flavors, I've noticed Amazon sells that combo too, along with individual 5 oz. bottles of orange and lemon. As for me I'm a lime freak and will be ordering the 5 oz. bottle of lime oil ASAP. I'm thinking margeritas at the moment. Oh, the possibilities!

As an after thought, I'll probably order the 3oz. combo, too, for those times when I DO feel like making a tartier lemon bar or an orange flavored butter cream frosting. Yum! But delighted am I, to find the LIME oil again!

We have it installed in our Subaru Forester, and it fits well enough.  The issues are with the Subaru, rather than with this car seat.  The car seat is fairly deep front to back, which means we have to lock the handle down before placing it into the car, as there's not enough room to move the handle after it's clicked into the base.  Installation with the LATCH system is very simple, and the base has a easy adjustment to make sure it's level.  We feel our daughter is very safe in this seat, and highly recommend it!

I was appalled at how much moisture and milk got into the tubing using the original parts. The tubing is much easier to keep clean now with less milk getting into the tubing. These V8 V-Fusion Refresher drinks are diluted - with water - juice combinations. The good news is there is no corn syrup or artificial ingredients. However, they do add sugar. Yikes! They are 100 calories per cup, but this one has 24g of sugar which is high. You can have 50g of added sugar a day, and 100g of total sugar so this is about 1/2 of your added sugar allowance. Nutritionists would probably want you to have less sugar. A nutritionist told me to think of sugar as poison - your body will burn the sugar before the fat.  It does provide 100% of your daily vitamin C. I pour a cup of seltzer and then pour of splash of this refresher in (about 1/4 cup or 25 calories) with ice and it's a refreshing drink and deserves its name. This flavor of tangerine and passion fruit is tasty, too. I won't be buying this again because of the added sugar. I'd rather buy regular V8 Fusion juice, without added sugar, and dilute it with seltzer.  Ingredients  Water, Reconstituted Vegetable Juice Blend (Water and Concentrated Juices of Sweet Potatoes, Carrots, Reconstituted Fruit Juice Blend [Water and Concentrated Juices of Apples, Tangerines, Passion Fruit]), Sugar, contains less than 2 percent Citric Acid (for flavor), Natural Flavoring Passion Fruit Concentrate, Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid).

I am still experimenting with the best mix for me, but so far, the milk is too overwhelming for a person in me that likes his chocolate/cereal/etc. with his milk rather than the other way around.  In other words, I'm tasting too much of the milk and it's not a taste I care for.  It is better than the cheap stuff like store brand or Swiss, etc. but I would much rather use it in my espresso machine than boil off milk (will be one of my next experiments).      Pros:    -Very good chocolate.  I have used the straight cooking based Ghiradelli cocoa and it is intense, but good actually in an espresso type situation.  I'm thinking this stuff should be a bit less intense than the cocoa made for cooking and be even better for my personal purpose with it.    -Beats the store brand or use with water stuff if you either have the mix down or do not mind the extra milky taste.    -Even though milk has to be used and milk does cost more than free water, the chocolate is not only worth it but cost to cost, the intensity level of Ghiradelli vs. Swiss or other is a lot higher.  In other words, while Swiss may be cheaper on paper, it will take a TON more to get to the same intensity level as Ghiradelli AND it will not taste as good.  So the having to buy milk is really the only additional cost factor going on here.      Cons:    -I have yet to figure out a good enough potion that makes the taste less milky.  If I cannot figure one out, I will have to downgrade this review for the product being of use for only specific people or applications.    -Have to buy milk and with such a nice chocolate, I'd recommend an organic or nice albeit expensive milk.  I will update this review if I find that using water/espresso machine/etc. factors can take the a good bit of milk out of the equation.      So there you have it.  More pros than cons from me, though I am only partially satisfied at this point.  Will update if I can figure out how to nail down better solutions to my liking, and if anything, I can always use it how I did with the Ghiradelli type made for cooking!  Afterall, I bought this hoping it would make good hot cocoa, but knowing it would be top quality chocolate that I could at least toss into my espresso mixes if it didn't work out.

The other reviewers that complained that you can see the outline of these pads through a thin or tight top are correct. I find that it takes the perfect adjustment to camouflage them, but honestly, I don't care. They are comfortable and washable. Plus, you can dry them in the dryer as opposed to so many other brands that require air drying.

But my favorite thing about these pads (why I give them 5 out of 5 stars) is that they do not visibly leak. Let me explain. There have been times when I saturated these pads and I could feel that my shirt and bra were damp but no matter how saturated, there was no visual evidence that I had \\"leaked.\\" No embarrassing wet spots on my shirt, right where my nipples are, no dripping or streaking. No one can tell if I am \\"leaking,\\" which, in my opinion, would be much more embarrassing than someone possibly noticing that I am wearing breast pads.

Im giving it 5 stars because I appreciate all who care for health and therefore provide us organic wholesome foods. I pray and believe for better and better throughout our earth and lives. Having a heart that creates in life-giving ways also creates miracles that don't always get noticed, but to those who pray and believe, we will notice as we focus on those good results. This was the first time I've used Coconut Flour, and honestly, it was not one of my favorites. I do enjoy the taste of coconut, so I was hoping it had a noticeable taste of it, but it didn't. This flour is fine (not course) in texture, and it is light and crumbly in baking. I did not read the back of the pkg, so I did not follow the guidelines on replacing regular flour with "only" 1/4-1/2 cup in recipes that call for more than a cup of flour. I made organic chocolate chip cookies and replaced all the regular flour with this coconut flour and what a crumbly mess I made!! and it didn't taste like our original chocolate chip cookies using all coconut flour. This is a flour that leaves a batter dry and crumbly when you replace all or most regular flour with it. Next time I will only use 1/4-1/2 cup in a recipe calling for 1 1/4-2 cups flour. Needless to say, the cookie dough was crumbly (using all coconut flour) and found out then I had messed up big time!! but for the heck of it, I put the whole crumbly cookie dough mess in one big glass dish to see how it would bake lol. I included a pic of my organic chocolate chip crumbly cookie dough disaster masterpiece. Living and learning! me and my family took a small portion of the crumbly baked mess and the rest is history! (though I will dissect and eat most of the chocolate chips and macadamia nuts). I had doubled the recipe, so what a waste I made with a good flour! I still prefer part oat flour for my cookies because I like the oat texture and taste (which is also crumbly if used too much) in cookies. For me, this flour is good in muffins, cakesand other moist breads, but only use a 1/4th for each cup of flour!

Overall, my wife and I are satisfied with the fit and finish of the Delta Bentley crib. With only one exception, each piece was machined and painted well, and fit together with adequate precision. The single issue we encountered concerning assembly of the crib was the discovery that two holes meant to line up for a retaining pin were somewhat offset. Ultimately, this did not prevent assembly; we merely had to apply more torque to the adjacent connecting screws in order to pull the two parts together. Once assembled, the crib seems to be rather sturdy, and we expect it to hold up well. I was particularly impressed by the construction of the matress support. I expected it to be a slab of MDF board held up with run-of-the-mill shelf pegs. To my pleasant surprise, its actually an all-metal design, incorporating a tubular frame with a spring-connected center wire grid. So in form and function, it seems to be great. Further, it looks good, too, from a distance. And this leads me to my one major gripe concerning this crib which is this: Delta's manufacturer's stock photographs of the crib are tantamount to false advertising! Take a good look at the official product photos for this crib. Do you see any exposed screw heads or fasteners? Neither did we, and seemingly having no visible screws was the main reason we chose this crib by Delta over several other manufacturer's offerings. However, as I began to assemble this crib, it became apparent very quickly that this crib does indeed have screws that are visible from multiple viewing angles, even the same angles as pictured in Delta's official product photos. So, obviously there's some photo manipulation going on. That's just a shameful tactic. Come on Delta; be up-front with your customers!

This is the ONLY item I actually bought when I was pregnant, as opposed to receiving it as a gift.  I thought it was a must-have, and the best of the best, so I spent $119 on it.  It was ok while my baby was just weeks old, but once he was 10 and 12 pounds, I couldn't walk more than a couple blocks without very bad lower back pain.  I'm average weight and height, but this carrier was very painful.  My husband wears it occasionally because the baby can face forward, which the baby loves, but I don't wear it any more.  I bought another model that places more weight on your hips.

We just bought another Wizard and I can not say enough good things about this seat.  I find it very nice when my son falls asleep in the car, his head does not fall forward, the wings act like a pillow and he is comfy!  We have a vehicle that you can not put a seat in the middle seat (please read your car manuals) and I have been in an accident with a semi truck so safety is my main concern.   We have had 3 other seats (Triumph, Eddie Bauer, and Cosco 3 in 1) which my son hated and screamed the whole time.  He loves this seat and loves to rest his head on the wings!!!  THIS SEAT IS WELL WORTH THE MONEY...  From what I have read all carseats in the next 5 or so years will be required to have these wings for safety reasons.  You can not turn back time so please make sure your children are safely buckled up!!!

It seems that the price on this tea fluctuates as Amazon Prime courts different suppliers. For the longest time, Amazon was the supplier and it was about $16 with free shipping for Prime members (less than $1.40 a can, which beats the $1.99 that it costs at most retail stores, I've seen it go as high as $2.79). I've seen Amazon go as high as $2 a can, and then you have those crazy offers with insane shipping costs that triple the price of the tea.

Cost aside, this tea is the best going, and I have been a sweet tea drinker for over 20 years, across the north and south United States! Not only is this tea refreshing, but you can drink a few cans a day without the sugar and carbohydrate content!! Best. Tea. Ever.

Amazon appears to be doing their best to offer this at the lowest price and keep it on the market. Unfortunately, although I love the tea, I will not order if it becomes more expensive than $1.40 a can, including shipping. There are other suppliers like Wal-Mart who can offer it cheaper and also offer free shipping, so if Amazon wants to keep moving on this product that seems to be selling very well, they'll try to keep the price down.

Please keep the price down! This tea is the BEST!

I find this matt to be huge (I could easily lay on it with my hubby and baby! It feels as big as a full-size bed at least). When folded and stored away it takes up a large amount of space in my closet.  The quality of the cotton cover: it's pretty soft and thick with bright and clear pictures. I have yet to wash it but hope it should wash fine.  However, I am not too thrilled about the internal polyester batting:  it's very thick, bulky, and not quilted at all.  I fear that after I wash the cotton cover, re-inserting the thick, fluffy, un-quilted and definitely not-slippery batting back inside the cover would be one hell of a task and might release lots of dust from the batting... I would have preferred something like a dense, durable woolen blanket inside.  I think that I might just buy such a blanket, cut it to size, and replace the internal batting with it.... I find that the $129 or so I paid for the pad is too much considering the polyester inside... But I wanted a pad with removable and washable cover, so, in that respect this fit the bill.

This juice is the real thing. It's beyond me to understand why the \\"fake\\" kind of cranberry juice is so popular. By fake, I don't mean where they add other juice besides cranberry (that's fine), I mean the kind with sugar or fructose or \\"corn syrup\\" in it, which is the kind that is most readily available, and the kind that you generally get when you order \\"cranberry juice\\" in a restaurant or bar. Northland was one of the pioneers in marketing the \\"real\\" stuff -- 100% juice, like this item -- and we should be grateful to them. Other companies in this movement have included Apple & Eve, Knudsen, and Lakewood. The 100% stuff is tastier, healthier, and doesn't wreak havoc with your blood-sugar levels. More recently, Ocean Spray, the \\"big boy\\" of the industry, has gotten involved, and that's good for us, because it means the 100% products are more widely available. I just wonder what took them.     There are various flavors -- cranberry grape, cranberry raspberry, cranberry blueberry, cranberry apple, and plain cranberry among others -- take your pick. (The hardest to find is cranberry BLACKBERRY, and it's well worth finding.) Some of the companies have a flavor called \\"Just Cranberry\\" or \\"Pure Cranberry\\" or some such. BEWARE OF THAT! Not that it's \\"bad,\\" but it's different from the versions that are called simply \\"cranberry,\\" which actually have other juices mixed in  -- this can be very confusing. The \\"pure\\" cranberry isn't really drinkable in that form. I once got a slightly rude surprise when I tried it. I figured pure cranberry would be the best of all, but it's too tart for most people to drink straight-up. It's probably good for mixing, though, if you want to give that a try.    Most if not all of the commercially-available 100% juice cranberry products are very good, but Northland has been my slight favorite. I know that the company used to provide the similar products for some supermarket-chain labels, and possibly they still do -- and those store brands are usually much less expensive than the Northland. My local supermarket is Stop & Shop, and their 100% juice products are excellent; I suspect they are indeed provided by Northland. Whenever I find the flavor I want in the Stop & Shop label, that's what I buy. Otherwise, I'm thrilled to find Northland.     In recent years the Northland company had some corporate troubles, which I doubt had anything to do with the products, since they've always been terrific. I thought that one silly little thing that might have held the company back was the very poor text-graphics on the products' labels, and in my original version of this review I talked about this. The text was inaptly written and the lines of text were divided clumsily, with the result that the nature of the product wasn't communicated well. Obviously this wasn't a reason not to buy the products, but I'd bet it did hurt the sales. Well, would you believe, as of March '06, THEY'VE FIXED IT!! I don't know if these Amazon.com reviews might actually have helped alert the company to the problem, but whatever made them do it, BRAVO! The labels are now as great as the product.

****Latest Update****

We are now past the baby food stage so I may have missed this if it was formally announced, but I recently heard that they switched packaging in late 2011 to be completely BPA free. I confirmed this with customer service. Leaving the remaining review as it was...

*********************

My wife had made her own baby food for our daughter for the first eight months. Then, when our daughter was going to begin daycare, there was a certain convenience factor of being about to send in jars of baby food for her and so we bought Earth's Best. It was organic, and figured to be the closest bought brand to what she had been making herself. The variety packs are a nice, easy way to stock different kinds for our baby to enjoy... and enjoy she did for several of the flavors, though some she hated as well. All in all, we were pleased, and baby seemed pleased, though I will say, she didn't seem to like these gourmet ones any better or any worse than the less expensive [[ASIN:B001BM6LVS Earth's Best Organic 2nd Dinner Variety Pack, 4 Ounce Jars (Pack of 12)]].

Needless to say, I was pretty surprised to read a review about BPA in the lids at [[ASIN:B001BM395E Earth's Best Organic 2nd Fruit Variety Pack, 4-Ounce Jars (Pack of 12)]], (and so I posted my review there as well). I spent some time trying to verify this myself. A lot of different blogs stated it, and while I couldn't find anything definitive, here's what bothered me: Clearly Earth's Best knows people are concerned about BPA in their lids... their own facebook site is littered with people asking this same question. The admin answers these the same way... food safety and baby health is of the highest priority, call us to discuss. That's only slightly paraphrased. Going to their website, they have zero articles on BPA and none in the FAQs section either... nothing. I'm not worried enough about the issue to stop using what we purchased, but I would have felt a whole lot better about the company and their products if they would acknowledge parents' concerns and tell parents... something. Hey, we check our food in laboratory testing regularly and the the amount of BPA found in our food is X, which is so low, there are no health concerns... just say something... anything. Do you really want the onus on the customer to contact you to keep using your product?

As I was taking the time to review their product, I decided I would call them to give them a fair chance to explain. Something, I likely wouldn't have done if I wasn't writing a review. Their office was closed... 9AM - 7PM est. Not the most convenient times for a working parent, but I will attempt to follow up and update this accordingly.

****UPDATED (old)****
Just spoke to someone from customer service. She says that the liner that comes into contact with the food is BPA free, but that there is another section of the lid behind this liner, that does contain BPA, but that section of the lid does not come in contact with the food. I'm sure not everyone will be okay with that answer, but I'm ok with it. I still think it should be an answer that's readily available to consumers without calling them, but I will say there was no hold time at least.whole lot better about the company and their products if they would acknowledge parents' concerns and tell parents... something. Hey, we check our food in laboratory testing regularly and the the amount of BPA found in our food is X, which is so low, there are no health concerns... just say something... anything. Do you really want the onus on the customer to contact you to keep using your product?

As I was taking the time to review their product, I decided I would call them to give them a fair chance to explain. Something, I likely wouldn't have done if I wasn't writing a review. Their office was closed... 9AM - 7PM est. Not the most convenient times for a working parent, but I will attempt to follow up and update this accordingly.

****UPDATED (old)****
Just spoke to someone from customer service. She says that the liner that comes into contact with the food is BPA free, but that there is another section of the lid behind this liner, that does contain BPA, but that section of the lid does not come in contact with the food. I'm sure not everyone will be okay with that answer, but I'm ok with it. I still think it should be an answer that's readily available to consumers without calling them, but I will say there was no hold time at least.

A friend gave us this potty when our girl was starting to become independent.  She was fine using this but preferred the more traditional training \\"chair\\".  Now that our boy is becoming more independent, we've rediscovered this potty and just love it!  We've just bought a second one to have one upstairs and one downstairs.      After having gone through this with two kids now, I like that it's one piece - our boy was taking the \\"bowl\\" out of the other kind that we'd used with our girl and putting it on his head.  You can well imagine how charming that is. It's also completely smooth - no bumps or ridges or crannies for anything to get into and fester.  With this one, I lift our toilet lid and seat and then just dump it quickly in. (Imagine the same motion as pouring from a full water glass at a restaurant into your kiddo's sippy.)  I've never made a mess EXCEPT will often have pee still on the seat of the potty where it pours out.  (I say this bc a lot of the reviewers complain that it's hard to dump but I just haven't had that problem, or more accurately, I see what they're talking about but it's just not that big of a problem.) I just have a roll of paper towels and a box of wipes by the regular toilet to take care of any mess, as you almost have to always wipe out the bowl of it anyway.  I think all training pottys have a similar problem when you dump it.  This one is easy for him to lift and move around and super comfortable to sit on and he pees INTO it and not on it.  The other one that we had (that has since been relegated to the closet), he would pee all over when he was sitting there.  YUCK.  This one is so much more comfortable for him - he sits with a book or a puzzle and is totally fine to \\"wait it out\\".  The other chair kind cramped his \\"style\\" if you know what I mean. When baby hit 3 months she turned into a drool machine. Most of the bibs I had were those little cheapos that are made of some thin synthetic fabric that soaks through right away. I searched amazon for the best bibs for droolers and picked a few with decent reviews to try:

aden + anais 3 Pack Nibble Snap Bibs
Imse Vimse Organic Cotton Terry Dribble Bibs
Tommee Tippee Closer to Nature Milk Feeding Bib

Baby is now 7 months and the drooling is gone, so we're not using bibs much at the moment. When I was using them, I liked the aden and anais best.

The Imse Vimse are very small which would have been fine for my purpose and they had the nicest colors to me- fairly neutral so they went with most outfits. They also fit nice and snug around the neck due to the tie. The bib cotton was thick and absorbent, but I rarely used them because the edging is made with some terrible rough fabric. If it's cotton, they must be breeding a new special type with the texture of... gosh, I'm trying to think of a fabric with such a terrible texture, but I don't know what it would be. Suffice it to say that it doesn't belong in the sensitive neck rolls of a little baby. So, these got very little use.

The Tommy Tippy are nice and probably well suited to keeping milk out of the neck rolls, but the bib itself is a thin synthetic material and not all that absorbent. So, they soak through too quickly to be of much use for a serious drooling problem. The bib size is perfect, not tiny like the Imse Vimse and not huge like Aden and Anais. I don't love the velcro- you have to be careful that it doesn't snag other things in the wash and if you don't line it up perfectly it can irritate baby's skin. The snaps on Aden and Anais are better.

Finally, my favorite ended up being the Aden and Anais which are designed for eating, not drooling. They are huge, more of a smock on a 3 month old, but this is perfect for an eating bib. At three months baby wasn't mobile yet, so being too large was no biggie- if I need to resume use, it may interfere with her crawling as they hang past the waist. They were also a big big around the neck for little one but we didn't seem to have a big problem with the drool running into her neck so this worked out ok. The reason I loved them is that they are so soft and so absorbent, they never soaked through with the drool and I could take the long bib and wipe her face with it. The Imse Vimse were too small for this and the Tommy Tippy not absorbent enough. Another possible advantage is the rather loud pattern does not show stains as much as the plainer bibs. I do wish they came in more color options, I don't love either choice, but on the whole I am happy and I know these will last forever, like the Aden and Anais blankets, they just get better with washing.

We had had our Bumbleride Indie for a few months now and am so far very impressed. I live very close to the beach, so wanted to get a stroller that I could take easily on the sand, and other similar terrain. After doing extensive research I decided to go with the Bumbleride Indie and am very happy I did!! For an all terrain, jogging stroller, the Indie is actually quiet light and SOOOO easy to maneuver. I can easily push the pram with one hand even with my toddler weighing almost 34 pounds in the seat. He loves riding in it and insists every time I say we are going for a walk that we take the stroller..lol...he jumps right in and doesn't budge. We recently went for a stroll along the beach and it handled very nicely on the compact sand nearer the water. The air filled tires are great and the suspension superb. The canopy is huge and offers more than substantial coverage from the elements. The adjustable handle is very nice and very comfortable. My 3 year old loves being able to move the handle down so he can push his brother. The foot break is very easy to put on and off and the stroller folds down very nicely. I can get it easily in and out of our Honda Odyssey and removing the back wheels makes it even more compact. Weighing only 20 pounds is awesome for such a full range stroller.

The ONLY complaint i have is the recline feature. The strap can get very sticky and makes it a pain sometimes to lower the seat back. I do however love how with adjustable foot rest and full recline of the seat, the stroller basically offers a bassinet environment without having to purchase additional items. I still give the stroller 5 stars though as all the other great feature outweigh this one downfall. It is definitely worth the price and the new changes that were made in the 2013 make it even better!!!

Our poor baby screamed for a week on alimentum because it tore his stomach up. Not to mention everything else started coming back as well. Now enter lactorelief! We saw dramatic improvements within 24 hours! He has been on it for close to a month now and he has no stomach trouble, he poos regularly, his skin is beautiful and he is not congested all of the time. He also used to hate tummy-time (I'm assuming because his stomach hurt), but now he doesn't mind it. He sleeps better, too! And as a bonus, lactorelief tastes amazing! We now have a happy, healthy baby!

I have seen plenty of mixed reviews about the Baby Trend Jogger Travel System. Many of the negative reviews claimed that this product does not hold up well over the long haul, citing its low price as evidence that it could not be a very reliable stroller after all.  While that might be true, this stroller has worked out PERFECTLY for my wife and me as a second stroller. My family has a summer home on Fire Island, which is off of the South Shore of Long Island, and is only accessible by ferry boat. My wife and I decided, although it would be more expensive, that we would need a second set of many items for our baby boy because we did not want to have to lug too many things back and forth each week; that meant a second crib, play pen, bather, jungle gym, and so on and so forth, but also a second stroller.  We bought the Peg Perego Pliko as our primary stroller, with a matching car seat, that fit into the stroller for when he was an infant. The Peg combined with the car seat ran close to $700! With that kind of investment, we did not want to drag the stroller and car seat out to the beach each weekend, where they could get ruined by the elements and we figured that the stroller might not handle so well on the boardwalks and sandy terrain. We thought that a jogger would be the ideal type of stroller for Fire Island: Light weight, durable, compact, great for an active lifestyle. At first we were set on getting a Baby Jogger, with the \\"City Mini\\" being the least expensive and most logical choice. However, knowing that our boy would still be younger than six months all summer long, we knew we needed to be able to use the car seat in the stroller. That presented the problem of having to either a). use an adaptor to put our Peg Perego car seat into the jogger, which we did not want to do for reasons already discussed, or b). buy ANOTHER car seat to go along with the jogger. We reluctantly decided to try using our existing car seat with the Baby Jogger, although that meant that not only might it be harmed in transit and out at the beach, but that we would have to carry it back and forth with us. Besides, we did not want to spend a couple hundred dollars on a car seat that we would really only need for one summer. Also, the adapter that made the Baby Jogger car seat-ready did not look very safe.  Enter the Baby Trend Travel System! My wife spotted it on the floor of the stroller section at Buy Buy Baby. We could not believe that it was so inexpensive AND that it included a car seat! We liked the styling and colors, the cup holders, and little change compartment. The little area underneath the stroller for storing things was even larger than on our Peg Perego! Also, the car seat (which we found out got an extremely high safety rating on its own), snapped into the stroller portion securely and easily. The salesman at Buy Buy Baby admitted that it was a popular stroller although he did not know much about it. When we told him why we needed it: as a second stroller that we would use and leave out at the beach house, he convinced us that we would be crazy to spend $500 on anything else.  The jogger, along with a collection of other items arrived at the house on Fire Island and I frenetically started to assemble everything. I thought the stroller would be difficult (mainly because our Peg was a bit harder to assemble than I thought it should be), so I saved it for last. When I finally got around to putting the stroller together, I was amazed at the ease of assembly. The frame came fully assembled, with the canopies and seating area attached, and all I had to do was unfold the frame and snap in the wheels. Once I snapped the tray table into place, the car seat also snapped right in. The stroller is easy to fold up and to disassemble.  I have heard complaints about the jogger's handling, particularly that the front wheel wobbles. This has not been my experience and I have brought the stroller over sand, rocks, and boardwalks. The large, mountianbike style tires are ideal for such terrain. Further the stroller has done great having been accidentally left out in the rain, and being in an environment where the sea air is moist, salty, and very tough on metal and fabrics; I had expected the stroller to have shown some rust and fading by now, but that has not been the case at all.  All told, we have had the Baby Trend Jogger Travel System for about two and a half months and have gotten about 30 day's use out of it. So, I cannot vouch for its quality over a 365 day period, or as a primary stroller. Since our son is our first born, my wife and I had the original mind-set that we would spare no expense in getting the best of everything for him. So, if you are convinced that a more expensive stroller would be a safer, better quality product for everyday use, then I totally understand. However, my wife and I have quickly learned where we might want to splurge and in which areas we are better off saving money when it comes to the baby. My only complaint about the stroller is that the tires were difficult to inflate with a regular bicycle pump and I had to take them down to a local hardware store and use the high-pressure electrical pump in order to inflate the tires.  So, if you are looking for a second stroller or something that you can easily travel with, in the interest of saving wear and tear on your primary stroller, or to save yourself the aggravation of having to carry your primary stroller to and from places, and do not feel like spending too much on a second stroller, the Baby Trend is an EXCELLENT product that deserves consideration, and will probably be durable enough to be a primary stroller as well. My wife and I have been nothing but pleased.
