Just think about it- dried kiwis?  You've probably had kiwis that were on the verge of going bad before.  How did they taste?  Dry, tasteless and nasty (and falling apart similarly to apples when they get old).  Now imagine taking that same taste and covering it with an abundance of sugar.  Now you have dried over-sugared kiwis being advertised and sold on amazon. You'd be better off avoiding this.  There are no words to describe how uninteresting this no doubt tastes compared to an actual fully ripe and juicy kiwi.  Now that you've been informed by the many reviewers here on amazon, you know what needs to be done- go to your local grocery store, head to the produce section and pick up an actual bag of kiwis.

When my daughter outgrew her infant car seat I began searching for a convertible car seat mostly because I wanted one that can rear face as well as forward face because I wanted to extend rear face my daughter and on a parenting forum I used to visit frequently a lot of the mother's had this seat and recommended it to me. I purchased the Beco Butterfly and have been using it for few weeks.   Here is my take on it and I'm going to be detailed since I was desperate for some detailed review when I was researching....    Pros:  -It's really nice looking...I get complements on it. It is the most attractive carrier I've seen so far.  -It's good quality...very sturdy, quality workmanship, good fabric  -It does distribute the weight to the hip so back does not hurt as much..so I don't mind wearing it for a long time. I have not noticed any irritation on my son after a long wear neither...it has padding for his legs.  -It's quick to get on but the buckle that was put in due to that previous recall is pain in the butt. It takes a lot of fiddling around with to adjust the top straps but it's super fast once you have it set since there really is no need to change it.  -It holds the baby nice and close to me (adjustable) and my baby is happy in it and sleeps in it well.  -I like the buckles vs tying stuff...it's quick...snap snap and it's done  -Infant insert works very well with my 5 month old (now almost 6 months)      Cons:  -It's padded and hot like the Bjorn, which sucks. It has the outer layer, baby insert layer, and another layer that lays on me directly...that's 3 layers with outer layer being pretty thick (not as thick as the Bjorn though). Yah...no wonder it makes my chest and stomach all sweaty after a walk in the hot weather.  -The back buckle is hard to reach and push down.  -I kinda don't like the straps...they are regular heavy duty nylon straps. It's good quality but it's not the softest thing to be rubbing against my baby's skin...most of the time it's out of the way but still....  -The headrest attaches awkwardly and is useless for infants...maybe it'll come in handy when he is a toddler.  But my baby has no problem sleeping in it and I really haven't had to use it at all.  -I tried to put it on my husband's back...baby freaked and was not happy. It is bit too small for his wideback and my son was uncomfortable...perhaps we need to do more adjusting but adjusting the thing is not that easy with all the buckles. It's only easy once everything has been set up just right....but not so switching to diff person where every strap needs to be readjusted.  -I also find myself wanting the outward facing option...for those short periods when i want my son to see what's going on (like the 4th of July fireworks)    I do take it everywhere and use it a lot. I love how he sits in it. A friend of mine recently got a Moby wrap and she loves it. But I have to admit that I am not fond of how it looks on...all that extra fabric hanging and the tie knot...not so attractive. But it does look like it would be good for a little baby.     I am generally very happy with this carrier since its super easy now its all adjusted, comfy for my son, and have beautiful prints.    Update: Started putting my son in the main compartment out of the infant insert and the canvas material does make red marks on his thighs and he seems uncomfortable in it.  Very disappointed.  Thinking about getting the ERGO.

She's big for her age and now that she's 8 months, the Tummytub was clearly way too small for her. This fits perfectly in our tiny bathroom shower stall (which doesn't actually have a tub...that's city life for you!) and she can finally spread her legs and splash around during bath time.

She did slip once when she tried to reach for the showerhead outside of the tub, and I was holding her obviously so it was fine, but I'd only start using this once the baby has very good head support and can do with you holding her stomach or back w/ one hand whie you wash with the other. I don't use the drain because it's a pain to put back in...just tip out the water when I'm done, no issues. I imagine this will be great for travel as it folds up neatly. I have to admit, the quality of the bag is very good. It has many pouches to store big and small items. Other reviews talk about the about the positive points of this bag.
However, this bag lacks a few basic design points.
1. The big ticket items for any infant/kid such as diapers, wipes, formula, games have to be stored in the lower part of the bag since it has big pouches for these items. Once you put all these items, the bag becomes huge at the bottom and becomes difficult to close using the zip.
2. Secondly. the laundry bag idea is great but no place to keep it once it becomes full. You have to carry it in a separate bag or may be squeeze at the top of the bag.
3. It gives some space for clothes but not too much. May be you can carry 5 pieces of dresses.

Overall, it is a great travel bag. It they had addressed these issues, it would have been the best backpack diaper bag! Hope subsequent versions have some design consideration.

My grand daughter has slept very well on it!  Has two sides - one which is water proof - and as a result a little firmer, and the other side which is not water proof, but a little softer. I have been using this monitor for 10 months and I love it.  We leave one in our bedroom hooked to the headboard.  I can hear my daughter breathe. I've never had any problems (except for today when I left it outside in a massive thunderstorm.  Not sure if it still works, but it would be a miracle if it did).  It does run out of batteries quickly, however we leave it plugged in in both rooms and unplug it only to take it into another location temporarily (i.e. outside or in the laundry room).  If I'm going to be in a specific room for a long period of time, such as ironing, I just take the adaptor and plug it in there.  It's still very mobile though.  Considering I do take it outside for a while without keeping it plugged in, I still only have to replace the batteries every couple of months.

C2O is not the first coconut water we have tried. I've tried most of the typical natural-foods store refrigerator case brands (VitaCoco, Zico, O.N.E., etc) and I honestly concluded that I just don't like coconut water and would never choose to drink it with other options around. This was confirmed when I purchased a couple of young Thai coconuts. I found the liquids to be odd tasting, like something at the start of going bad rather than something fresh and vibrant. Just not my thing.

I continued to buy those brands, thinking they were an easier alternative to opening coconuts, when I needed liquid to add to my famous (in my own mind) raw coconut macaroons. I always try to add a liquid with some nutritional value, even if it is mostly vitamins, electrolytes, yadda yadda yadda. The other flavors in the macaroons eclipsed any weird taste of the coconut water, and all was good.

Then I tried C2O and while I'm not going to be drinking coconut water daily, it is such an improvement over all of the other brands. The flavor is fresh and sweet and pretty good when served fresh from the fridge. As a type 1 diabetic, I did not the carb counts and I usually choose carb/calorie free fluids. I will, though, reach for one of these next time I am feeling dehydrated, and I will use this as the base for my electrolyte "cocktail" I make for my family when we are ill. As far as my macaroons, I would rather use this and have the flavor enhanced by all of the ingredients rather than feeling like I have to cover up anything, even in the slightest bit.

I have been buying the watermelon and the tamarind flavors for about ten years now.  However, they usually come melted and crushed in the wrappers, making them nearly impossible to get out of the wrapper.  Most taste just horrible but I keep buying them because, occasionally, the taste is so good that I am as close to addicted to them as any junkie can be. So I'm definitely a bit biased about my coffee - I like a richer, more basic flavor. This one is OK, but too acidic for me. For comparison, I'm not a fan of Kona coffee - far too acidic. The coffee is otherwise solid though - well packed (vacuum sealed for preserving freshness) and flavorful.

We bought this for cleaning home-made re-usable diapers.  Water pressure is great.  It's easy to use.  And, frankly, we just like the product.  We have had it for about 4-5 months.  However, starting about a month or so ago, the lever starts to stick...thereby making it impossible to shut the water off.  I'm not the only reviewer to say this.  I think I can probably find a way to fit something really thin into the handle to force it to turn off.  But, I don't want to have to buy something to make this product work.  I've got to find out if there's still an applicable warranty, but I can't seem to find info on that.  We threw away the wrapping, etc.  So, I'll post again if I find something useful.

When I lived in Germany, we would run over the border to Dutch grocery stores where we could buy these cookies for mad cheap! Although these specific cookies are more expensive then a place like Trader Joe's (or in Europe!!), I'd definitely buy them at least once--and 20 is a good number although they will last fewer than 2 hours in any home. I prefer them room temperature since it's easier to taste cooler food for me, but make sure to warm a few up! They are wonderful with ice cream or alone or maybe even make cereal out of them?? I own this thermometer and am surprised at the low ratings. While I don't think I get the most accurate reading in the short time the claim (I leave it in for another couple of minutes) it is quite accurate. Also, the battery does come out. It takes a CR1225 disc battery. You just use a penny to open it. This is the first thermometer I can recall bothering to replace the battery in a long time (and it lasted a couple of years). The only trouble I'm having is it seems a little difficult to find the battery. However it's available at Amazon and other retailers, too.

We LOVE our Halo sleep sacks and wouldn't change to anything else, but I now have mixed feelings about the early-walker foot opening sleep sacks. My daughters feet froze at night; the reason we had her in a sleep sack to begin with is because she moves around a lot at night so she can't keep a blanket over her, so this was no help in that department. We tried putting socks on her, but she only pulled them off and kept waking herself up. We went back to the sleep sacks with no foot openings, and have had no problems. I highly recommend Halo sleep sacks, but if you have children that move around a lot at night and take their socks off while putting themselves to sleep, you might want to stick to the regular style and avoid the pre-walkers. The regular style also keeps her from being able to climb out of bed, which is an added bonus we hadn't previously realized!

I am expecting my first baby and I ordered this in preparation for his arrival. The blanket is exactly as described, soft, plush, the color is very vibrant. I washed it and it held up beautifully. The stitching is very neat, no loose threads or shrinking. Neither did I see any excess lint accumulate while drying, which happened with other fleece blankets. Keep in mind that the blanket is on a smaller side (30x30), however, it works for me. It looks cute too, I love the polka dots.

UPDATE 1/29/2016
It has been almost six months since I started using this blanket after my baby was born. It is an OKAY blanket but nothing more than that. We have it in the car to cover the baby on chilly days so we don't use it every day. It's been washed maybe 6 times and I recently noticed it lose its initial plush appearance. Still soft, just not as smooth and plush as it used to be.

What really made me come back and update my review is the fact that I since discovered these fleece blankets are available from 99cents store for $1.99. The same fabric type/shape/size just five times cheaper! They actually have more pattern/color choices (I bought blue stripe, red stripe, green polka dot, multicolor with cars, green with elephants, pink with hearts etc. for gifts as well as for my own baby's needs. I got SIX blankets for like $12. What's more, 99cent store blankets are an inch wider! So I feel like this one was a big rip off.

I first tried this on a whim in a cafe in Boulder (the hometown of this tea) and I was so amazed that I actually had to find this on Amazon. It smells deliciously of a nutty vanilla, practically like candy. The taste does not disappoint its aroma. It's subtly sweet that you won't need to add honey, even if you're a honeynut like me, but the flavor is soft enough to enjoy without being overwhelmed. This is my personal favorite best vanilla almond rooibos loose leaf and I've already gifted it twice to a couple of very happy friends. It's also gluten-free, sugar-free, and caffeine-free if that is a concern for you!

The rooibos leaves are paper thin (albeit long, sort of half of a 2D rice grain in length) so they have the potential to flow out of infusers if the mesh isn't fine enough. They flowed out of my more-so decorative leaf-steam infuser, but not from my twist-lock capped mesh infuser. There are also pieces of almond in the tea, just like as shown in the elephant graphic on the tin. The tin itself has a red twist-lock cap with a second metal lid that fits securely with the tin in order to seal in the tea's freshness and maximize shelf life.

Overall, great design for the tin and delicious flavor for the tea! Don't hesitate to try it!

I have to laugh at some of the reviews... Hershey's dark chocolate is like first step into the dark chocolate range. It's not advertised nor intended to be the high cocoa % that is in the harsher dark. I personally find it to be the best combination of sweet milk chocolate and the more \\"real\\" dark chocolate. Usually IMO dark chocolate when coming from a sweet society is an acquired taste and you kind of build up to the higher %. It's a good starter dark! If you go immediately from milk to high % dark and are expecting anything sweet at all  you will be disappointed. If you have moved on passed this level of dark... you would already know to check the level of dark and the amount of peppers included in many specialty darks. It is indeed just as advertised!

I looked at the Graco Nautilus, and decided against it as many people reported that the crotch strap was positioned to rearward, resulting in children either sitting on the strap or even on the buckle. To verify, I went to Target and sat my 4-year old on the Nautilus with the crotch strap positioned as forward as possible; her butt was on the strap. I looked at other models from Safety 1st and Evenflo, but their harness boosters had a maximum capacity of 40 lbs. in harness mode; my niece is already over 35 lbs. Then there was Recaro's harness booster, which seemed perfect, until I noticed that there were no cup holders! What were they thinking, especially for a car seat designed for older toddlers?

I didn't have such problems with the Britax Frontier 85. There are two cupholders, so the child or adult sitting next to the child in the harness booster can use the spare. At 85 lbs. maximum capacity in harness booster mode and 120 lbs. in belt-positioning booster mode, I know that this will be the last car seat we'll have to buy. The headrest has wings for side-impact protection, but there's the invaluable bonus that she can rest her head to the side and not slump her head forward. The headrest height adjusts without having to re-thread the harness.

Huge note: When installing this via LATCH, you must thread the excess strap through the slot at the corner of the seat and pull, thus pulling the strap toward the seat. If pulled away from the seat, the installation will be loose, as the strap will resist being pulled. I found this out from the installation video much later, because I didn't bother reading the manual. Before finding this out, I had a horrible time installing this. Now, installation is a breeze.

I don't know what I would do without my Storhenwiege sling! We have used it since my little one was a few months old and still use it weekly (if not more) at over a year. It is so comfortable, breathable, easy to adjust, and over all amazing.

- Parmesan Garlic (1 bag) -- not bad
- Barbecue (2 bags) -- don't like BBQ

At a coworker's recommendation I bought an espresso machine not too long ago. He also told me to buy Lavazza coffee, which I did - I bought a can of their Cafe Espresso. To my complete disappointment, though, my espressos weren't coming out as creamy as I thought that they would. I blamed the lack of crema on the espresso maker. Then a few days ago I saw the Crema & Gusto recommended to me by Amazon, and I decided to give it a shot since I was running out of coffee anyway. Oh my, oh my, how happy I am. The coffee is really creamy, thick, and with that beautiful crema layer that I was hoping to get from the beginning. The coffee comes out strong but not bitter. It's really flavorful and just simply delicious, and I can see that my problem before wasn't my espresso machine, but the coffee I was using. I highly recommend this product and I will certainly buy it again (not to mention that less than $20 for 4 bricks of 8.8oz of quality coffee isn't a bad price). Oh, shipping was super fast two - came in two days.

Thinking Kraft mac and cheese powder was too expensive, I bought this at a bulk food store thinking I could make \\"my own\\", cheaper \\"easy mac\\". Holy cow was I wrong. Lets check the numbers...

Easy mac is $3 for a 6 pack at Walmart, which is 50 cents/pack if you throw away the noodles. Each pack comes with 20g (or 0.7oz) of cheese powder. At 50 cents per 0.7oz that equals $11.43 per pound of actual Kraft Easy Mac powder, not counting all the noodles.

This stuff costs MORE than that... a LOT more, and also contains a fairly large amount of partially hydrogenated oils, which are terrible for your health.

Kraft cheese powder does NOT contain hydrogenated oils (hydrogenation is a cheap way of making oil take up about 10% more weight, while costing the manufacturer nearly nothing, it's a way to skimp on costs, except hydrogenation has been proven to reduce life expectancy. This is already banned in Europe and some parts of the US like NYC).

Aside of the health issues, this stuff is so expensive that you could buy easymac, throw away the boxes, the noodles, the plastic, etc. and still come ount ahead. Just buy easy mac powder... you will live longer, you will save over a dollar a pound and have free pasta, individually wrapped for you too.

As of 7/27/13 the title and description of this item is incorrect. The picture is correct. This product is actually the Sweety Feet set of three socks, not the sock-t-pus. Fortunately a quick call to Amazon sorts it out with a return label emailed to me and an immediate refund.

If you are looking for the Sock-t-pus, search for \\"Baby Aspen Plush Octopus with 4 Pairs of Socks\\". That being said, the Sock-t-pus is my daughter's favorite toy. We take it everywhere, doctors offices, car rides, sleeping. We needed a second. It's soft, about as big as the baby and has a bell inside so it catches her attention when it jingles.
My daughter absolutely loves this car seat! The airport recently ruined it, so I am purchasing it again. Definitely would recommend!
I just love the celery color and the sheet was a very nice.  (Not to mention at an awesome price!)
I  bought these for the kids to have as study snacks. They are a favorite treat and will be ordering them again
Doesn't stick on oven, my baby popped off at his first try. Don't buy. Waste of money.
Good product, but too expensive here.  $3.99-$4.99 at the Smith's (Kroger related in SW) grocery chain.  Shop around.

These rails were purchased to change a crib to a full size bed.  The slots do not fully line up with my crib (I sort of expected that could be the case), but 2 holes did so we just used regular self drilling screws to attache the other slots.  This worked well.  I purchased the "bunky board" full size for the base instead of a boxspring and it worked well with these rails.  The rails did have to be installed with a slight angle because of the center metal stick, but it is not noticable and overall the bed is fairly sturdy (at least for a young child).  I'd rate this a 5 star if the center stick fit better for alignment, but I can not complain.

The taste of this product was good but it mixes very poorly, even when
mixed in water and diluted more than recommended. I will not use Nito-Tech again due to this.

I got this pump because I was tired of hand expressing whenever I needed to leave my baby for a short time.This pump is a godsend .Being that I never used a electric I cant compare the two,however I do know this pump is very comfortable & expresses milk quickly .I can get 4-9 oz out of one breast in  3-7 minutes.I express milk daily & store it for later use.The silicone petals produce a letdown as if my baby were nursing.The kit itself is very handy for travel.I keep a small bottle of hand sanitizer in my kit.Just the other day I was pumping in a dressing room while shopping.It is very discreet.You just have to purchase two extra gel packs to keep the milk cool, but most hospitals give them away with thier going home kit,so needless to say I didn't have to purchase anything extra.

Wow!  I was surprised by the negative reviews because I think Miracle Noodles are great!  Yes, the liquid in the bag they come in has a strange odor.  Yes, the texture may seem a bit off-putting for some.  But for someone like me who can't eat normal pasta, these truly are a miracle noodle.  The garlic flavor in particular gives a nice mild taste to the noodle.  If you put a bit of Earth Balance (or butter, etc) on them, the salt helps to balance the flavor.  The texture is kind of chewy, but I would not compare it to a jellyfish like a previous reviewer!  I have tried seaweed noodles before, and THOSE taste and have texture like jellyfish.  If you are simply trying to low-carb diet, I don't know that I would recommend these.  Or, if you are gluten-free only, I don't know that I would recommend these.  However, I am gluten-intolerant and pre-diabetic, and I have had to stop eating grains entirely, and these are the only \\"noodle\\" I can eat.  At 30 calories and 6 grams of carb per bag, my blood sugar doesn't spike, and they keep me quite full!  For anyone with similar medical problems as me, I would definitely recommend trying them.

If you have problems with gluten and miss good tasting bread - this is what you have been missing. If you are missing \\"normal\\" tasting bread, than this is the bread you should try. I make this for myself in a bread machine, I add a handful of fennel and sunflower seeds to the directions and use it all week long. It's good both toasted and not. I get a pack of 4 every two months through Amazon and find it much cheaper than having to shop for it at the stores. It really is Wonderful!

I bought this at Target (store not website) for $16.99, and will be returning it, since my daughter is too long for it at 40\\" tall. I like the concept and the execution of the nap mat, just not the size. Really the packaging should say \\"for kids up to X-inches.\\"

We've only had this stroller for a month, and it's wonderful.  It takes up very little space in the trunk and it is so small that it's easy to navigate stores.  We bought this one instead of the Volo for the recline option. Wish we had bought it sooner!
love this mirror so big it's perfect I get compliments all the time on it and it was the solution to a crying baby

We had 3 of 8 that we not quite the quality we had been receiving at Christmas but on the bright side Amazon made it right and immediately sent us 4 fresh jars to replace the 3!!  Delicious! Best Jerky ever!
These have very little coffee flavor and are certainly not worth the high price paid for pods.  I'll stick with Starbucks!

I've recommened it to so many people.  I just love it.  It blocks the smell really well & I have no problems emtying it when it needs (my husband on the other hand, has problems getting the 'cuter' to work).  My daughter is 9 months & eating a lot of real food & I still don't smell poop.

This is just the thing for a \\"proper cup of tea\\". My English husband and I used to bring huge boxes of PG Tips teabags back from England in our suitcases. No more - what a great price on Amazon. Not as cheap as the UK, but the convenience can't be beat! Enjoy!
It fits into any bottle or nipple and I use it to clean my breast pump attachments also. I love the stand because it keeps the brush clean and the counter clean as well.

[[ASIN:B000E1HVVQ Shake 'N Bake Seasoned Coating Mix, Original Pork, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)]]    Shake N Bake Original Pork coating mix is the best for both chicken & pork!  It gives baked chicken that crunchy finish, yummy!!!
Baby is now 8 months old and still loves this.  Adjusts easily once you figure it out. Lots of items to keep baby busy.

I tried it - have the other 5 packages taking up space -
not worth buying at all - don't bother purchasing this - worst part it can't be returned

This cocoa \\"tea\\" is (or was) delicious. It satisfies your chocolate cravings with real chocolate! only 60 calories. I went through a couple of cases and want more but can't find it anywhere. What happened, Honest Tea? Did the big boys at cocacola make you ditch this terrific product?

I use it for my BOB, since paying 300+ for a stroller doesn't give you a drink carrier!!! Whatever. This one works like a champ. Holds everything and moves with bumps and turns. Velcro is strong and the zipper pocket is perfect for keys and garage opener! Worth the 10 bucks!

My daughter chose this Thermos because of the design as a replacement for her Hello Kitty thermos. I thought they'd be the same, but they're not. This newer model doesn't keep the soup as warm for as long, and it's not dishwasher safe. Bummer. But it IS still a thermos, so it does work -- just not as well or as conveniently as we'd been used to.

Man, it is so tough to find GOOD teethers that my baby likes, that aren't plastic. I saw these on Amazon and took a chance; my son loved them, so I ordered another pack to make sure I always had a clean one on hand. All the little nubs seem to keep him stimulated, and the shape is perfect for chubby hands to hold. My son got his first tooth a little on the early side (4 1/2 months) and he is ALWAYS looking for something to stick in his mouth. I like to put these on pacifier clips when he's in his car seat so he has something to keep him occupied. They are easy to wash (I just throw them in a soaking bin in the kitchen sink along with his bottles/breast pump parts) and dry quickly. I haven't had any cracking issues at all.

Bought two this for the second car and grandma. I like it better than the expensive one we bought. Con: like ever car seat you need something to put under it to get it to the right level for kids under 25 pounds. Also not best for long trips as there isn't a ton of padding. Pros: super easy to install and really easy to get the kid in and out of.

Nutiva coconut oil is the best there is.  I have tried many different brands over the years and by far Nutiva has the best flavor, consistency and price that I have found.  And with the convenience of ordering through Amazon, I do not have to search the Internet and hope that it is in stock at a vitamin store site.  You cannot go wrong ordering Nutiva coconut oil, I use it in my cooking daily.
Previously, I had damaged three Omeron Pedometers due to the clips allowing them to fall. Since I have installed these Leashes, I have not had a single incident of damage.

DO NOT BUY ANYTHING ELSE!!! These have saved our fingers and knuckles from getting pinched or scraped by the others that you have to post your fingers on between the cabinet in order to push down to unlock. I hated that and my one year old got his fingers stuck in there and hurt. I was so over it. Bought these and never looked back. Zero issues installing. They will not work on a Lazy Susan though.

Great toothbrush! We ordered this for our then-8 month old and our pediatric dentist actually gave us a freebie set as part of our goodie bag! My daughter loves this toothbrush. She's actually not picky since she loved her $2.99 winnie-the-pooh one that we got from Target, BUT I love that this one has a long handle. Since she's at the stage where she doesn't want me to brush her teeth FOR her, it's nice for me to grab ahold too. She wants to do it herself (by chewing on the bristles) but I can still guide her with the long parent-handle.

This toothbrush comes with a hand guard which I haven't used yet since I opened the package from our dentist (which didn't have it) so I can't speak to it but I like the idea of baby not being able to hold it way far back on the handle and cause herself to gag on it.

Very soft squishy fun handle, rubbery soft siliconey toothbrush head back.

Haven't used the tongue scraper thing, I don't think my 10 month old would like that very much. Instead, she chews on it at the end of her brushing session, then we say "yay" and clap for her.

Makes infant tooth brushing fun!
really was satisfied with all the above products  up to my standards  courteous service  great pricing  clothing good quality  adorable children's clothing  will purchase more products from amazon
I love Playtex and liners but the 4 OZ ones are just too small.  You can't actually get a full four ounces in these once they are wrapped around the bottle neck.

Plain Blueberry Pop Tarts have been my favorite quick breakfast for years. My kids love them also so they don't stay around our house long.     This was my first grocery purchase from Amazon and I wasn't sure what to expect. They arrived in factory carton packed in another box for protection. They had a full year before \\"best by\\" date and me and my kids noticed right away that they were much tastier than ones we have bought from the grocery store. I think they were fresher than ones that went through warehouses on their way to the store.

20-something SpongeBob fan loves her new pillow. It is of a good quality and soft to the touch. Made of polyester it is surprisingly smooth and if you turn it over it makes a nice pillow to rest your head on. Very bright colors too! A nice buy.

I have 4 big dogs. This works perfectly. I had a choice of colors so I could match it to my decor, Its easy to install and even without using the screws or sticky tape, it is really sturdy. I can push it open and it stays open if I dont want it closed. It does have a threshold, which is not a big deal. Hopefully when I get used to having these gates, Ill eventually stop tripping over it everytime I cross it. My transition strips from kitchen to carpet are raised oak so its set kindof high because of that. I would recommend these 100%. They are a great product, and shipping was lightning fast.
Does not keep my bulldog in. but with the adapters that are in the kit it might work, It is plastic not really what I thought it would be. but its ok.

I used this blanket with my first two children and LOVED it.  Both slept better and longer stretches at night as soon as I started using it.  I just ordered a new one for baby # 3.  This item is a MUST have and Is my favorite shower gift for new moms.
I have the K-Cup machine which gets daily use for coffee and tea.  It is also great for the quick hot cocoa on a cold evening.  This brand makes a good cup of hot cocoa.  Just add the marshmellows.

I mostly bought this for the tea chest itself.  The chest itself is kind of cheaply made and you can find a better product.  The tea that came with it was absolutely dreadful.  The fruit teas tasted really unpleasant and almost had a soapy taste to them.

This is my first pregnancy, so I want to remember as much as possible.  I figured there is no better way to remember my stomach than to cast it, so I bought the casting kit.  We laid the drop cloth over a chair, filled a pyrex with water, and got working (well my boyfriend did- I just sat there).  It was incredibly messy, but very easy to do.  We were able to pop the cast off in less than 15 minutes and it was fully dry a day later.  Also, there was enough material leftover to do at least one more cast, so it might be fun for others to do one cast in both the 2nd and 3rd trimesters.  I am excited to have my belly cast and the next step for us to sand it and decorate it.  I highly recommend this to all pregnant women who want a special way to remember their big stomachs.

I did not realize there were not microwaveable when I ordered them... perfect  except for that.  a good deal for a little one as they DON'T  break when thrown on the  floor by little one as she  Feeds the Dog

Bought this blanket for my 20 month old son. Like any parents was concerned with the danger of giving him a blanket that could pose a potential risk but that would keep him warm at night. This blanket solved that problem! It's warm, cozy, super soft and breathable. I folded it a few times and put it over my face and you can really breathe through it. It's wonderful and my son loves it!
bought this for a friend who uses pickling spices alot and he was very happy with the product and will be buying more
This tea does relax my mind, and it has a light, pleasant flavor too. I happily would recommend this tea.

I noticed some reviewers have said that this is not a needed item. Live where it snows or gets really cold and it IS!!! There are safety guidelines that state that babies shouldn't be placed in an infant carseat while wearing heavy garments like a snowsuit or a jacket because the seat belt won't protect a baby as well. Can't afford the hefty $60 price tag? there are other cheaper alternatives like ebay (although currently someone is trying to sell two diva and ice for almost $20 more than the original ticket price) or Target and Walmart sell cheaper brands that might work just as well.

Durable for the most part. Easy for quick snack to throw in the diaper bag. Also can be used for other things like markers or meds that need to be tucked away but easy to find. Washes up in the regular cycle perfect.

I recommend Quality Street to all sweetie/candy lovers. Good quality chocolate and toffees and a great variety too. They were delivered on time and in excellent condition.
The only problem - they were gone too soon. Love them. You cannot go wrong with these as a gift for people of all ages. Yummy.

I have this item for only about 2 months and I dropped it only once.  It broke after I dropped it only once.  I do not recommend at all if you have toddlers or happen to be tired from being up with a newborn and are a little clumsier than usual.  I also called Motorola and they refused to fix it or give me a replacement unit even if I was going to pay for it.  Do not buy this!

I was reluctant to purchase the valance after reading past reviews stating that this valance would not match the one that came with the Lambs and Ivy Enchanted Forest nursery set.  I was pleasantly surprised, the valance was identical.
Just can't drink plain water. these powdered drink mixes make it more palitable. great taste. not as strong as the raspberry flavor.

It's not as big as I thought to rinse my little one off (she's 2yrs) but for smaller babies, it can be useful for that. I just like that they float and it's something my daughter likes to stack and dunk and pour the water out (I just have to make sure the water stays poured inside the tub :) ). I was surprised how well they float upright. Definitely something to add for bath time fun.

Candy was packed in a small box with ice packs that were still cold when the package arrived the day after I placed the order. Wow! Despite filling it with this reasonably priced large bag of fresh candy, the candy dish at work was empty so quickly, I'll have to place another order. Thanks for making my co-workers happy Amazon!

This item is perfect for the new baby and I believe it will be good for at least a couple of years for passive entertainment.  Contains 7 classical melodies and each is longer than I expected.  As each song plays, 3 LED lights flash in tempo.  Seems sturdy and well made and the rings on the handle/bug body rotate.  I love it!
Excellent quality! Washed several times and no  napping or  piling,  Price a little high but worth it if remains looking good.

These thins are so versatile. I love them with both sweet and salty toppings. A great way to top these is with all natural peanut butter, banana slices, and organic agave nectar. It makes a filling snack. On the opposite spectrum, spread a thin layer of cream cheese across, then top with fresh, organic tomatoes, and spice as desired (you can make it Italian, Mexican, etc). These are delicious plain, dipped into soup, or crumbled onto a salad. I am thrilled there is a gluten free, non GMO food out there that is delicious and flexible. I highly recommend these for everyone, allergies, special food needs, or not. You will not regret it.

I absolutely LOVE this product.  I have a busy life with my toddler and infant and my husband being deployed is not much help.  It's so hard to keep things organized.  This organizer made it easy.  It's so wonderful and you don't even have to put it together.  You can take it out of the package and put it right in the closet.  Buy it!

Good tasting gluten free italian food is difficult to find. This is a great product!! I found the gnocchi to be delicious and it passess the most difficult gluten free test...the rest of my \\"non-celiac\\" family likes it too!!
The chips were awesome. Great idea for school lunches. The packaging was less than desired. Some of the bags opened during shipping and product leaked into box.

Looks Great in my son's nursery! Livens it up for the right price. Lots of compliments on it when everyone came over for the baby shower. Also shipping was fast and everything was in tact when we opened it up.
I am a great tea drinker (lived in England for 10 years) and for me this tea was a little on the weak side.I had ordered Earl Grey a few times a definitely prefer that for the strength and taste.

Really like spinach, love paneer, and the convenience of these pouches. These are yummy! A little spicy for me but wouldn't be for anyone used to spicier foods so I'd consider this \\"mild\\" though there are no heat rankings on the package. Wish more of these types of pouches had that, it's very helpful!

Also wish I could nuke these pouches, but that could be why the lower price (thirteen or so at last purchase). Great to have on hand, easy to cook. I usually make a little mess trying to squeeze the contents (which are a thick, rich consistency) into a bowl but doing it in the sink really helps keep it minimal. Don't want to lose any of it! Microwaves easily in a minute, definitely cover it! Great with naan or over rice or noodles. Slight kick for me but so good it's worth the burn. Also, the paneer is great. Large chunks of deliciousness. Not like making your own but still, oh so good.
just what I expected nice and soft and fluffy and it fit the crib so nicely

I am a big fan of Krusteaz muffin mixes -- I usually bake several dozen once a month or so (oat bran and fat-free banana are my favorites), then freeze them and have a couple for breakfast every morning (I nuke them on high for about 10 seconds each and they are ready).  I had never tried this kind before as it's not one my local grocery stores carry, so I bought a case from amazon.  The first time I baked them, they smelled AMAZING in the oven and I was looking forward to trying them.  Unfortunately, I was disappointed by the taste -- they were just very, very, very bland.  They tasted to me somewhat like vanilla muffins (I can't taste anything like almonds in them), but actually they didn't have much of a taste at all.    With my second box, I added frozen mixed berries (blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries) to the mix -- I think about a cup or cup and a half of the berries (no need to defrost them first).  This improved the taste quite a bit, so I think this muffin mix just needs SOMETHING added.    I will continue to add fruit (maybe nuts too at some point) to the 10 boxes I have left, but I doubt that I will order any more.  I really wanted to like these and am surprised no one else mentioned how bland they are.  (Maybe it's just me.)

This stuff is like none other here in the States; it is not the same as Corn Syrup, maple syrup or any other sweet stuff here.  Lyle's Golden Syrup makes for a delicious and REAL oatmeal cookie/bar, or flapjack, and also gives pecan pies a fantastic taste! This is such a great product and, through Amazon, I am able to buy in bulk and save so much money than if I just order or purchase individually or at my europ market.

The positive:   We bought this tub, because we liked the clean water idea which it definitely delivers on.  Suds, pee etc go down right away so you don't feel like your baby is sitting in dirty water.  Our newborn fit snugly and didn't slip around too much.  It was also nice to have the thermometer as nervous new parents.    The negative:  The way the tub is contoured as soon as your baby gets a little bigger his bum rests at what is basically the end of the tub and his feet come up on top of the bum rest.  Unfortunately this means his feet are always out of the water and once he gets a little older he can't really splash.  Additionally, our thermometer broke after a month of use and made this horrible beeping sound we couldn't get to stop for two days.      Our baby is 4 months and now we have to buy another tub.  If I had it to do again I would have bought something that would have lasted longer.  Especially for the price.
Hubby and I both love this tuna! It has a milder taste and is on the lower end of the mercury containing tunas. Subscribe and save makes it even better!
Great car seat! Lived up to my expectations. A little difficult to figure out at first but well worth the learning curve.

Love this monitor! Plastic is plastic, so don't drop it on hard surface or the antennae will break off. (My 11-month old pulled it off my dresser, had the cord where she could reach, won't do that again!) But so pleased, ordered it again. Clear photo and the sound goes quiet as long as there's no movement in baby's room (or crying). Great factor. Don't worry, you'll hear your baby if the move or whimper, you just won't hear static if their quiet.

I didn't realize when I purchased this that there was a pour over packet of marshmallow sauce.  That doesn't bother me too much, it tastes wonderful.  My only complaint is that I wish there was more sauce to pour onto the popcorn, it never seems to cover all of it.

The seat is well made and the latch system works well if your car has the bails under the seat for the latch clips.

The cloth covering is not very well fitted, so it interferes with opening the storage compartment.

One of the manufacturer's pictures showed the seat with cloth arm covers. The others didn't. Mine didn't come with any. The problem is in a hot car, the arms get too hot to touch. So I guess I'll put some socks on them. If I had to get it again, I'd get something else because of that issue.

I suffer from chronic constipation. This product is great for relief in up to 6 hours. No cramping, no achy feeling and relief is complete. I don't have to take it daily even though its recommended daily dosage, but when I do, overnight, I can depend on early morning relief.    I've always ordered from Uncle Lee's site but for some reason the site doesn't respond or process orders. And I've never seen this great price for multiple boxes.

This was expensive for a changing pad cover, but it was the color I needed so I figured I would give it a try.  It is not made of soft fabric or velour like most covers are, it is rough and feels paper-like.  Definitely not worth the money.
this stuff does not taste like an authentic miso salad dressing - way too sweet.  Must be all that high fructose corn syrup.

I have been enjoying Choice Irish Breakfast tea and purchased this one to try when it was on sale at my local Kimberton Whole Foods. This tea has made me a fan of Oolong! I get two 12oz cups out of each bag, brewing the first one for 3 minutes and the second for 4. I drink the first with no sweetener as I'm trying to keep my sugar consumption down. The second is slightly tannic so I use 1/2 tsp of honey and it's delicious. I wouldn't put milk in this as that would overwhelm the delicate flavor.

I like that Choice teas are organic and fair trade. I saw that some reviewers complained about the bags breaking and one mentioned that the string was stapled. The bags I just purchased are stitched and seem very secure so maybe Choice took a note from some of the other reviewers and changed their construction.

I make no claim to be a tea connoisseur but I'd say this is moderately priced for a premium tea and a good choice for enjoying every day.

I ordered this sampler pack as I prefer decaf coffee and wanted to try several types without having to order via the large boxes for each type.  It comes in a brown paper sack if that matters to you (it doesn't matter to me).  I got my order in 2 days and I got a very nice sampling of 11 types of decaf coffee k cups.  All of them were well within the "use by" dates.  The k cups were all in good condition.  I would happily order this again.

This is the 2nd Levana monitor that I've had and, just like with my first one, it has several annoying issues.  Number one: the picture freezes ALL THE TIME. Not just the standard way when there's no movement. NO. Like when I hold and kiss the baby, put her in her crib, rub her tummy a minute, walk into my room, look at the monitor and the picture is a fractured image of me holding her from 5 minutes ago! Restarting the unit doesn't always fix this issue. And it happens ALL THE TIME. My other Levana model did the same thing.  Number two: The rotation of the camera is horrible. It takes so many readjustments and weird placements to finally get a good angle for a picture. The other Levana camera that I have is able to rotate in every direction, so you simply hang it once and point the camera. Sounds simple, doesn't it? Why on earth they changed their GOOD product to the horribly limited one they have now, i have no idea.  Number three: the parent-end unit BEEPS loudly whenever you turn it on. Super annoying. Even more annoying when you pair it with the next thing on my list...  Number four: THERE IS NO MUTE! Let's face it, sometimes your kid just makes noise and there's no reason to mess with them, especially when you can SEE that they're fine. And it's 2am and you want to go back to sleep. But there's no mute on your monitor... if you turn the monitor off, then the next time you want to check on the baby IT WILL BEEP AND WAKE YOUR PARTNER UP. So you can't turn it off. But you can't sleep with that noisy baby chatter. So you bury it under the blankets and TRY to sleep. Does this sound the like kind of regular procedure you should have to perform with a device that costs as much as this one? NO!!  DEAR LEVANA: for goodness sakes, PLEASE figure out how to make a product with more efficient video quality and PUT A FRICKING MUTE FEATURE on your products!!  As for the \\"good\\" parts about this product - the music playing and talking to baby features are great. I love being able to see the actual temperature of the baby's room at all times. And the parent hand-unit is pretty self-explanatory, which is nice. It even has a stand on the back, which was a big complaint of mine on my previous Levana monitor.  In spite of the things i hate about this monitor, i still use it. So i guess it's not all that bad. But it's FAR from perfect.

Looks better in the picture. It doesn't really have a lot of structure so more floppy than i thought. Things fall out easily. You have to tie it off to get stuff to stay. It works, I just thought there was a little elastic in the top part area but there isnt.

Spelt is lower in gluten than regular \\"wheat\\" and a lot of people can eat spelt but cannot tolerate wheat. I am one of those people. The first time I bought these noodles from a local store I was amazed at how delicious they were - like really good homemade noodles without the mess of making them! I found the cooking time to be a bit longer than the recommendation on the package, but you also need to watch them so you don't overcook them.

Yes, they are a bit pricey, but I think they are worth the cost. If you belong to Amazon Prime you don't have to worry about shipping charges and that makes them a better buy.

Berlin bakery also makes a wonderful, thick, homemade style spelt sourdough bread. If you can find it anywhere I recommend it also.
I received this item and it was already open and broken into pieces.  It made a mess

This a great little mirror to use in the car.  I did find it a little difficult to attach to the seat.  After I figured out how to attach it to the seat, I am very pleased with the mirror.  I would recommend this mirror to anyone.

I was curious about these, and so I bought the least expensive selection of them.  First of all, it's a ridiculous price for what you get.  I'm sure that the reviewer who said that you can buy this for a couple of dollars at a big-box store is right.  But worse:  the candy is so stale it's hard and crumbly.  This stuff should have been thrown out.  That's what I did with it.  A complete waste of money.

I started using this product at my 4th month because I was having lots of trouble with my back pain & laying on my side.  After using it for a week or two the part that's under your belly got flat.  It really didn't work that great once that part is flat!  Also if you toss & turn a lot like me the velcro strip will probably come undone or the pillow might fold & the velcro touch your skin, ouch!!!  Now I'm in my 5th month & I'm getting more used to sleeping on my side, I still use this because it does give me some help with my back but if it isn't positioned just right it falls off my bed.  I have tried folding it and putting the wedge behind my back & that helps but of corse it does fall off the bed.
Seasonings are pre packed, just weigh out meat and mix, follow directions on packet, package meat accordingly and prepare after ageing
These are the best. They have great butterscotch Flavor, they also have twitched ends on the wrapper making them easy open.
Twins didn't really use them, because when the bottles were in the props, they were too heavy on their faces, and they'd spit the bottle out.
got the scratches out of my toilet in seconds after trying to use a hanger to remove a clog

I'm not surprised that my first Amazon review revolves around coffee.

I was spending way too much money on chain brand pumpkin spice lattes, so I decided to give this product a try. I received it yesterday, and 4 cups of coffee later I think I'm hooked. Personally, I like that it's not too sweet so I can control how sweet I want it with extra sugar/sweetener. I think, in terms of flavor intensity, 1 pump goes well with 8-10oz of coffee. Add in 1-2 packs of sweetener and it has a very similar taste to coffee shop pumpkin spice.

I was torn between this flavor and pumpkin spice, so I'm curious as to the flavor difference between the two. I might get the holiday syrup pack, and if I do, I'll update my review with a comparison.

This item is great. My 11-month old will not sleep well in a Pack n Play.  In addition, Pack n Plays are too heavy and big for air travel.  So, I decided to buy the Bjorn Travel Crib Light 2 despite its price (only slightly cheaper than my actual crib).  For the past two days my baby has taken her naps in the Bjorn crib and really likes it!  I was very skeptical because she loves her crib, and does not  sleep well anywhere else.  So, much to my surprise, my baby did take her usual 2-hour nap in the Bjorn crib.  She also played in it for a good 25 minutes without crying to get out!  So, this travel crib would be just perfect, EXCEPT for the non-mesh sides, which are somewhat unsettling to me.  They say the sides are breathable, but honestly, I don't think they are. I put my mouth against the fabric and could not really breath well,  and I am in my mid thirties! So I am not sure how they say babies can breath. I did a research and could not find any negative feedback (only one here) with bad experiences about this concern, so I guess statistics show that the bottom fabric is not really an issue.  I just wish Bjorn would improve the fabric in the bottom part of the crib in the future.

This is my favorite granola. Great taste, chewy, generous with nuts, natural ingredients, and the company has a wholesome and green attitude. Super! There is one significant caveat . . . they are very devious with the nutritional information, so beware!  The \\"serving size\\" is listed as 1/4 cup, enough to feed a small bird. I always mix this with Post Shredded Wheat/Wheat'n Bran (and use soy milk), probably the most nutritious and honest cereal out there. Perhaps the only cereal with no sugar or sweeteners (or salt). Tasty and plenty of fiber, too. And reasonably priced. If you are concerned with healthy eating, don't pass Post Shredded Wheat, Wheat n'Bran by. It has a nice crunch and taste, though mixing it with Bear Naked Fruit and Nut makes for a more roundly delicious meal. The Post Shredded Wheat/Wheat'n Bran lists a serving as 1 1/4 cups. Realistic. Compare that to Bear Naked's 1/4 cup and you will see that Bear Naked, despite its great taste, is extremely caloric. 1 1/4 cups of Bear Naked has 35g of fat, or 55% of the Daily Value and 700 calories! 1 1/4 cups of the Post cereal has 2% of the Daily Value and 200 calories. So for taste and enjoyment I would give Bear Naked five stars, but for the dishonest nutritional information, I lower that to 3.

I had high hopes for this food grinder.  The fresh food feeder is okay--my 8-month old likes eating cantaloupe from it.  But I was very disappointed by the grinder.  Here's why:  1) The grinder is shaped awkwardly.  You have to hold onto the upright middle part of the grinder while pushing downward so the food gets pushed up to the grinding blade.  It can be hard to apply enough downward pressure to do this, and it's fatiguing to push down with one hand while grinding with the other.  2) It takes a lot of effort to grind just a little bit of food.  It took me about 2 minutes of grinding to get less than 1 ounce of ground green beans.  8 minutes of grinding by hand to get a 4-ounce feeding while the baby is hungry?  No thank you!  3) Ground food is too course for my 8-month old baby.  I tried feeding him two bites from the grinder, and he gagged so hard he almost threw up.  Maybe it's okay for babies eating \\"Stage 3\\" foods, but not for younger babies.  4) The grinder is hard to disassemble.  During assembly, you rotate the metal disk into the base of the bowl so it doesn't come loose while grinding.  But there's no easy way to get the metal disk back out for cleaning.  I ended up having to use a fork to pry/rotate the metal disk out.    I'm taking the grinder back and getting a food processor instead.

Stouffer's Stuffed Peppers, 15 Â½ oz. Large Size.
These stuffed peppers are good, but taste a bit salty. For anyone with high blood pressure, and restricted to a low salt diet, the amount of salt per serving is high, about twice what you would get in a hotdog, and hotdogs are high in salt to begin with. The amount of salt in the 10 oz., one stuffed pepper package is 990 mg, and the amount of salt in the 15 Â½ oz. two stuffed peppers package is 1600 mg. The larger package has two medium sized stuffed peppers, the regular 10 oz. size has one large stuffed pepper. It is just as easy to eat all the food in the larger package, as the difference in weight is mostly in the extra tomato sauce. If the salt content is not an issue for you, go ahead and chow down, but you may have some extra water retention issues with the roughly 50% larger package of food. You will gain some temporary weight in fluid retention until the extra salt leaves your system. Warnings aside, the stuffed peppers in both packages taste good, but leave a salty aftertaste. If you like extra salt, you can always add your own, but you can't remove it once it is there. Before cooking a meal in a microwave oven, I always poke a hole in the top plastic cover and add about an ounce of water to help prevent drying out and burning. At the dinner table, I prefer adding an Italian blend of six shredded cheeses, instead of grated cheese from a shaker. For the sake of our overall health, I think all processed foods should contain far less sugar and salt.

The Nutrition Facts and INGREDIENTS as currently listed on the 10 oz. Stouffer's Stuffed Pepper package is as follows:

Nutrition Facts: Serving Size 1 Package (283g), Servings per container 1. Amount per Serving: Calories 210 (Calories from Fat 80).
Total Fat 9g (Saturated Fat 3g, Trans Fat 0g), Cholesterol 15mg, Sodium 990mg, Total Carbohydrate 23g (Dietary Fiber 3g, Sugars 9g), Protein 10g.

10/25/13 update: I received this email from Stouffer's (Nestle Frozen Food) concerning their stuffed peppers and other frozen foods as well: "To give you an example of our sodium reduction efforts, since 2005, we've decreased sodium levels of our 20 oz. and 12 oz. packages from 920 mg per serving to 820 mg per serving (from 40 Percent Daily Value (% DV) to 35% DV). We will continue to take sodium out of products moving forward. Recently, we announced a plan to decrease the sodium content across our brands by another 10% by the year 2015. This initiative includes gradual but steady recipe changes in order to bring down sodium levels without impacting taste."
Why wait until 2015? This is too little, and too late for those people with high blood pressure currently on low sodium diets. Stouffer's still has a long ways to go in terms of reducing sodium levels in its frozen foods.
