For all chocoholics out there, this is special! I received a tin of these little circle chocolates, and found them to be absolutely choco-marvelous! I couldn't believe that I could find these dainty morsels on Amazon.com. That's a double WOW! This chocolate comes in pretty tins; easy to put into a pocket or a purse. The chocolate morsels are wonderful to the taste and make a terrific gift. If you love chocolate, as I do, this is a must.
Way too pricy. I should have purchased something more reasonable. No proof that more bitter might be better.

LOVE this! Subtle, Refreshing, and Easy! Last reviewer complained that it loses the "Lemonade taste when added to 16.9. oz. H2O; NOT my experience. Perhaps that person likes the pervasive taste/flavor of 'sugary' drinks. Many sugarless powdered drinks are like cool-aid for grown-ups. This is SO much better to the palette! It's subtle and actually refreshing! Personally, I use the "16.9 oz. H2O" as a guide, not a prescription that MUST be followed. I simply add approximately 16.0-16.5 oz. H2O and it's just right. I love that I can keep track of whether or not I'm getting my MDR (minimum daily requirements) of H2O with these packets. As long as I drink at least 4/day, I'm good! As far as the subtle taste goes, it reminds me of 'Lemon flavored Water", not something like soda pop. As an adult, I PREFER that anyway, especially as I drink a minimum of 64 oz. (8 glasses/4 packets) every day.

I have to say that for the price, this cannot be beat! It's pretty much an exact copy of the $45+ rug bag, though the cloth itself is a slightly lesser quality. But to have something for the kids to put their toys/legos in to take camping...this is perfect. The shipping takes a bit longer than the 2-day amazon prime but I was not in a hurry to receive it so that didn't affect my review (I think I received it within 2 weeks of the order date).

We've taken it on 3 vacations and it is holding up really well. Kids love it and it really does save so much time and hassle.

I'm only a little embarrassed to be writing a review titled 'love this diaper.'    I recently purchased several different cloth diaper options to decide which ones I would use to size-up my 3 month old who is too big for the littlest diapers that we still have. In addition to this diaper, I bought a Thirsties Duo Wrap Snap cover, a  Thirsties Duo diaper, a couple wool pants, some Osocozy prefolds a BumGenius 4.0 and a Fuzzibunz One size. We had used Fuzzibunz perfect size small, Thirsties fitteds and covers and Kissaluvs size 0 for the newborn to first couple months stage. I ultimately decided on the Thirsties Fab Fitteds and the BumGenius as well as some prefolds to keep cost down.     These diapers, right out of the package, are super soft. They have nice soft elastic in the back and an extra snap in front for overlapping (for the tiniest little babes) at the waist as well as an adjustable rise. What I didn't quite understand before purchasing, was that these diapers have a pocket (in addition to the cotton/micro fleece pad that's sewn in) with an opening in the front and the back. This allows you to put a doubler in there for night time/ heavy wetters. My 3 month old little guy (about 12.5 lbs and 24.5 inches--long and lean) wears these on the highest rise and the tightest waist setting (without using the overlapping snap). We have already seen some seriously heinous overnight diapers with these and yet, no leaks. As another reviewer stated, it's not even wet all the way through in the morning! This diaper, paired with the Thirsties Duo cover is a great little system. It's a little on the pricey side, though, so hopefully the two sizes will take us to potty training.    I do think, as some others have stated that these may run a bit small. I don't see them taking my little guy all the way to 18 lbs on the size 1. He generally grows out of the rise before the waist. I like them so well, though, that I'll size up early if need be.    As a side note, everything I'veever purchased from Thirsties comes in a compostable package and is made in the USA. I consider these to be great added benefits!    UPDATE 9/20/2011  My son is now 16 lbs and is just about totally out of the size 1. We bought a few size 2 a few weeks ago so that we could use them at night--at 15 lbs I could no longer add a doubler and still get the waist on the size 1 to fit snugly. The size 2 are quite large but we immediately started him at the middle rise setting rather than the lowest. We now use the size two with a Thirsties hemp insert and a size 2 Thirsties cover for nights. We rarely have a leak--that usually only happens if I don't have a clean Thirsties cover and have to use one of our back-up Flips covers. He now completely soaks through the diaper and yet no leaks! I still really like this diaper but I don't see it lasting us through potty training. We only have enough of these to use at night because they're so pricey. We still mostly use BumGenius and prefolds during the day.
This sauce is  not only great for leftover  beef but pork as well.  Fantastic for the slow cooker too, the meat will be tender.

Blows all other drinks like this out of the water, ensure etc. My wife has crohns and this has been an amazing product for her. She has many strong food allergies/sensitivities and orgain has always agreed with her.
And everyone else in the family has ended up drinking it as well as its a real nice replacement meal on the go. I cannot praise this product highly enough. We've been drinking this for around 3 years now and there have been some bumps in the road as they've developed the product but the company has always been very easy to talk with and Orgain always ends up being superb.All flavors are fine and actually taste good to our kids as well but we tend to prefer the vanilla.
Highly recommended.

The mix is very good, but it makes such a large batch.  I didn't pay  close enough attention to the package size and thought it would just be a 'cup of soup' size.  I is very good soup and easy to 'doctor up' with chicken or turkey too.
Quality is great.  I'm still figuring out the best recipes with this, but I'm getting there.

Absolutely love this. I have twins and it makes my life some much easier. I actually love it so much I have one upstairs and one downstairs. It also saves money by measuring the exact amount needed. (Really on the formula package it says one unpacked scoop, how do you do that)You choose the setting based on brand and type of formula. Great for night feedings when you are "sleep walking" for lack of sleep and just have to push one button. I have seen some not so good reviews but with regular cleaning and following the directions I have had no problems.
The little washcloth loops pulled out as soon as I removed the tape they were packaged in. I don't expect these to last very long. Boo.

This is one of the best solutions ever for dining out with a toddler. It keeps our hands free - no more having to hold plates down while the littlest one eats.

The only negative for us is that you have to take off four separate strips to place it...and hope your kid doesn't stop you in the process. Once you pull it up, it won't really stick well again...and the process can be a little consumer.

Our youngest kiddo loves the pictures on it too!

I was really looking forward to getting this seat as my son loves Sponge Bob Square Pants and I needed something to protect his car seat that would make cleaning it daily an easier task.  This cover may work for some car seats but it did not work for mine.  It would not stay covering the seat but rather fell off and annoyed my son (and us).  We ended up donating this seat cover after a week.

I like VERY VERY spicy food and most chili flakes just don't cut it. D&A has clearly used very spicy peppers, and the grinder makes it so that you don't notice the seeds and flakes in most food you put this in. Just be careful because most people find this to be significantly more spicy than any red chili flakes they've ever had.

I use this inside of my hard plastic tub for baby. It helps to keep her warm and from slipping. I don't know why they don't just include something like this with all hard tubs. It has kindof a wierd smell but I've only used once so far, and I think that will decrease with a few uses. I just wring out to dry after each use.
I bought this pasta making crafts with my kids.  We ended up dedicating one box for crafts and the other boxes we ate.  The kids enjoyed the different shape.

These sucks!!!  I don't usually like to give reviews but this one is a no buy.  It's not kid friendly as my 5 yr old can't open it by himself.  Every time he needs a sip of water I need to be around. After just a few months of using this, my 20 months old just accidentally drop it on the floor and it cracked.  Keep in mind he dropped it at his height, like less than 3 ft height.  So pretty useless product.

Bought them because I thought they were cute and would brighten my day,  However, that enjoyment only happened for one bath event.  These DO NOT stick to your tub.  I would not buy this product if you want your bathtub decals to last for more than 2 or 3 showers.

Folds smaller than some other models. Easy to wash in the sink or with a garden hose and dries overnight. Can not be used with pedestal tables or with tables that have a decorative 'lip'. Does not work on round tables. Awesome for dining out and the baby prefers it to his own high chair. We started using it at 5 months and he's now 27lbs and a yea told and still comfortable in it.

This stroller is just what we needed. It is fairly small as "double strollers" go. Our kiddos are older but it's working fine for them. We have a just-turned 5 year old and a 2.5 year old who is more like the size of a 3-4 year old, so they can be heavy when both on the stroller. It did make some squeaking noises on one of the wheels the third and fourth time we used it, but the squeaking went away; I think the wheel was just adjusting to their heavy combined weight. We are probably over the weight limit but the stroller has been fine. The purple color is nice.

I got the great idea from another review on here to get a bungee-style cargo net (usually for bicycles or motorcycles) and use it as a backrest/kind of hammock style net for the child in the back to sit facing forward. It's sort of hard to explain and I haven't taken a picture of it yet, but basically you stretch the net between the two bars in the back. The cargo net will usually have hooks that will easily hook onto the bars. Then your kiddo in the back can sit facing forward and rest their back against the cargo net. The only problem I have with this is, they have to put their feet into the basket under the stroller. This is a bummer because my older kiddo tries to stand in the basket or put a lot of weight on it, and I don't think the basket will hold up to well if they do that too often. Then if the basket breaks I would be hard pressed to find something that will work, and their feet would just be dangling (or in my kiddos case, maybe dragging on the ground) and you wouldn't have the basket anymore, which is a pretty roomy and nice basket. In any case, we usually use it as it is meant to be used, and I'm planning to just hang onto the cargo net for taking trips to Disney or somewhere that both kids may need to take a nap in the stroller.

Just a few other things I wanted to mention, the sun shade is nice and can be moved so it covers more of the front kiddo or back kiddo, but my kiddos just kept yanking it back and forth because they both wanted it, so I just removed it. It is very easy to remove. The table for the front seat is nice, but can be hard to remove because the "buttons" that you need to press to remove it are not easy to press and you sort of have to press both at the same time. It's still nice and we use it often; definitely not a deal breaker. Also, the footrest for the front seat is short; specifically the foot part. It is not too short for her legs, but it's hard for her to keep her feet on it because it's less than half the length of her foot (kind of hard to explain). This is also definitely not a deal breaker though, because I know my younger kiddo is older than most kids that would be riding in the front and she also has large feet for her age.

I ordered small/medium , but It wrote down those.
Item Weight 4.8 ounces
Product Dimensions 29.5 x 20.5 x 0.2 inches

Really good flavor, be sure to slice as thin as possible because the casing can be objectionable trying to chew through.  Bought 6 pounds some have more grease than others but still really good.

We haven't used these to bake yet (although we will soon with Halloween right around the corner).  However I opened and tasted the spring green color and it tastes good and a little unusual - remember it is colored with spinach - I think it tastes like turbinado sugar, which we all love in my house. I think once it is baked it will taste just like regular sugar cookies. The sugar is made up of sugar crystals, it is not the refined granules we are all used to which I think will add a fun touch to the decorating process for the kids.  My kids have a strong reaction to regular dyes in colored sugar and other unaturally colored products, so I was very happy to discover this product.  India Tree also makes naturally colored food dyes which would be good for frostings and such.  We haven't tried it yet, but I am going to order that next.

When I first got this product, I was pissed. I was sorely mistaken. My baby girl soaked right through this liner! It feels like a dryer sheet and is simply for cleaning up solids from baby's diaper. Though I have a 1 year old son, I actually purchased the Corner Kushions to protect my head from the corners of low, exposed HVAC ductwork in my basement. I originally bought this coconut oil at a health food store because they had some sort of promotional sale, and I moved soon after, so this big jar ended up in storage for more than a year. I finally came across it when sorting through boxes, and assumed it would go in the discard pile. I know how delicate some oils are, and rancid oil is especially bad for you. So it was surprising that this jar was still as fresh as new - I later read that coconut is one of the most stable oils.

At first it was a little alarming that the oil in the jar normally resembles something like shortening or the lard we had on the farm, or it can melt in the jar and be clear when the room temperature is higher in summer. But I take it by the spoonful right out of the jar. It is also good for cooking, like scrambled eggs and so on, I use it interchangeably with butter now. I also really like it on my skin for moisturizing after a shower.

Don't mind those that have complained about bitterness or purity...blah ...blah...blah. Chances are they are not using a good technique. Or maybe they just hate it....? Or they are matcha snobs.

Anyways... I just wanted to try out matcha and I bought this. I have never had it before and was looking for something that would give me an extra boost in the evenings. Well....it does that...So well in fact I have found that I cannot drink my matcha pass 6:00 or I will be up til 1am.

Here is my recipe for a delightful 32 oz energy drink:
1. In to a pyrex cup put 1 tsp matcha (...or maybe a little bit more....) and 1 tsp of your favorite drink mix (I use a Peach Mango mix that is sugar free)
2. Warm up some water ...1 cup hot water (DO NOT BOIL!!!! The key to non bitter match is hot water. But not scolding hot water.)
3. Pour hot water over your matcha and drink mix.
4. WHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHISK or stir. I have a hand held whisk that is easy to use but whatev.
5. Add ice and water the rest of the way.
6. ENERGY!

PS. I hated Matcha lattes they tasted like milky grass. But the drink above is fabulous.

This seat cover is just what I was looking for, as I have two children who are rear-facing. It covers the entire seat, seat back and protects my leather from my toddler's messy shoes and frequent seat kicking. I have two other seat protectors and they really cannot compare to this one; my major complaint being that they do not attach to the head rest like the Brica does. This prevents the cover from falling down or shifting to one side.

The Brica seat protector is easy to clean and seems very durable. There is also a raised edge around the base that works to "control" the crumbs that come flying out of my toddlers hands. The only negative thing I can think of is that the seat sort of stinks when you first open the box, you might want to air it out a bit before placing it in your car.

I regret that I didn't buy this seat protector before I wasted money on the other two...

I have a 3 month old baby that was born congested. I started with the bulb sucker and thought it worked fine until I tried this. While it was a little disconcerting at first to use my breath to suck boogers it was way more effective than a bulb sucker. I give my little guy a spritz of saline and within a few minutes I can get him cleared up. This things helps us all get a better nights sleep.

Proceed with caution as normal, but these have been amazing for us with an infant. The scissors have slightly curved blades and the tips are rounded for extra protection. Like one of the other reviews I read, I found that the wine did have a slight bitter taste when we tried our initial bottle, but once we gave it a few more weeks to mature, it sweetened slightly and the after-taste disappeared.  We have shared this with several of our friends and have had very favorable comments.  I'm very happy with kit and am looking into other varieties from Vino Itialiano.

For those who haven't tried it, Marley coffee is amazing. We've tried four different blends and i've realized that despite drinking fairly high-end brands I've never had good coffee until Marley. Best potty ever. I have potty trained two children successfully already, but with my third when she was 2 I had just given birth to baby number 4 and was in grad school so I didn't have the time to devote to potty train her on an adult toilet like I did with my first two. This potty has saved my life and potty trained my daughter in pretty much a day.

The tune it plays when she goes makes it so I don't have to sit there and watch for the slightest bit of urine to come out so I can jump and cheer. She caught the hang of when she needed to pee in a snap and in one day was putting herself on the potty as need be which left me free to attend to my newborn and catch up on school work!

This potty is a must for any busy parent to facilitate potty-training!

With a new baby, I needed some storage for toys in our living room. Because we don't have enough rooms in our house to designate a specific playroom, we instead designated a corner of our living room as a play space. However, I could have all the toys cluttering up the rest of the room. This was the only toy storage container that didn't look ridiculously childish for a mature space, and it holds tons of everyday toys. Seriously, you can't quite gauge the size in this picture, but these puppies are deep while remaining compact enough for a corner.

We bought two and stacked them. Very easy to assemble and of great sturdy construction. I couldn't believe what we actually got for the price. I would buy ten of these if I really needed them. Absolutely the best choice we could have made.

This swing is my daughters favorite place in the whole world (apart perhaps from her Dad's arms!)... and it always has been.  Our daughter is now 4 months old, but we bought this swing when she was 5 weeks, and I must say this was the most worthwhile $130 I have EVER spent.  It is sooo comfortable and there is very little negative I can say about it.  Amy, our daughter was colicky up till 10 weeks, and although at times nothing would console her, this swing was always our best bet.  She just relaxes with the side-to-side movement... she much prefers this than front-to-back, but it is good to have the option.  The shape of the cradle means she feels secure and comfortable and the tunes are soft and relaxing.  She doesn't seem a big fan of the nature sounds, and yes, its true, all she sees of the overhead mobile are the l'il critters feet... but really the pros outweigh the cons - I attach Tiny Love toys from the mobile and that adds more interest.  It is true that the swing mechanism clunked and clicked a little more than I thought it would, but if anything Amy likes the rhythmic sound it makes, so it turns out to be a bonus!!. Before I bought this cradle swing, I borrowed a standard swing from a friend (I think it was Evenflo) swing and there is no comparison - the side-to-side movement seems much more soothing for newborns, and they can lie/sit in a much nicer position.  This is the Mercedes-Benz of swings and in my opinion worth every penny. Now that Amy is more interactive and likes to grasp at objects the toy bar is becoming another firm favorite... again it is easy to clip other toys and rattles onto the loops of the bar.  I cannot recommend this swing more highly... GET IT!!

You'd think you can't go wrong with a basic staple like rice, right? Unfortunately, I was disappointed with this rice. Lotus Foods Madagascar Pink Rice was described as having a hint of spice flavor such as cinnamon or clove. I didn't pick up on that in the slightest. In fact, this rice had very little flavor at all. I normally buy brown basmati rice, or Lotus Foods Forbidden Rice which are fantastic all by themselves. Those rices can be enjoyed without a speck of salt or other seasoning added. The Madagascar Pink can't begin to compare.

I wish this had been available in a small package instead of an 11 pound sack. I read the full description on the Lotus Foods website and I liked the idea of this rice. The Amazon subscription price was a great deal, so I went for it. I'll still eat the rice, of course, but it will be served in recipes that don't depend on the rice for flavor like other whole grain rices provide.

I recently used it as an ingredient in a new granola recipe, and it added welcome crunch and nutrition. I especially like having a gluten-free option for times when I'm not eating wheat in my diet. The couch sits 1 child comfortably. Two children is tight, but as long as the 2 kids don't mind touching slightly, it won't be a problem.    The construction is okay. For a small piece of furniture and the price, I would have expected something much more durable. My child hops on it and falls into it and he can feel the wood frame underneath the cushioning. The arm rests have no padding on the topside, so resting on the armrests hurts because the wood frame digs into kids.    If you've ever shopped for furniture at a discount place, then you know how they cut corners to make cheaper furniture. The manufacturer has cut all the corners for this piece. Some extra padding in the back, the armrests, and the seat would have made this a more durable product without adding to the cost. Actually, I probably wouldn't have noticed all the other shortcuts taken to manufacture this item if the armrests, at the least, were properly cushioned and did not hurt to lean on.    Item is cute and looks good, but only functional if your child will remain seated in an upright position. Laying on and horsing around does not got well with this item.    Couch could have also been a couple inches longer to better accomodate 2 children sitting. I so wanted to love this stroller. The 2 stars I gave went all to the compact folded size and the easy folding mechanism. Bought it and kept it for 3 weeks, trying every way to make it work comfortably for my 9-month old, but at last we gave up and returned it.

We were so in love with the easy close/open mechanism of this stroller. No other stroller out on the market could compare to it. Using one hand, you can easily close the stroller by just pulling up the bar at the bottom and to open, you just need to pull out the handle bar and the remaining of the stroller will follow. And it's folded size is so compact that it's even smaller than my diaper bag. The weight is also acceptable to be carried on shoulder, with the shoulder strap attached to the stroller.

Maneuver is easy and smooth, even with the small wheels. I don't expect much of the storage with this compact size of a stroller, so I have no complaint. However, the one major problem that made us returned the stroller was the seat.

I wouldn't have noticed the seat problem if I didn't put my own child on. The seat, where the baby sits on, is too flat. The seat pocket isn't deep enough to hold my baby's bottom securely. Or you can say, there is no "seat pocket" at all. The sitting area is flat and the back rest is made with a wrong angle to go with the flat seat. So, my baby either kept slipping down and all slumped or had to sit herself up straight to make herself more comfortable. Either way was a pain for her. Slipping down and all slumped made all her weight gathered at the buckle. It was only the bucket holding her whole body from slipping out of the stroller. And sitting herself up straight all the time was worse, it created safety issues. Her back would not touch the back rest and so her neck lacked support the whole time when I was pushing the stroller. She couldn't stay in the stroller for more than 10 mins. After 10 mins, she would either struggled to sit up or lie down with a more comfortable position. I tried all the recline angles but none worked to make a comfortable seat. My baby would start screaming after 15 mins if she was still buckled in the Yoyo. :(

We tried it out for 3 weeks, with different reclining positions and on different types of roads; We even did some modification to make the seat a better seat (like, trying to put a folded towel in the front of the seat near the food rest, so to make the seat pocket deeper), but still, nothing worked. So we had no choice but to return it.

We still like Yoyo a lot in terms of the compact size and the easy fold, and we would even be willing to keep it if my baby wasn't crying in it. However, no luck, babies know what's best for their own comfort.

Attached is the picture of my baby sitting in Yoyo. The lower right bottom was her sitting in the most upright position of the stroller. Her back couldn't rest on the back due to the wrong angle or the seat and the backrest and she had to sit up to make herself sit comfortably. The upper right picture was her slipping down and all slumped. I unbuckled her and wanted to pull her back up and tried sitting again, but then I remembered to take a picture first. So she wasn't buckled up in the picture, but her position was exactly like this when she was buckled. And she was sitting in a halfway reclined.ggled to sit up or lie down with a more comfortable position. I tried all the recline angles but none worked to make a comfortable seat. My baby would start screaming after 15 mins if she was still buckled in the Yoyo. :(

We tried it out for 3 weeks, with different reclining positions and on different types of roads; We even did some modification to make the seat a better seat (like, trying to put a folded towel in the front of the seat near the food rest, so to make the seat pocket deeper), but still, nothing worked. So we had no choice but to return it.

We still like Yoyo a lot in terms of the compact size and the easy fold, and we would even be willing to keep it if my baby wasn't crying in it. However, no luck, babies know what's best for their own comfort.

Attached is the picture of my baby sitting in Yoyo. The lower right bottom was her sitting in the most upright position of the stroller. Her back couldn't rest on the back due to the wrong angle or the seat and the backrest and she had to sit up to make herself sit comfortably. The upper right picture was her slipping down and all slumped. I unbuckled her and wanted to pull her back up and tried sitting again, but then I remembered to take a picture first. So she wasn't buckled up in the picture, but her position was exactly like this when she was buckled. And she was sitting in a halfway reclined.

Thanks to Amazon I have finally found an instant beverage to replace my 40 year coffee addiction. Although it is not coffee it tastes pretty close and it is not a tea. While inserting the last of this plug protectors the 18 month old was handing the first ones back. I have to drink decaf tea in the evenings and before I found this Typhoo I always had to trade off decent tasting tea for being able to sleep at night. But Typhoo decaf makes a very robust and flavorful pot of tea. On more than one occasion, somebody in the family has grabbed this decaf by mistake and nobody even realized it was decaf until we noticed the distinctive round bag in the bottom of the pot. This tea is best brewed by the pot using fully boiling water. If you try to make it by the individual cup using 190 degree water or water heated in a microwave, you'll probably be disappointed. Besides compromising the flavor, brewing by the cup would be wasteful since a single bag makes a good three cups of tea. The only compromise needed when brewing this decaf over regular black tea is the decaf needs to steep a bit longer (I'd say ten minutes) for maximum flavor. Alternatively, you can limit the water to two cups and then it's ready in about six minutes. Typhoo also makes regular caffeinated black tea which I consider to be just average.
Brush is nice and soft but the comb is a bit too hard to use on a babies head!  Nice quality though.
Works just as described, in my opinion. I think that it is a solid product which I will continue to use.

These are the best sippy cups for transitioning from bottle. Amazingly, they don't really leak. We even use them in the car. My son took to them right away. I still haven't been able to get him onto any other kind of cup though. I just wish they were a little cheaper.

I love these! My 5 yr old boy wets the bed almost every night! I came across these when trying to find a solution and am so happy I did! I have not had to was his bedding at all since we started using these and I was washing it everyday! We do use an extra soaker pad because he is a heavy wetter and it does not wake him up at night when he wets.

When in Paris last October, I fell in love with Rosette de Lyon sausage. RdL and I met at a little sandwich shop near Centre Pompidou. It was love at first bite. I ate a whole sandwich in front of the gallery, then grabbed two more on my way out. The next day I went to the grocery store to get more sausage. I was hooked. No stores in the LA area seem to sell RdL sausage, so I took to the internet to find my love. It's expensive and worth it for this mild, delicious sausage. I recommend eating it on a baguette with butter and cornichons.

The flavor is very heavy not a bad heavy but thick. It's too strong in my opinion to spread on a cracker unless it's lightly. The taste is very good. My biggest problem I had was that there were artichoke thistle pieces in the mixture. I have never got spinach artichoke dip that still had parts of the silk or little thistles mixed in the mix. This is why I didn't completely love this dip. Those little artichoke is dangerous to eat this the name artichoke means if you take it out ill return as a customer again.

rec'd promptly - in wonderful condition - recommend to others!  thank you very much and MERRY CHRISTMAS!

This came with one 2011 (older) seat and a new 2014 seat. The only difference is the logo and type of buckle and is not a cosmetic issue - the colors are the same. This is an awesome carseat.  Very easy to install.  Because it's a little smaller it also fits better as a rear facing carseat, taking up less room front to back so the driver doesn't have to squeeze up against the steering wheel.  (We have it in our Ford Edge and a Honda CR-V).  I also have graco, evenflo and safety first carseats.  The Britax was more expensive but totally worth it in how much easier it is to install correctly as a rearfacing carseat (my 1 year old and 3 year old are both still rearfacing.)  You would not be able to fit three of these across unless you had a huge car though.  It also has more padding and seems more comfortable than the evenflo and the safety first seats (although my kids don't complain about being uncomfortable in any of them.)

When rear-facing, this car seat will flip towards the back seat.  This will severely hurt your baby! Look at \\"coccoro flip issue\\" on youtube to see what I mean.  And the company is aware of this problem!  Their solution is a \\"foam block\\" they ship to you.  Seriously, call them and ask if you don't believe me!!  This product should be removed from the market.  I have never been so upset with a product as I am with this one.  It is NOT SAFE!  Do not purchase!
Product was a little bigger than I thought it would be, but it is a great product, good quality.  Looks very nice on my wall!

The crib skirt must be purchased separately.[[ASIN:B002A3P60E DwellStudioÂ® for TargetÂ® Dot Fun Crib Skirt]]  There are also other matching items available. It has helped me with my cracked nipples but i havent been able to collect milk because it keeps spilling even though i placed them correctly and never bend over. Maybe if they were a little bigger for more liquid space

The ekobrew cup makes fine coffee but the design of it has caused the problems we have had.  On the bottom, there are 2 recessed inlets for the spike in the keurig machine to slide into.  The spike is used to pierce the bottom of k-cups.  If you do not place the ekobrew in just correctly, it will pierce the bottom of it, rendering it useless. The top design, although it may be the seal on my machine, does not seal and coffee spills out around the top causing a mess in the machine.  While this is eliminated with less coffee in the brew cup, the purpose I bought it for was stronger coffee than a regular k-cup.  So be cautious, if you you are barely awake in the mornings, I would not recommend this.

i use it to walk with my infant grandson. my only issue is that the canopy doesn't not extend far enough to shade him when we're walking toward the sun. i used a work around by tying a string to the velcro so it would extend further. otherwise a great stroller.

I love this tea and still think it's the perfect epitome of that rich red fruit tea. The hibiscus leaves dominate to give it a sour, anti-oxidant packed flavor. It's kind of like a zinger, except it's the best zinger I've ever tasted. I'm a pretty regular tea drinker and agree that loose leaf is the way to go, but sometimes I'll drink a tea that had to be brewed loose leaf and think, why bother? Too much time and effort for a tea that would taste similar brewed in a tea bag. But with a choice few- genmaicha, a delicate white tea, and this one- it's totally worth the effort and I wouldn't do it any other way.      This tea makes the water into a red, juicy but not overly powerful elixir. It wakes up your taste bugs with it's tartness, gives you just enough sweet to satisfy your craving but not give you a sugar spike to make you crave more. Rich, beautiful, fragrant, delicious. The ingredients are fresh, top notch, it's perfectly blended, and quite simply, it's one of my must-have teas.

Edited 11/13: Evidently the ingredients for McCormick's Pesto have been reformulated and they have removed the MSG and Nitrites that were in the old formulation. I've very pleased to say that the new ingredients are:

\\"Basil, Salt, Parmesan Cheese (Part-Skim Milk, Cheese Culture, Salt, And Enzymes), Garlic, Disodium Phosphate, Natural Flavor, And Extractives Of Basil.\\" Disodium phosphate is added to foods as a texturizer and emulsifier - it helps thicken the sauce and keeps the oil from separating.

We love pesto sauce on pasta and even on homemade pizza, and on nights when I can't make my own from scratch I love having a package of the mix waiting for me. It's ready in just a couple of minutes, and adds a savory, creamy taste to any dish. I'll be looking for this product again, now that the nasty ingredients have been removed (see below).

The OLD ingredients list was: \\"Beef, Mechanically Separated Chicken Water, Salt, Corn Syrup, Flavorings, Dextrose, Paprika, Hydrolyzed Corn Gluten (MSG), Soy and Wheat Gluten Proteins, Sodium Nitrite, Lactic Acid Starter Culture.\\" Hydrolyzed corn gluten is a fancy name for MSG It also has 480 mg of salt in each serving - each package having 3+ servings.

So maybe this should have been obvious - buy the storage bags made by the same company you bought your pump from.  But it wasn't to me, I did, and things have been tricky.    You cannot pump from an Avent pump directly into the bag (the pump head is too big), which means pouring, which inevitably means some level of mess. Stainless Steal, great. Good for transition from breast or bottle feeding to sippy.

Problems: leaky nipple when cup is on it's side (think your bag, kid's bed)
Mold easily and frequently grows under the cap. These are different than the other fogo sippies because the rubber under belly of the lid protrudes through the lid and becomes the nipple. This allows moisture and junk to collect under the lid, thus becoming a little mold factory. Bummer. Totally disgusting bummer.
My child bit pieces from the nipple. Sheesh. Everyone teethes. I thought the nipple was better quality. Apparently not.

I would never buy this again. I waited a while after buying this cup to give it a good test drive before I reviewed it... trust me, get another sippy and forget this one! Other Fogo products are amazing!! The other, hard nip sippies are great. The thermos fogo container is amazing for storing warm or cold food. This sippy... well, it sucks!

Easy to operate.  Lightweight.  Easy to clean. Sits on the ditchen counter (secured to a post, of course). Makes baby happy while he learns to self-feed.  What else does it need to be perfect?  Nothing!

We just got this for my 8-month old, and she is in love.  This offers so many textures of interest to the mouth, and curious little fingers are busy moving each of the parts and then pausing to give the whole thing a big bang on the table.  Definitely a hit with her, and I'm thrilled that it's wood with non-toxic paints!

The product description states that it will fit from 10-45lbs but my 30lb boy is already on the last/largest settings and the diaper is very snug. We can still squeeze him into it but the diaper leaves red marks. We bought a few one size and a few of the Perfect size in medium when he was 6 months and we definitely prefer the sized version. The mediums fit him when he was a chunky-legged 20 pounder and still fit him great at 30lbs (2yrs old) and a slim/average toddler. I liked the idea of the adjustable leg elastic but the elastic wore out after about 10 months of use. My advise would be to consider the one-size diaper as more of a 2-size system (med/small) and buy both the 1-size and the sized mediums and you'd still be saving money because you wouldn't have to buy a full stash of smalls and a full stash of meds. The 1-size would serve as smalls but still fit into the \\"med\\" size range and when your child got to 15lbs or so then buy how ever many size med you need to complete the stash and since the med run big you shouldn't have to buy the large size. My son still has some growing room in the mediums.
I wish it came in a resealable bag, but it worked great for my DIY dry shampoo.
my item had most of the wrappers empty and everything was sticky and stuck together
It is bit inclined, you need to check if this inclination is okay. Otherwise the quality is very good.

I try emulsions for my cakes & cupcakes, and Lorann's emulsions are definately among the best.
One of my favorites ones is orange... highly concentrate emulsions & highly recomend :)

I just received this Coconut Oil and truth be told, I only ordered this one because my current one couldn't be ordered through prime, but I have been pleasantly surprised.  My old favorite is EfaGold, so I will compare a bit.  The Eva Gold from Nature's Way has a stronger aroma upon opening, but is somewhat harder in consistency and not as easily spreadable off the bat as the Viva.  The Viva didn't have a strong aroma of coconut oil upon opening (I know that some people don't like the stronger aromas, but I do), but once I cut into it, I could definitely smell a very light and pleasing scent.  I actually put it into my teas in the morning time and like the taste of coconut oil mixed with my herbal teas.  I know this is gross to some, but for me, it's heavenly.  I also use this for my skin, hair, and cooking. I believe that coconut oil has controlled my appetite, smoothed my skin, and allowed me to loose some weight.  Time will only tell if it will meet all of my needs, but I wanted to point out the lighter less heavier coconut taste and smell, and also the creamier spreadability as I know from reading other reviews that there are many differences in opinions.  I can definitely see spreading this on toast or a bagel with ease, or even using it for frying. So the only reason I'm giving this a 4 and not a 5 is because I like a super strong coconut taste and smell.  Otherwise, it's great!  Shipped quickly and arrived in excellent condition. Hope this review helps somebody.
Very delicious! The box was a bit beaten up but the chocolate itself was just fine. I would likely buy more.

Please note that only about 50% of these actually stuck to the wall. I have gloss wall in my sons room and this kit requires you to sand the wall first. I did sand for the first one.... needless to say there is now a large unglossed portion of the wall that looks horrible!! For the amount I spent on these I expected better results. Also please note that if you screw up on the rather complicated application process there is no removing them and these are very easy to tear when applying the to the wall leaving a half cloud and a rather fustrated consumer to say the least. Thank goodness my son wasnt home when I applied them for there would have been a few new words he would have learned that night.

When you cannot run out and get a fresh batch of hummus or make your own, this will satisfy the craving. If I do not control myself, I guarantee I will eat all of them within a few hours. Addicted to great taste and an outstanding product.

These chia seeds are a great and easy way to fit in some nutrition into your diet! I just soak a tbs. of seed+tbs. of water to let the natural gelatin form, and pour it into my veggie shake in the morning for breakfast...can't taste them and I know they're good for me! A+ from me! Xxx

I use this for myself and was worried it would be too small but it's a good size. It fits about 2-4 loads of laundry, depending on the size of your dryer. The only thing I dislike about it is the sides buckle out, even with no laundry in them.

the person I gave them to for Christmas was very happy with them.

This is the worst baby product we have ever bought!!! It stopped working after two months and upon contacting Motorola I was told that I have to pay the shipping fees to have it sent to be fixed. This is outrageous for a product that sells (in Canada) for 80$. Not only that I have been inconvenienced with a defective item, but I am asked now to pay more money to have it fixed.     Cons:  - the battery does not last more than two hours  - the volume is very low even at the max setting, you can not hear the baby unless you keep the monitor very close to you.   -VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE - I will never purchase a Motorola item again after this experience    Pros  -None    Don't waste your money on this monitor, there are so many other options out there!!!

Someone suggested we try this and it is quite tasty but, frankly, I like American beef jerky better. It is seasoned with salt, pepper and coriander and is very mild and dry.  Should I order it again, I might go for a spicier version.
Unfortunately this pump didn't work for me as I have a lower milk supply but I think it would be a great pump for a mother on the go with normal supply!

When I received this, I ate one, then before I knew it I had a pile of wrappers.  They're so delicious and addictive!  I ordered 3 more packs in original, melon and strawberry. Have purchased Two Leaves and a Bud tea many times over the years and have to say that the peppermint is, by far, my favorite. The mint is clean and refreshing and the tea is high quality. The tea bags are made of a fine mesh and the leaves are large cut and release very little dust that can ruin the end of a cup. I prefer to drink my tea after steeping for 2-3 minutes (don't like it overly strong myself) and find I can usually get a decent second cup from 1 tea bag. It is one of my favorite peppermint teas though I have knocked off one star for the high price and the fact that the mesh tea bags occasionally rip if you're not careful when pulling the tag off.

My mother used to use this for seasoning. So I continue to do so. Never used it as soup. I use In spaghetti sauce, short ribs, red beans, limas, etc. I use real onions as well. When cooking beans in my slow cooker, I use vegetable broth instead of water, organic skinless chicken breast, organic coconut oil or EVOO & onion soup mix. As you can see I try to eat healthy and also reduce salt, but this Lipton onion soup mix is so tasty I find it hard to resist and like to have it on hand as seasoning. In order to reduce salt, I think I'll try using a half package instead of a whole one. Also, this is not something  I use frequently, because, I am trying to not only reduce salt but meat including chicken. But occasionally I just cannot resist because it is so scrumptious!!!!  Also when I have dinner for friends, I like my food to be well seasoned. I love this crib! My son is now 8 months old and this crib has been amazing. Your child is honestly on the table for only a few minutes and it is nice to have a pad that will wipe down when it does get dirty. The large changing pads are over priced and not necessary. After trying, and loving, the Sweet and Spicy flavor, I thought I'd expand my horizons and try some other Good Earth teas.  While I can't claim that I love them every bit as much, they're still excellent teas and well worth the time to try.    What isn't immediately apparent from the description (and requires a close look at the box) is that the teas are flavored.  In my case, I was really pleased with the added flavorings.  The black tea flavored with tropical peach was my favorite, but I also enjoyed the white tea with vanilla.  Chai is always a welcome addition, too, though there wasn't anything spectacular about the Good Earth version.  The green tea was enjoyable, but not memorable.    The one thing that disappointed me was the number of decaf teas that were included.  Because the decaf green and decaf chai count as 'flavors', you get a lot less of the best flavors (the black/peach and the white/vanilla teas). I'd prefer it if there was a separate variety pack for decaf teas, rather than mixing them all together.      All in all, though, I enjoyed this variety pack and I'd buy it again, though I think next time I'd just go for an order of either the black tea or the white tea instead.
these spoons are great.  They are rubber great for teething babies and it is a nice deep spoon that holds more than most baby or child spoons,

Update. the snack catchers didnt work well. the cheeris pieces fall out and my 2 year old thinks it is funny to shake it upside down. It is tricky to put the lid on the cup. Not a big tea drinker, unless I have the flu, and when I do drink tea, it's usually something herbal: Red Zinger, Cham., any decaf green tea, or I mix two teas in huge mug. Anyhow, I saw this in a discount bin at the supermarket for a buck and decided to try it, since it fit the bill: Green tea and decaf, plus it sounded healthful, didn't expect it to taste good.

It tastes so good, and I really like the deep red/purple color as it's steeping, that it's been calling me even when not sick, and now I'm buying a box of six for way more than a buck a box, but decided it's worth it. Delicious, drawing me away from coffee with all the half and half and sugar I add to coffee, and feeling good when I drink it.

Sorry if this sounds like a sales pitch, but I like it enough to hop on and review it, so that says something... and I'm sipping it while writing this :)

I don't bake or cook with chestnuts; if I did, any old brand would do, I suppose.  BUT, when it comes to finding a great-tasting roasted chestnut to snack on right out of the bag, these are the bomb.  As a kid, my relatives up north always shipped raw chestnuts down to our house for the holidays.  Dad taught me how to cut a slit in the shell, then bake them in the oven, and then carefully peel off the shells (torture).  Loved the smell and the taste.  I have tried the Galil brand and the Gefen brand from Amazon.  The Galil wins hands down--they are moister, fresher, and better tasting. Sometimes,  I empty the bag onto a paper towel so it can absorb some of the excess moisture that has collected on the outsides of the chestnuts (they are not slimy or greasy, as some readers have commented). While none of the roasted and peeled chestnuts look very appetizing, they are certainly delicious.  And I do not miss the tedious cutting, cooking, and peeling that I had to do" in the old days" before I could enjoy them.

I grew up in a town North of Chicago with a large Jewish population. Halvah was a treat that we had in our house all the time, the only place you could buy it was the deli. It came in 2 flavors: plain and marbled (chocolate like). You bought it by the ounce from the deli guy who would cut it off the block of halvah. When delis stopped carrying it, we were able to find the chocolate covered sold in pharmacies and local small markets. Fast forward 30 years, had moved to Northern California and not had halvah in years. Then I see it at Real Foods. The first bar I bought was stale so my opinion was it wasn't the halvah I knew. I bought a bar a while later, hopefull and to give it another chance--that bar was less stale. I advised the buyer at Real Foods about it being stale. I bought a bar again recently and it was fresh and delicious, exactly the way it should taste and the right texture (texture is important)

The texture and taste is something people who know halvah can appreciate. I treat myself to one of there bars whenever I shop at Real Foods but not more than once a month It's strictly a treat because it's very high in fat and calories.

I give this bar 5 stars, as long as the bars are fresh. Yummmmmmmm.

I loved Fog Chaser when I first found it and even subscribed for monthly delivery. It was shortly afterwards though that I noticed my Keurig machine was brewing full cups extremely slowly - it was taking twice as long to brew a cup. So I did all the cleaning and maintenance suggestions found on You Tube - whatever could be taken apart and cleaned, was, yet there was minimal improvement. I was thinking my Keurig brewer had seen it's better days and needed to be replaced soon.

Then came Christmas and I ordered a few new coffees I wanted to try and much to my shock, when loaded with new std plastic k-cups, the machine brewed faster than I've ever seen.

What happened? - Fog Chasers have a unique cloth/mesh bottom and the brewed coffee isn't forced out of the bottom pierced hole when the handle is pushed down to brew. This results in more of a drip effect which aside from being slow, has coffee spraying out causing a mess instead of creating a steady stream!

So as much as I like the taste, I've given up Fog Chaser because I can't deal with the slow brewing speed and spraying mess. I'm now on Donut Shop and Brooklyn Bridge Blend - both very clean and moderately strong.
Simple appearance and blends in well.  Works as described and good picture.  no complaints after first few weeks.

These are noticeably a bit thinner than the typical Medela bottles but have held up just as well through my 5 months daily use. It was irritating, at first, that the markings on the bottles are harder to see when filling them so I just used a colored sharpie and marked the full oz lines, now, no complaints :) Certainly a good value and I now wish I had purchased more of these in the beginning instead of the typical, more expensive version.

I love brewing loose leaf tea, except for the bits of tea leaves that inevitably end up in the bottom of my tea cup!  I have bought so many tea infusers hoping to find one that keeps the sediment to a minimum.  I might have found that with the TeaSpot Tuffy Steeper.  This is such a great idea!  I love the fact that you can collapse it to make it easier to carry with you.  It comes with a lid to cover the infuser while the tea is steeping, keeping the tea nice and hot.  The holes in the infuser are so small!  If you use a good quality loose leaf tea, I don't think you will have any problem with bits of tea leaves getting through.  The little handle on top is kind of odd.  I am not sure why it doesn't go the other way but you can use it to pick the infuser up out of the tea when you are done brewing.  It does displace a lot of water, so fill your cup up as much as you can while the infuser is in the cup.  The shape does allow the tea leaves to open up during the steeping process which gives you a great cup of tea.  Love it! Will use it all the time!

My kid loves this little chair. It is the perfect size and seems very comfy. Our child care person had gotten 4 of these chairs and a table from the same company for the kids she takes care of. I saw it at her house and noticed that my child was very attached to that chair. So I went ahead and got one to have at our house. My kid is 18 months old and she drags this chair around to sit on at different corner of the house. She sits on it to read a book, drink her bottle, put her boots on or just sit. While we do know how to swaddle with a regular blanket, we prefer using this Miracle Blanket. We find it easier to get a tight swaddle that lasts with a squirming baby. We have yet to use this exactly as stated in the instructions (with the flaps going around his arms and then under his back), but it still works great. I love love this product. A friend recommended this brand to me through a food thread on a recipe website. I can't buy it locally, so coming here to amazon is my go to place. And when I'm going through other towns and come across it..I buy what I can and stock up. I can't rave enough about this line of sugar replacers. This is a great quality product. I have used the confectioner's sugar in this line to make sugar free frostings for cupcakes with success, it's also the only line that has a confectioners' sugar which makes it \\"ideal\\" to use. You really can't go wrong with using any one of ideal's line of replacers subbing for real sugars. Thank you very very much.
