I recommend buying one size larger than you need as they do shrink a bit in the wash.
It's a blue wooden J.  It has a little kickstand type of thing to stand on a shelf.

We've had this car seat for several months now and I love it. The cover cleans easily with a wipe down or comes off to put in the washing machine. The adjustable headrest makes adjusting the strap height much easier than re-threading. The LATCH system is easy to use and loosens and un-clips MUCH easier than some other systems.

I would recommend this product 100% with enthusiasm to any new parent.
Very poor picture quality, horrible range. Returned this and bought a different camera which was cheaper and we better quality
We just started using Grovia's hybrid system and they are quickly becoming my favorite diapers! They are a very nice fit on my 2 month old. No leaks so far!
They're pretty good. Not awful, but not my favorite of the chocolate covered gummy bear industry. I'll finish them off, but probably won't purchase again.

This wonderful swing has been a life saver. My baby loved being on the swing since we came back from the hospital. Now, she is 3 months old and she still loves it. Every time I got tired of rocking her, I would put her on the swing and she was very content. The trick is that if the baby is fussy, you have to calm the baby first and then the baby will be fine in the swing. Now that she is 3 months old, she loves the little fish that spins around, the lights, and she loves the music selection that puts her to sleep. Great Item to have, it's a must.
Actually EasyPouch doesn't fit all the sizes. I bought a Squooshi reusable (4.7 fl.oz; 130 ml) and they doesn't work together... Easypouch is too small.

This review is for the strawberry flavor, in case the listings ever merge. (It'll be pretty similar to my review for the raspberry flavor because they're pretty similar.)

First off, be careful when you open the package. These are little tiny pieces, maybe around the size of green peas (but cubic in shape).

I like these. They're a little bit like gummy candy although softer (they're vegan, though). They're pretty addictive. The strawberry flavor and scent are prominent. These have a lot of fiber (6g in a 1.4 ounce serving), a lot of vitamin C, no sodium, and very little fat. Here is the ingredients list since I didn't see it on the product page:

Strawberry, plum, apple puree, apple juice concentrate, organic baobab fruit pulp, black carrot juice concentrate, citrus pectin, natural flavor, rice flour and vegetable oil as a coating agent.

Sugars are kind of high, but they're natural fruit sugars and not added. These are much more interesting as a vitamin C supplement than a lozenge and are flavored strongly enough that you'd be able to taste them, even with a cold. These are also a more healthful alternative than "fruit" snacks with artificial colors and added sugars.

Harvesting the baobab provides sustainable income for women in southern Africa (according to the package) and 10% of profits are donated to a foundation run by the manufacturer that supports sustainability and fair trade of the baobab tree (among other goals).

The hot sign glows even if the water is cold, kind of ridiculous, but it is a great little bath toy that my baby loves so I kept it.  Great if you plan to use it for anything other than hot water bath safety.

These spreads are very good but expensive (which is why i gave it 4  vs. 5 stars).  I found all varieties quite tasty great with French bread. I actually preferred the taste refrigerated, as the product seemed to develop a slight oily flavor at room temp (but still good).  Like a previous reviewer, I too â€˜sat and ate one all by myself with crackers......lolâ€™.

I'm confident that the quality is good, but I was expecting it to be a little roomier. I'm 5ft 2in and about to deliver any day. I'm over all not that big but the chair made me feel big. Hoping when I get back to my normal size I'll feel like there's more room in the seat. Wish the seat was longer and wider for the money I paid. The cushion feels firm and comfy, like it'll last long.

These are much cheaper than the ones you can buy anywhere locally. The attachment for the pacifier is like a small ribbon and my son loves to chew it. I don't think it will last long. I like the material of the whole thing because it's easy to clean though. The end where it connects to his shirt works well too, Hardly ever falls off compared to the more expensive brands.

The assorted package comes with extra \\"apples\\" which happens to be the most yucky one.  The pear was not bad, only the bananas in the strawberry bananas was decent to eat, strawberries were way too tangy
This stroller is great and my grand baby loves it. She is all smiles and so is her Mom.
Our baby's arms couldn't fit, the "wings" are too short and the baby's arms were mangled in it. She is an average size baby for her age (2.5 months).

Very convenient, but it depends on the individual who will be using this product. It was easy as it went in the microwave to be sterilized. I think it is a little better than the stove making life a tiny bit easy. The only thing I will say is that if you have banned a microwave from your house because of the plastic with the heating, I'm trying to figure out more research on this but so far it seems safe. So far.
Where has this stuf been all my life it was amazing i cant wait to use it in other recipes

This tea has gently but steadily improved my skin, even throughout a week of eating much more poorly than normal!! I've been drinking 2 cups a day for about 10 days now (I missed one day) and I am SO happy with the results. Stubborn, deep zits are drying up, my forehead is getting smoother, scars are fading, and new pimples (a result of some late-night cookie and bread binges) are going through their cycle much more quickly than normal. I can't wait to see what this tea does when I'm actually eating properly.
Herb power!!!!!!

I was skeptical about this cake when I first saw it in a local store called "A Taste of Kentucky". The packaging was cute (a wooden box that resembles a bourbon barrel), but it gave off a "fruit cake" vibe.

Luckily, someone brought this to an office party and I was able to get a taste.

The bourbon flavor is very pronounced, but that is kind of the point. The flavor is a perfect match for dense chocolate and yellow swirled cake (think bundt cake texture here). The glaze on top is mostly decorative, but the toasted pecans on top add a perfect hint of crunch.

This cake is very moist and dense. These characteristics, paired with the sturdy packaging, make it the perfect candidate to survive a cross-country voyage in the mail. This year, I have sent a number of these to far away friends as gifts. The recipients have, universally, been delighted.

Since I no longer have a choice, I've begun branching out in my normally decent diet, now GF. Boy, are these ever tasty! Not as sickeningly sweet as pop tarts, there's a good ratio of crust to filling & it's just enough to heat up nicely in the toaster. 1 to a package, 5 per box & you'd NEVER guess each one has 4 gm of fiber! :)
I'm a minestrone lover, and Wolfgang has definitely hit the mark on this one!  Best Minestrone in a can by far!
This is my second jar and it is now a house hold essential. My husband uses it to shave, I use it as a moisturiser for my children and I and for our hair.  Excellent product.

I purchased this booster seat to take on vacation with us because it breaks down and is easy to transport.  It took up little room and was perfect for our trip.  We used it in restaurants (cause lets be honest, the chairs they have are disgusting!) and never had any problems.  It wipes down easy and the cover on the back comes off quick and easy to wash.  My daughter is comfortable in it.  We use this one at home now instead of the bulkier one we used for her as an infant.  I do not have any complaints about it and would recommend it to anyone with a little girl.

Saw this as I was perusing a local pharmacy for a decent light lunch. I was about to settle for one of those cold cut and crackers deals when I saw this and snatched it up. It was perfect. A nice light healthy lunch power packed with protein. It came with sesame crackers (very tasty), humus, a very tasty fruit and nut mix, roasted edamame and a small square of dark chocolate. The great thing about this product is there is not alot of sugar (the chocolate is sweetened with beet sugar), NO MSG (which is a big reason I love this product!), and the fruit and edamame really is tastier than you will find in other mixes. My only complaint is that there should be more crackers...: Still, I am loading up on these and they're gonna be my main lunch for the next few months :)

I would like to add that there have been a few negative comments about how hot and spicy the nut mix is. I eat alot of hot spicy foods. I like the spicy nut mix and didn't think it was all that hot and spicy. Perhaps, at first there's like a burst of spice flavor... but any heat dissipates quickly. If you have never eaten jalapenos, chile, or turmeric, you might find it has too much bite for you. The kind of heat that is in the mix may bother some... in this case, eat just a few at a time along with your humus crackers. If you gobble the whole bag down at once, this may be a problem if you can't handle heat. The humus will help dampen the heat ;)

LATE NOTE (09/2013) - I am glad to see that Go Picnic has rotated some of their side snacks. What this means is that you may not actually get the exact snack that is listed. For instance you may think that you are going to get a chocolate wafer, but instead they substituted chocolate almonds. I was getting a bit bored with the \\"same ol' same ol'\\" thing and am glad to see that they change them around every once in awhile. It is stated on the box that the actual side snack may differ. But you will note, that the main lunch item remains the same, although some different brands have appeared.
Not only is it convenient, but somehow I get more when I pump when I use this. Even when I single pump, I use this bra because I get more milk.
The flavor is great, but it contains sugar and I have a hard time understanding why sugar is needed in seeweed snacks.

I love the curved sides of this changing pad, keeps my wiggly little grand kid from rolling off while I change her. It must be comfortable too, because she seems to like it, especially with the plush cover which is sold separately.

Now this happens to be the WINNER! Found it in smaller size @ food market, and since I cook with garlic, herbs, etc tried it. It has been perfect from salmon to soup. No doubt the best I use from McCormick. This product will STAY in my cabinet. And the larger bottle, well saves another store trip and cost is less. Cannot be without this seasoning.
If you like peach flavored candy then get your self a bag of these right now !

In the interest of adopting a healthier lifestyle, I decided to decrease the amount of sugar and sugar products I was consuming. When it comes to the beverages I enjoy everyday, my morning coffee let the pack. I was addicted to those flavored coffee creamers that are delicious, but contain many things bad for the human body.

This chocolate-raspberry liquid is delicious, and like all new food changes, did take some time for my taste buds to enjoy fully. Sugar is extremely sweet. My taste buds were used to that level of sweetness. So when I switched to this stevia liquid, at first, the subtle flavoring levels were not apparent. I use about a dropper full in every cup of coffee, although the instructions suggest a few drops. I may decrease the amount in the future, but for now, that amount satisfies my taste buds.

Now that I've been using for about a month, I appreciate the delicious flavors, and have subscribed to auto-ship every month. For me, this was the perfect solution to my flavoring challenges.

Forget that gas station jerky.  Biltong is by far the superior fare.  I drive throughout the southeast US solving problems for my clients and need a healthy snack along the way.  Biltong fits the bill.  Its all natural and tastes great.

Not sure if it's because I have a different palate compared to others who have reviewed this tea, but I find it obscenely weak. Let me just say that generally, I like Stash tea. Their Earl Grey is pretty good for the price, as are some of their other selections, but this blend is utterly weak. I made a cup (a fairly large mug, but still) using THREE tea bags and only then did it get any sort of appreciable flavor. In comparison, I only use two bags of Earl Grey when using this same cup and the flavor is much more developed.

Maybe rooibos just isn't for me, or maybe this blend is just too mild. Either way, if you prefer strong tea, I would seek elsewhere. If you want a strong, spicy tea, I would suggest trying Harney & Sons' hot cinnamon spice. Now THAT is a strong, spicy, naturally sweet tea. In comparison, using one sachet probably gets the same or maybe even a bit more flavor in this mug.

Wish I would have had this in the hospital...let alone at home once we got there.  I got this a month after my son was born and it changed my life for the better.  Still use it and my son is 6 months old now!
Color and taste confirms that Blueberry is the predominant ingredient, maintains its great flavor from hot to cold.  The health benefits are a bonus
I;ve always loved Eight O'clock coffee and now it's delivered for breakfast and all day The price beats the grocery store and beans are fresh and tasty

I've tried Scottish Breakfast Tea from various tea companies and think this is one of the best. This tea starts my morning off just right. Great full flavor with a smoothness I love. The affordable price and the ease of ordering by the case made it an exceptional offer. Please bring this product back soon! My supply is getting low!

It came the very next day as ordered and my wife and I were excited to take the imprints - only to find out that the ink was dried out and did not smear the ink well on my newborn's hands and feet. Added some water and removed excess water and then the ink was well distributed.
Almost returned it thinking that it was no good until I tried adding water. If you add water make sure you tap extra liquid/ink out with some paper towel.
I drink tea because it is the best alternative to other drinks, but this one is just excellent in taste. I hope it's good for my health as well.

This is a temporary device due to the fact that the bottle is so small that when you clean it and push water through the tube, the bottle doesnt force enough liquid through the tubing in order to get it clean.  So to prevent bateria growth this is recommended to be used only for 24 hours.  This is per Medela.  Now, onto our review,...This stopped working after two uses.  We ended up buying the regular SNS instead.  The liquid stopped flowing into the reservoir nipple and we had to manually squeeze the bottle to make it flow.  NOTE THIS IS FOR BREASTMILK ONLY.  FORMULA IS TO THICK TO FLOW THRU THE TUBING AND WILL LEAD TO HOUR LONG OR MORE FEEDINGS.

Nothing else to say other than absolute perfection. The fact that there is no colouring agents and know the containing ingredients puts a smile to my face. The taste and texture and is perfect for anything. Trust me, the extra money is worth it you will not regret it.

My daughter loves the music and lights combination, and with it's compact size, we've taken it  with us to doctors appointments, in the car, shopping, etc. Babies receive so many vaccinations in the first year that this toy combined with a pacifier was great for distraction and soothing after those painful moments. It also buys me a few more minutes in the grocery store!

really excellent. suggest watch 'you tube' videos on 'chinese street food' for many ideas on use for noodles/rice. i only use partial contents for each meal and refrigerate remainder for another time...............lots of other varieties can be ordered from asian home gourmet site.
I love tamales and this brand is very good for canned tamales..I am pleased with my choice..Thank you Amazon for speedy service..

I thought these would be perfect for my Grandchildren who always want their own water bottle. We buy Zephrhills but the tops leaked and wouldn't stay threaded on the bottle tightly. We tried a couple other brands of water and the tops leaked on them too. Overall a pretty useless product.

This is one of my favorite chocolate from Kinder Bueno. It use to be my top favorite, but there is also the Happy Hippo from Kinder which is so very good. Also a must try.

Kinder Bueno: each stick has four chambers, the outside is a wafer type material, while the inside is filled with hazelnut chocolate. There are 2 sticks per package. It is addictive. Some people say that one stick is enough. But there are days when I can eat 3 or 4 of them.

I absolutely love hazelnut chocolate. When I'm dieting, this is one of the few chocolates that I would eat.. since I believe in saving calories for the best.

These make about the BEST chai I think I've ever tasted.  Easy to brew, delicious to drink and doesn't break the budget.  This review isn't long, but I don't think it has to be with a product this good.  Thanks!

I am the picky type when it comes to most foods, but I love this product. I'm even more picky about how much money I want to pay for treats. So, I hardly ever allow myself to buy Jelly Belly jelly bean until l I saw the Belly Flops. I've gone through a couple of bags. I have gotten 99% great flavors!The bags I have gotten had plenty of sours, cinnamon and lemon but only a few licorice. The mix of flavors has been great for me. Some of the jelly beans are stuck in clumps, some are tiny, some are misshapen or they have specks of colors from another flavor stuck to them. Once in a while you might get a strange flavor that is unpleasant, but the vast majority of them are fantastic!!  A real treat for me, that's for sure.

Overall, I think this is a great diaper bag for the price. Material is easy to wipe down, design is cute, love the pockets/compartments on the outside of the bag and the bottle pockets on the outside as well. The interior is also lined with easy to wipe down and mesh pockets, all great for organizing. The small zipper pocket on the front of the bag is the perfect mommy pocket... Just big enough for Yor keys, phone, and some cash/cards! My only complaint is that it's smaller than I was hoping. It's a big bag for the brand, and as a mother of twins still in diapers and taking bottles I was hoping for it to fit our overall needs better. But, I would definitely recommend this bag for a parent with only one baby, and it's a great alternative for me for when I know we will be out for just a short trip (that way I can leave our monster of a diaper bag at home unless were going out for several hours)! Another great feature is the gripping stroller clips... Much better quality than the others that have come with my diaper bags with MUCH higher price tags :)

My 3 month old really likes this.  It's taken him awhile to enjoy it because of his age, but he's starting to really get into staring at the toys and grabing at them.  It has a good amount of  removable toys hanging from it and an attached mirror in one corner.  Also 3 flowers on the mat that light up when the music is turned on.  Things I like about it are that the toys are of good quality as well as cute and the mat is nicely padded.  It also has a few different interesting features such as a crinkely elephant ear, furry zebra mane, squeaky bird, etc.. which are on the mat itself.  I also like that you can detach the toys to wash or take with you.  My son loves chewing on them.  The colors and patterns of this mat are very nice.  Visually stimulating for the baby yet not gaudy. Very cute and fun.  And the music isn't annoying as on some toys.  The tune can be changed and the sound quality is good.  I found the price of this was a bit high, but when compared to some of the other ones, the little bit extra that you pay is worth it.  I have another one someone gave me and I don't like it half as much simply because it's lacking a lot of the features this one has. The only thing I don't like is the mirror seems a bit warped when you look into it, so I'm guessing the baby doesn't see himself all that well in it.  But other than that, I love this product and highly reccommend it.

This is simply the very best dark soy I've ever tasted, with no exception!  I first found a bottle in some little Asian store cuz I needed dark soy for some recipe.  Didn't think anything of it.  Not until this year, when I became a FANATICAL Asian chef at home and realized that no other dark soy rises to the level of Pearl River Bridge Superior, Mushroom flavor.  I bought the 60oz to use as a refill source for my smaller bottle.  If you like/need/want dark soy sauce, look no further - it would be pointless!
Easy to grip and use. Perfect first cutlery set. Highly recommend. My son is four years old, and he loves these.

My first impression of the Rainforest Friends jumper was how big it is. I'm in a one bedroom apartment with child and baby. This is huge. It takes up as much space as our small kitchen table. Please try to find a floor model of one before buying, so you can see the size. Plastic boxy ones are smaller, even though not as high quality.

Assembling the jumper was hard for me. The three springs that attach the jumper to the metal supports are permanently attached to the metal supports. To assemble, you assemble the rounded triangle base, then attach the poles that hold up the jumper. But you must attach them while they are connected to the jumper. It was confusing for me, because for the first pole, I had to deal with jumper and two other poles being awkward. Then for second pole, more of the same. Then for third pole, the jumper weighed it down. This matters to me, because I'm removing the poles from the base frequently to store this, so it doesn't take up space. (The actual attachment for poles is OK to assemble and unassemble. To assemble, just snap in place. To unassemble, push a button that allows the metal poles to disconnect. What is hard about this is dealing with the parts that are already connected together.)

The actual jumper looks fun with many activities for a baby. It has monkey thing that dangles from above the child, a small mirror that is a bit like a fun house mirror but more like a real mirror than most children's toys, a wheel baby can spin to hide and expose different pictures of animals, a light up \\"waterfall\\", beads that slide along a metal pole, etc.

The other thing about this, and all jumpers, is anything that dangles a child from the crotch can be bad for hip development. So, for babies under 6 months, especially, but then even older, this shouldn't be used for a long time. If time is limited and it is used to give the child little activities to do, then that's good for baby to develop.

Update: My baby has enjoyed the bouncer from about 4 months old up to now 8 months. He would only use it for short amounts of time (maybe 5 minutes) before he was about 6 months. Now, he will happily bounce and hit things for 20 minutes at a time. He can crawl, but he still likes the bouncer and does not see it as a containment device. So, this has a pretty long useful life for a baby. I also moved to a huge apartment with ample space for this bouncer. I still think it is too big. Baby Einstein has on that folds up for storage, and my baby's daycare has that one. That other bouncer is sturdy, comparably priced, and stores easily. If you are buying new, please look at fold up models, and only get this Rainforest Friends one if you have enough space for a refridgerator sized item in the nursery. This and the refridgerator will take up similar amounts of space.
Far less expensive than home made broth, it really intensifies the beef flavor of soups and stews as well as braised dishes.Very well balanced.
Fake pubic hair keeps getting caught in my teeth. Otherwise quite a delicious addition to any clean-shaven poultry dish.

While an inexpensive Brie..........delicious.  I have purchased this product from another source, but found it to be less expensive on Amazon.  Less money and an exceptionally luscious cheese.  Melted in the microwave and placed on a slice of apple, pear, a crisp toast or bread of your choice and it's a meal, an appetizer, or a snack.  A cheese that's flavor should not be missed by anyone and at a really, really good price.

I ordered this item and even paid for 2 day shipping after my 20 month old learned how to open knobs and handles even with those covers that are suppose to be childproof.  I thought I would try this after reading all the good reviews.  Unfortunately after only 3 days of use the pad that rests against the door frame tore and came apart rendering the item useless.  It is a good idea but not really strong enough to do the job.  The hook part itself should also be engineered stronger.  I am sad I wasted the money for expedited shipping.  I just processed the return and item is going back.

This is my favorite flavor of K-cup coffee.  It's strong and tastes rich.  You can smell the deliciousness as you sip it. Most coffees I've tried are weak and boring. This one will get your blood pumping!

The blue truffles are the best for adults.  For children get the red ones.  They arrived promptly and in perfect condition. Even though I have prime and was surprised they charge 1.99 shipping,it was worth it. I live in central Florida, it is May and the temperature was 87 degrees. The truffles arrived in an insulated bag with a still cool cold pack.  Bravo for doing a professional job. The more I buy from you the more I am impressed with your consistently excellent service.  Thank you.

I am a huge fan of Hubba Bubba Max gum.  I love the texture of this gum.  It is super soft and the flavor lasts long.  I've tried all of the flavors and this is my favorite one thus far!  The mystery flavor is lemonade with a little cherry added in the middle.  It has a sour kick to it, so if you like sour candy you will love this gum.

I've been a lacto-ovo vegetarian for over 30 years. I'm always looking for easy meals to make for lunch or a quickie supper dish. I used to love Tuno, but when it left the market I was on the search for an alternative. I tried making my own using chickpeas, but being the lazy vegetarian that I am...it just didn't cut it. When I saw this Fishless Tuna on Amazon I figured I'd take a leap of faith and buy a case. I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the flavor and texture, quite appealing. I prefer the 5oz cans as it's perfect for 2 regular sized sandwiches or 1 large roll (like a hoagie roll). Generally I just mix mayo (Helman's only for me), spread it on bread with maybe 1 slice of cheese and eat.

I do recommend this to lazy vegetarians like myself who want convenience in addition to not eating meat.
We go through several boxes a year. Just ad pecans for a speical treat. kids form 2 to 80 love
Sour sugar free candy was so sour that it was bitter tasting. I wanted to send it back, but was not allowed to.
This seasoning is awesome!!! Very versatile and adds a wonderful flavor to everything we have put it on.  This was an excellent buy....we will buy another when we get to our last bottle.
To me this is one of the best tasting choices for coconut water available. I have tried ONE and ZICO, both of which I like, but this is my favorite flavor.

Works great to keep our daughters head from hitting the spout but we cannot keep it on while the tub is running since the spout is not caulked at the wall so we get water behind the wall. Just something to think about.
Great quality, very soft, and baby loves the patterns! Definitely worth the price, they actually stay on!
This is the best Tomato Soup I have ever consumed out of a can or carton.  A bit pricey, and only for occasional consumption.

This is one of my baby's favorite rattles. We bought a second. Easy for baby to grip with the holes in it, light to hold and soft enough that he doesn't get hurt when he hits his face with it. Never understood why so many rattles are really are plastic. I never buy them. Buy this one instead. Also REALLY easy to clean unlike many other rattles. Also makes a nice noise that baby loves and we love too as it's not really loud. Also, you can attach it to stroller with rings through the holes so that if doesn't fall on ground.

Tomatoes are great but why am I paying a premium for dented cans? Every single one of 6 cans was severely dented. Thus, I assume we are buying seconds, because, as we all know, no one buys the dented cans at the supermarket. You always reach for the good cans.
Disappointing at over $6 a can.
My husband drinks this and it is one of his favorites.  Smells good to me though I don't drink coffee.  Little mess with the K-cups though I wish they were more environmentally friendly.
There is less than 10 grams of sugar in each package. 80% RDA vitamin C per serving. I like it. I would order again.
This baby monitor is simple and works great. We ended up getting two (long story), but we could alternate receivers and have one charge while we use the other.

I eat extra sharp cheddar cheese regularly, and it never tastes like mold,  but this powder does. I'm not sure if that's supposed to be the "sharp" flavor, or if there IS mold in it. It just looks like white powder.  UPDATE: It is BLEU CHEESE!  Why is this in cheddar cheese???

I love it! A little definitely goes a long way, which is great since I bought the small package. I don't use sugar/sweetners very often at all so this package should last me a while :) Love that it's all natural and free of fillers!!!
Very cute lamp and goes well with our woodland themed nursery. 4/5 because the shade was a little smashed upon arrival. Luckily the shade was bent in the back so we can hide it well.

I was looking for a LIGHTWEIGHT stroller that fits my ' big tall 18 month ' son , this is a GREAT catch spaciously for the price

The great things about it is that its specious (even the basket) but doesn't get a lot of space , the height is perfect for me (5.5) , the canopy is BIG enough to cover his whole face from the sun which is hard to find in a lightweight strollers , the tray is removable so easily

It was easy to assemble took me 3-5 min and it arrived fast , what not to love about it , I recommend it for toddlers

My wife and I have been ordering Larry's for over a year, and we're very happy with it.  It's very good quality, consistent roast, and with \\"subscribe and save\\" discount plus the free shipping, at Amazon, it's about $9 a pound delivered whenever we want it.  It's also Fair Trade and Organic, so you can feel vaguely happy for some coffee grower in a far off place while drinking it.  Great coffee, convenient availability, we'll be ordering this as long as they keep sending it at this quality and price.

These sheets make changing the crib so easy! No need to pull up the mattress or remove the bumper. This is the third zip sheet I've purchased! Awesome time saving invention! I won't buy any other crib sheets going forward!
Purchased this set for my Granddaughter.  She loves Mickey and Minnie Mouse.  Will be a great Christmas present for her.
I absolutely love this tea! The nutty flavor of the toasted brown rice blends perfectly with that of the green tea.

even the website says they are wheat free only, not gluten free. oatmeal can contain gluten if it's grown where wheat was grown previously, it picks it up from the soil. I wouldn't trust these until the company says they're certified gluten free.
i put this in a spray bottle and use it as a mist toner for my face. its wonderful!!! smells amazing and hydrates my skin nicely as an essence. no harsh chemicals either.

The long sleeved bibs are wonderful for keeping my almost one year old son's clothes mostly clean.  However, the pocket does nothing to catch fallen food and my child's pants do get dirty.  In result, I have combined this bib with the Tommee Tippee Explora Easi-roll Bibs, and my son stays pretty clean when using both bibs.

This Celtic inspired tea chest is simple but elegant. As soon as I saw it, I placed it on my wish list and was so happy when good friends bought it for me. The box is sturdy, and divided into quarters. Instead of the traditional paper packets, the tea bags are sealed in what feels like a paper/plastic blend but it also may just be a shiny effect that was added to the packets.
There are many Tazo flavors I haven't had the opportunity to try before, and they're so good! So many samplers have a number of \\"throwaways\\" in terms of enjoyment, but so far every flavor is bright, strong (but not too strong) and comforting. I've been a fan of Awake black tea for some time, as well as Passion, which is a fruity hibiscus blend great for iced tea. New to me is the Wild Sweet Orange, which is as sweet and juicy flavored as it sounds. I'm currently enjoying a cup of the Green Ginger, which has a spicy-sweet aroma and a fruity, gingery flavor that is not too sweet.
The only caveats so far are that The Celtic knot appears to be a raised, gold-covered applique as opposed to being embossed, but as long as it isn't actively peeled off it doesn't look like it's going anywhere. Also, there is a chemical/lacquer smell that is evident in the box, but I don't find it has affected the tea at all. The dividers in the box would allow for it to be used to store more tea, or small items like jewelry. It's a great gift for a tea novice to a tea lover.

I did buy this product through Amazon but used an account/payment in my maiden name so it might not be verified. If you look at my history you will see that I am a legitimate frequent shopper. I did not buy this product as an infant. I was a new mom with a definite strong fear of SIDS. I did my homework about when SIDS becomes statistically less of a threat (about 6 months you are almost out of the woods and by about 2 the fear is just about over). At 2 I decided that the risk of me getting in a car accident with my child because of sleep deprivation outweighed the risk of SIDS.

Because of the risk and new standards for infant sleep, mine did not. I did my best until we got him a \\"big kid bed\\" and despite the unique Disney Cars design the bed was unslept in because it was not comfy. I read all the reviews about memory foam mattresses and decided to give the pad a try because the existing mattress was good and spending a great deal of money on a bed that would only last another year or two did not make sense.

It has been about 6 months and while the mattress cover did not keep the monsters out of the closet it, it did ensure once my son was a sleep he stayed asleep because he was comfy. If he lies flat on the mattress he can breath out of both nostils just as well as on a standard mattress. It is a stuggle but even a standard crib mattress fits over both the pad and mattress.

This was a great in between option for us, cheaper than a new questionable mattress and much cozier than the rock of a mattress from infant time. I did not smell anything chemical like when this product was removed from the package. I did cover this and the sheet with a water resistant cloth cover so the distance between any possible chemical residue and my child was two layers deep.
Would never purchase this product again as it doesn't take like white cheddar at all. It's entirely to, to mild. I like a mild white as a popcorn topping but this disappoints in ever way.

Addictive! I love these. They are wrapped in little piles of several so perfect for shoving in pocket or lunchbox or for giving a reward to a kid. I will not lie and say they are good for you because they are sweet so they probably aren't but I have got to tell you - I found myself saying WHO CARES! They are so good I don't mind. Better than cake, pie or pudding. And the pkgs make it so you can say to yourself (I will only eat three pkgs) then go outdoors quickly so you forget about them for a while.
its been a week and ive finished half of the box just by myself :( im crazy about cashews and this one is super amazing. I thought it would be unsalted but it actually is salted but oh whatever.

Hello!    I used the Organic Maple Syrup grade B for a lemon detox that I use to loose weight and to clean my system.    I recommend this product, this is a reliable vendor as well. I submitted my order and in less than 5 days I received my product and began doing my detox.    If want to use the product and research the lemon detox master cleanser and you will see that the main ingredient for the detox is this great Organic Maple Syrup Grade level B.    Good luck!!
Only 4.5 oz of popcorn, not crispy, like popcorn sits in kitchen for a couple of month. Absolutely not worth the money, do not buy!
These decaf coffee pods were very good;  I use them in the afternoon to avoid too much caffeine.

These are so good you can't stop eatting them..you need to pour out a few and then hide the bag away!  The lemon flavor is subtle and they are sprinkled with fine bits of rosemary...saltiness is just perfect...can't think of thing to say that is not glowing!
My son won't keep his blanket on and woke up cold every morning. This took care of the problem. Very happy with it

We are huge fans of MAM pacifiers after trying a few styles. We fell in love with them when our baby girl was about 1 month, and we have been buying exclusively MAM pacifiers ever since. We usually have 3 or 4 sets open at a time (one at home, one at my work, and one set in the diaper bag, and we throw each pacifier out after being used for 2 months.

One of the things about the MAM pacifiers we liked are the super cute designs. They are subtle and not gawdy, which is nice when you take a photo of your child you see the baby and not a GIANT pacifier.

However, after 6 months, the designs are not quite as cute, which is a bummer. These soft silicone pacifiers however are very cute. Our baby has been teething since about 5 months old, and she uses the backside of the pacifier to scrape along her razer sharp tooth nubs. I was super excited to see this variation of the MAM pacifier, so I ordered them.

Our baby loves these even more then the standard ones as the soft silicone sides are great for teething, she doesn't chew on the nipple part, only the sides, whereas her other pacifiers she chews on the nipple, which is nerve-wracking.

A note on the design - the "style may vary" that I received has a giraffe image on it, which is not pictured in included photos. This was a bit of a bummer because my husband and I are not super huge giraffe fans, but it's still cute.

Highly recommend for a teething baby over 6 months that still uses a pacifier (ours uses hers at bedtime and in her car seat on trips).

All I can say is wow! I used other Matcha but they dont compare to this one! It full of flavor and has a the classic green tea smells, with I love. I mixed half a teaspoon with 2 oz of water, mixed it into a paste, add 4 oz of almond milk , sweeten with agave and a few drops of mix essences which is like vanilla extract  but with a almond flavor.  And it was the bomb!  The only draw back with this product is that no real recipe for those who dont know how to use Matcha, and its a small container of tea. Looks as if I will use this tea from time to time due to its cost.  Just so you know I received this product at a discount in exchange for this review.

I looked online at reviews for many different soft structured carriers. I had tried the front carriers like baby bjorn but those are not useful once baby gets heavy, so for my 10 month old who weighs 20 pounds I wanted a back carrier.  I looked into Ergo also but because the Beco Gemini also does hip carry, front outward/inward carry, in addition to back carry so I chose the Gemini. I hadn't known anyone who had it but decided to buy and I think it was a a good choice. My 10 month old at first was nervous and fussy because he had never been in a back carrier. But after walking him around it a few times he now loves it, smiles, and is so comfortable that he falls alseep while in back carry mode.  I also have an infant and like the choice to have infant face inward in front carry (without infant insert like other carriers) and later have chance to do front facing out with my infant too. My 10 month old is very happy/comfortable in it, the gemini is lightweight but feels very sturdy and is easy to use, while sitting on a couch with baby behind you nestled in the carrier seat you can load your baby into back carry mode without anyone else's help. Ergo cannot do front facing out (but some people don't think that position is good because of excess stimulation) or front inward without infant insert, Gemini can do those and more. It seemed to have the most versatility and I like it so far, it's easier that carrying him in my arms for long periods of time. My back doesn't hurt at all.  My nanny also easily uses it to back carry and so does my spouse who are all different body shapes and heights. It's also very compact when rolled up and easy to take anywhere.
It is so dang cute! We bought it to give to our grandson when he is born.

We love this bath tub though I was concerned about the size. It has turned out to be really great for our twins. We bath them separately and get a little 1-1 time with them. We have been using it since 3 mos and they are now 1. We will use it for 6 more months easily! Saves water too!     There is a small hole on one end and we HANG it up with baby rings (those half circle shaped plastic ones.) It stays out of the way and we have a very, very small space. A great tool!!
I like how refined this coffee was and it was a pleasure to drink this coffee in the morning. I'm happy with this purchase.
I bought this for my son and his wife who are avid coffee drinkers.  They liked it so well that they ordered more.

I love the idea of this sleepwrap. The first couple nights in it went well. However, my newborn absolutely hates it now. We spent all day yesterday and now all night just getting her to relax in it. She hated being strapped in and confined to one spot. She will be quiet for about 5 minutes then whine, quiet then whine, etc., for HOURS. I try taking her out and consoling her only to put her back in and go through the same thing over and over again. All. Night. Long. It's so frustrating because I want her to be safe in her bed, but she hates it so much. I tried giving her naps in it and for 12 hours yesterday it was a battle of getting her to calm down and sleep.

So now we have to decide whether we try it again when she is older and can roll over or if we just wasted $100 because we can't live with the sleepless days and nights. :/

I bought these because I was looking for the much-loved Callard & Bowser licorice toffees my mother used to treat me to every so often as a child. I haven't had one for about 50 years, and today, when my package of toffees arrived from England, I eagerly ripped open the bag and popped one in my mouth. At first, I was thinking, no, these seem very much harder than what I remember, but it's very cold outside today, and the package was sitting on my doorstep for hours, so the candies were unusually hard. Within about 20 seconds, the candy started to soften and I was able to chew it and move it around in my mouth. My knees nearly buckled. It was every bit as good as what I remember from my childhood. I savored the one and quickly popped another. I can tell these are going to be habit-forming.

If you're looking for a replacement for Callard & Bowser licorice toffees (who are out of business), you will find these completely acceptable as a substitute, just as other reviewers have said. Excellent!
I love this lunch box. It does it's job and is adorable. I some point I may need to change to one that holds an ice pack but it totally does the trick for now :)

I ordered this for my elderly mom. The cookies were elegant and very tasty. Many combinations of different kinds
of Belgian cookies. Expensive.

We got this for free with a purchase at Babies R Us. Thank god it was free because it doesn't work! It consistently just beeps and reads "Lo", as in "low temp", even when taking my baby's temp who had a fever of 101.4. Don't waste your money. I am so glad I didn't pay for it, but wish it worked. I'm now going to invest in one of those expensive "no touch" thermometers because my baby was just sick and it was no fun taking his temp under the armpit while he was sick.

Good value.
*Used the cloves for making a Williamsburg style wreath for the front door. Oranges studded with cloves.
*Used whole cloves in making wassail
*Made simmering potpourri
*Made cinnamon and clove sachets for closets.
I still have plenty of cloves left over for more crafting or food projects.

There is a certain age of baby that wants to jump for joy for hours every day. This seat is just the thing for that certain age of baby. You can hang them in the doorway and watch them jump for joy while you work at home or on the job. Hang one in your doorway, stick a baby in it, and watch your co-workers gather round to share the joy.

Even though most claim the smoky flavor is too strong, in my opinion, it's not strong enough and the tea itself is too weak. I was somewhat skeptical buying it since it was suspiciously inexpensive for a premium tea blend and I was right. I should have paid more to get the real thing.
I really enjoy the Barney Butter (crunchy) is my favorite. My snack is an apple with Barney spread on it, doesn't get any better. Anyway I hope you enjoy it the same.

Good quality chair. I even find myself sitting in it and it holds up well (5'9, 160). My 2 year old son automatically knew it was for him and say in it with a book the moment i took it out of the box. Now he just has to fight the dog for who gets in to it first.

I haven had these cups too long for my kids. The valve does fall out if the cup falls or they bang the cup. We also have a few cups that the valve doesn't work and the kids complain that, "nothing coming out." My biggest complaint is the plastic by the rim actually cracks and the cups end up leaking.

I purchased this swing for $60.00 and thought that it would be a nice way to save money and keep my baby happy while I was busy with household chores. The highest setting simply shook the swing a bit, and my baby was soon frustrated with sitting still. I tried changing the batteries, and finally figured out that the swing was defective. If I held the bars apart, the swing would work a bit better but not for long. It sucks the batteries dry within an hour and overall it was a huge waste of money. I would NOT recommend this swing to anyone.

Just installed this a week ago, and so far we love it.  The seat seems super comfortable.  Easy to install.  The straps are easy to adjust, and I like the 'click' that tells you the straps are tight enough.  I also love that there is nice padding where the metal pieces clip in, so the metal doesn't burn (or freeze) my toddler's thighs when she has on shorts.  Very cushy seat!

We received this as a shower gift and love it.  The shower was held after the baby arrived,so we did without a changing table for awhile,not sure how we managed.  It was easy to assemble and has storage below.

This device seems to work as advertised, for some people. I have found that I can not see the effect expected, but my wife has no problem. So be aware that if you don't have a backup, the device may not work for you.

This is about the best price you will find on this product and you know that the proceeds are helping real people, not funding some conglomerate. Quinoa is a great natural product, a great rice substitute that is healthier for you and provides a long term food storage food source as well.

This is a great wet bag. Many different functions from cloth diapers to swimsuits to soiled clothes! Perfect size to throw in your diaper bag. I also bought the snack happened pouch to hold my cloth wipes!
Good quality, shipped promptly.  Macademia nuts are expensive, but their price was among the best.  Will order again.  These are unsalted and are great for making Macademia butter.
Evidently my granddaughter loves it. Her parents approved and agreed it is adorable. I have not seen it, but will soon.

We have tried many foods. Our dogs are inside a lot and this is the only food that doesn't give them stinky gas. They love a lot of the wild foods with venison ect but even their stools outside are stinky so we stick with this.

I really like this carrier! My daughter is quite small (I've been using it since she was 8ish pounds), and it seems to be just fine. It does seem to work a bit better now that she is a bit bigger (9ish pounds), as she doesn't "scrunch" down so far in the carrier. The reason for 4 stars is the buckles are really hard to get off; and while I know that is the point for increased safety, with a squirmy baby in your arms, it makes it really hard to get off and probably makes it more dangerous! Overall, though, I would definitely recommend this product!
I really like this bar. It has very simple ingredients, is vegan, tastes good, and fills me up.  It is one of my favorite protein bars.

For the price, this is an excellent stroller.  Folds up compactly enough for easy in and out of the trunk, has a respectable amount of storage, and looks pretty contemporary.  Also has plenty of space for a growing child and the seat back adjusts very nicely between "aware" and "please fall asleep on this walk" (my personal settings).  I use this all the time and nothing has broken or been damaged. The mom cupholder falls off frequently when going in and out of the trunk, but it reattaches easily and that's minor enough for a $50 all purpose stroller.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Let me start by saying that I was very hesitant about buying this playgym because of some of the negative reviews I read. However, I really wanted some sort of playgym for my month-old daughter, and I wanted to see it in person before buying. Our local Babies R Us only had two models in the store when I went there: this one and the Carter's Butterfly Play Gym. Despite the glowing reviews I'd read about the Butterfly gym, when I saw it in person I was extremely unimpressed. In my opinion, the colors were dull and nothing about the gym excited my interest. The Discovering Water gym, however, immediately caught my eye with its vibrant colors and water-filled music box. I decided to give it a try and figured I could always return it if either my daughter or I hated it.

I have to say I'm DELIGHTED with this gym. No, it's not perfect, but then again, what is?

The first thing I really liked about this gym was that it's different than all the others I've seen. Every other gym seems to have the same standard design: a flat floor mat (usually square) and two overhead arches that cross in the middle in an X shape. The DW gym, however, has a rippled floor mat with flaps that can be lifted. Each flap is shaped like a different sea creature (a fish, dolphin, whale, etc) and has a cartoon picture of that animal on top and a silkscreened photo of the real animal underneath along with the name of the animal in English, French and Spanish. Even though my daughter is too young to actively lift the flaps to look underneath, at least they give her something to grab onto at floor level when she's lying on the mat. As she gets older, she can do more actual playing with the flaps themselves. I just feel that this gives the mat itself an extra layer of interactivity that's missing with the other activity gym mats out there.

The standard X shaped overhead arches of other gyms form a square shape (four equal-sized spaces between where the arches meet the mat) and leave the gym wide open on all sides (which, I realize, some people might love). The DW gym has two overhead arcs that come together in the middle and then bow out again rather than criss-crossing. This makes more rectangular-shaped openings (two long sides and two short sides) than with other gyms. What I really like about this design is that the arches themselves have a short length of netting (like a fisherman's net) hanging down from the top. This combined with having one short end occupied by the water-filled music box really gives the gym a semi-enclosed feeling, like the inside of an undersea cave. I think it makes for a wonderful spot for imaginative play, much more so than other activity gym designs I've seen.

The gym itself can accommodate 12 hanging toys, although only 3 are included. I think the selection of toys that are included isn't the best. The plastic fish reminds me of a dog's squeaky toy, right down to the squeaker inside, but the high-contrast colors really seem to attract my daughter's attention. The stuffed turtle is one of the Baby Einstein licensed characters - it's cute enough, but it doesn't \\"do\\" anything, and when it hangs overhead the only thing to look at from below is its plain, undecorated stomach. This is a toy best played with at eye level, unattached to the activity gym. (I bought another, slightly larger stuffed turtle toy with a mirror in the stomach to hang overhead). The third \\"toy\\" is really a set of thick plastic flashcards with sea creatures and their names on them. The pictures are very nice, but I don't really see how a young child would necessarily play with them except maybe to clink the plastic discs together (kind of like a set of plastic \\"baby keys\\"). I wound up purchasing 3 or 4 additional toys from a variety of companies to add to the gym - I object to having to spend the extra money when the gym itself cost so much, but all the activity gyms seem to be designed this way.

The water-filled music box is a nice touch, and I like the fact that it has a motion-sensitive setting. The baby needs to actually shake the arches (by pulling a toy) to activate the box in this mode, and I wish it were a bit more sensitive (it takes quite a bit of motion to set it off).

I really like the pat mat in the floor of the gym. This is basically a thick plastic bag filled with two-dimensional sea creatures and an ocean-looking background. The instructions say to fill it with water and empty after each use, but I don't bother emptying and refilling it and we've had no problems. Be warned, though - at first, it looks like you won't be able to fill it with water because the fill hole looks like one solid piece of plastic with a cover. My husband and I actually thought we needed to poke a hole in the plastic in order to fill it. Don't do this! The fill holes are actually so very small you can't really see them - just put the sink faucet up to the fill hole and run the water in. The mat fills pretty slowly but it does fill, and keeping the holes so tiny probably keeps the mat from leaking all over the place. We haven't had any problems with leakage at all since getting the gym.

I also like the crescent-shaped pillow that's included with the gym. It's great for putting under your baby's head so she can look up at the hanging toys, and of course, it's perfect for \\"tummy time.\\" The pat mat and liftable flaps on the mat of the gym give baby some interesting things to play with and look at at floor level during tummy time, too.

On a side note, I took a Kick and Play Piano and tied it across the other \\"short\\" side of the gym (opposite where the water-filled music box is) and it's worked out wonderfully. This gives my daughter something to kick (she's a big kicker) plus when she does kick it, it moves the arches enough to activate the motion-sensor music box. I can either leave the piano in the \\"off\\" mode and use the music box activated by kicking, or I can leave the music box off and let my baby's kicks operate the music of the piano.

The biggest disadvantage of this gym, in my opinion, is the price. It's definitely the most expensive gym I've found, but in lots of cases (the Gymni and the original Baby Einstein, for example), it's only more expensive by about $10. For all the \\"extras\\" that this gym provides, I think the added expense is well worth it.s way.

Barilla Collezione Casarecce pasta is on another level! We are big pasta eaters in my house. We are always on the go and looking for something to spice up our recipes.Barilla Collezione Casarecce pasta did just that! We have had pasta from the north end of Boston that was just as good as this much easier to attain, store bought pasta! Give it a try. You won't be disappointed. #GotItFree #Barilla #BzzAgent

Our first feeding with the Ventaire was a solid hour of nothing. No formula got to the baby. We called and got information not included with the set. We made the adjustments and still my 1 wk old got nothing even though sucking with all her might. Another reviewer mentioned that it took two weeks for her newborn to learn to suck differently. The customer service from Playtex said to only allow the baby to suck on the tip. What?!! Baby's don't naturally do that. ...
As for me, Ventaire was a waste and I am going back to the bottles that work.

I have been a K-coffee user for some time and I especially like Timothy's. I ordered this flavored coffee and the regular decaf at a very good price with the Amazon 1-day sale.  All the K-cup varieties are good and your K-pot makes a fresh cup in 30 sec.  Amazon delivered the coffee in just a couple of days and I'm still enjoying it.  Thanks, Amazon and Keurig.  When are you going to have another sale?  I don't hesitate to purchase at the regular price because I really enjoy the coffee, but sales allow us buy more!

It is perfect. Bought it for my 14 month grandson and he loves it, he actually stays still enough to set in it and enjoy it. It  I would purchase again if needed and it fits right in as part of the regular furniture. Delivery was awesome as well as well. Highly recommended.
this cheese ravioli is my familys favorite! great tasting,has plenty in bowl for a quick lunch! would buy again.

The Wisconsin Cheddar rounds are awesome! My toddlers and husband love them too. I was thinking they would last longer than they have because I bought them for myself as a low carb snack and the whole family has been eating them and I'm having to reorder them again. Definately try these.
this did not fit my play yard -it did not have any elasticity and was way too big .I could have sown something something like this: myself quite easily

i read lot of people mentioned that they got much smaller (shorter ) beef sticks in second shipment. i was nervous to get them again but when they arrived, they did seemed shorter but seem thicker, i weighted them and found out except one been 1oz, all the other 11 of them were 1.08 oz.  *UPDATE* Ok , so we were going on a road trip so I ordered this again for our snack. What happened??? It's super mushy inside and outside is really hard/crunchy but inside is like really soft and it was gross texture. Really sad about this cause we are already on the road and can't eat them as our snack option:(  I probably won't order again from this company.

I have enjoyed tasting my way through the list of Sodastream diet flavors...and I've liked them and found them an acceptable alternative to the name brand diet sodas they emulate.  The diet cream, IMHO, is the first I haven't cared for.  It doesn't taste like cream soda!

Great traditional spice for everyday use in home Japanese cooking. Adds a lot of flavor and a little spice to any dish - certainly a necessity if you are thinking of making traditional Japanese dishes at home!

When we first recieved this, the seal ripped in taking the lid off the first time. Amazon replaced it and the second one was sticky as well, but it didn't rip. It is a bit hard to close sometimes, but it is insulated and the right size.  The divider isn't leakproof though.

The product arrived in a timely manner. It has a nice flip open cap with a squeeze nozzle type deal similar to mustard or ketchup. The oil is a rich green color. I've used the oil on pasta (it has directions to make a salad dressing on the bottle) and I like the flavor a lot. The flavor is kind of a warm, rich, nutty kind of flavor. What I bought the product for was not for food though. I bought it for my read dry skin on my face. I got really bad sunburn last summer on my face and it's been flaking ever since on my cheeks. So, I squirt a little bit on a sock and rub my face with it! The flakes of skin come right off and it helps my skin. It hasn't given me acne and this oil miraculously does NOT clog pores. I shaved my head and gave myself a mohawk but I noticed I had really bad dry scalp on the sides and it was disgusting. I treated my head with this stuff for about a week and now it doesn't have any flakes and is completely healed... my face is being stubborn though... the sun really cooked it last summer. If you're looking for a healthy product for your face and your food then buy this stuff... it's great!
Durable, easy to clean, my toddler loves to drink out of it. Fits in the diaper bag, stays cold, doesn't sweat.
I add this to baked goods! I made low carb pancakes with it, put it in cookies, and can even make gummies with it. Flavorless and Great source of fiber that's easy to incorporate into recipes.

This dried milk tastes like the real thing when it is reconstituted with water.  I used to own a Jersey cow. We drank the whole milk, with about 40% cream.  This milk tastes almost as good.  It is a far cry from the nonfat powdered milk.

I really like this stroller!  It isn't horribly heavy, but it does have some weight.  I chose orange so I could use it on trails during hunting season.  It folds pretty small and the wheels come off easily to make it smaller.  It comes assembled, except you have to pop on the wheels.  I would not use this on two-tracks or really uneven terrain because with 3 wheels, it could tip easily.  It has a 5 point harness system, which is nice.  I just clip toys and a pacifier on it.  Once you are comfortable with the stroller, you can pop it open with one hand!  I use this as an every day stroller.  I even use it for shopping - I just put my items in the basker under it.  You can't put a ton of stuff there, but $50 worth of groceries will fit.  This stroller turns on a dime, but you need to have the room to turn around since it is pretty long.  I also have the adapter for the Graco Snugride 35 carseat, the cupholder, and the weather shield.  I think those items are overpriced, but I like them all.  I would buy this again.

Love. How inexpensive these are considering what we bought at buybuybaby. With those shoulder bibs. For one shoulder bibb 10 dollars- I love them but for what they are a little too expensive. I go through about two burp feedings one burp rag with six feedings makes 3 rags per a day so spending less on getting more is why i purchased these bad boys.I just know the quality is not as good as expected not as thick and a little longer would be nice. If they could cut out for a shoulder for  the same price i would be on cloud 9. I think next time ill buy a thick towel for cheap. And alter it.
If you are tending vegan, this is is a great winter's morning drink.  Leave cows' milk, and soy "milk" can cause digestive woes for some. Tasty as all get-out!
Love these because you can use for 1 glass/container at a time... not a whole pitcher. Plus I love that the flavor isn't overwhelming; very subtle

I PURCHASED THIS PRODUCT WHEN MY BABY WAS 10 MONTHS OLD.I FELT THAT THE VOICE ACTIVATED WAS GOOD ENOUGH. BOY,DO I REGRET NOT BUYING THIS PRODUCT SOONER.AFTER MY BABY HAVING A FEBRILE SEIZURE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT. This is a great idea rather than use a seat cover. It is made of quality material and can last long. I have a Toyota Rav4 with twins sitting (in two car seats) in the back. I would suggest any future products include two additional holes for latch connectors.

I ordered this as our sole baby-monitor. I have an iPad and iPod and my Husband has a Samsung Smartphone, on which we were planning on using as the monitor. When we (finally) got it set up we were disappointed that the audio did not work on our computers or phones/tablet. In order to get audio on the computer you must download a program, which we were not willing to do. We found an app that supported the LOFTEK brand, but it did not provide Audio either. We were disappointed and considered sending it back.
However, after submitting a 3-star rating for the seller-feedback we were contacted swiftly by LOFTEK Customer Support. They suggested an app that does support Audio for iPhones and iPads (although it is a purchased app; not the FREE version). After downloading that app we have a great Audio/Visual Monitor for our baby's nursery. I suggested to the Customer Service Support that they make it clear in the product description that this app is necessary for audio use, and consider developing their own app or working with one already developed to provide free use to purchasers of LOFTEK cameras.
Now I am not disappointed in this purchase, but I did have my doubts that could have easily been avoided had the suggested app been made clear from the beginning.

Ambrosia. I first learned this divine term in high school when reading Greek fiction. It is the term used to describe the drink of the gods, but the description stops there. Often I wondered what It might taste like for it to be so popular among deities. Does it just taste great? Is that all a god is looking for in their beverage? Or is it invigorating? I supposed it would have to be, after all, reigning over the realm of mortals and hurling thunderbolts must wear a guy/gal out. Would it need to be healthy and nourishing?The gods ARE Immortal, but that doesn't mean they can't get sick of overweight, just look at Dionysus for instance.

I would ponder the potential attributes of such a drink for days, wonder what powerful, maybe magical, properties it would need to have to satisfy such a lofty audience. Then, one day long after I had given up my quest, I got my answer.

As I was perusing the vast inventory of our local whole foods grocery store, I stumped upon something called C2o, the very product I am reviewing today. My thought process was \\"I love coconut, why not coconut water\\" after all that reasoning had served me fairly well with other such substances (Lemonade, apple juice, ect....). My first taste was absolute shock, the drink was cold and smooth, it had a viscosity to it slightly greater than water, and a flavor that was mild yet distinct. Then the can was empty. I was distraught, so I turned back to the store to purchase another. The beverage has a subtle sweetness about it which is pleasant and not at all overpowering. It is as refreshing as a cold glass of water but with all the benefits of an one of those highly touted sports drinks. I was in hydration heaven...

As I let the second can rattle to the floor, feeling a bit like a alcoholic, I realized I finally had my answer. THIS was ambrosia, this was what I had been trying to describe all those years ago. I needed more, but at 3.00$ a can I was looking at taking quite a hit in my wallet to feed this new addiction. So I turned to amazon and got a affordable solution. The cans were pretty banged up upon delivery but the C2o tasted none the worse for it. I plan on buying much more of this product as the year goes on.

I buy quality, more natural mac & cheese quite regularly and was a long time customer of Annie's products. Unfortunately I often found that glue and other contaminants (which spark when heated) made it into the finished products Annie's sells. I contacted the company about this and was ignored twice before receiving very brief a reply that there was no danger to the consumer. Call me skeptical but eating glue (it's probably from the sealant used on the box tops) caked to the pasta does not seem to me like a good idea, and I wasn't exactly thrilled with Annie's customer service, which was mostly dismissive (ignored my first two missives to them). There are plenty of great products and companies out there. I buy Back To Nature mac & cheese now, and actually prefer their spirals and elbows to Annie's shells as these also cook much faster than shells.  Furthermore, Back To Nature mac & cheese has the added benefit of employing vegetarian friendly enzymes in their cheese culture, as opposed to Annie's which does not uses animal enzymes. All in all there's no sense taking a chance on eating toxic substances when looking for a healthier alternative to the chemically heavy products from Kraft and the like.

I've listed these below [with hyperlinks to Amazon product pages].

It could probably go without saying that the dragonfly and ladybug shown in the video were not purchased from Amazon! They just happened to cross my path in such a way as to become video stars.

The dragonfly was found lifeless but perfectly preserved. Of course it did not \\"come with\\" my Kindle, as my slip of the tongue in the video may have implied. The ladybug somehow found its way from my country kitchen onto the top of the container of JUST VEGGIES after I had broken the seal and opened the tub. I didn't notice the ladybug until I was showing the product in the video.

According to my holistic doctor and my personal viewpoint [and studies of books by several medical professionals] the severe magnesium deficiency and soybean intolerance I unfortunately have is aggravated [if not caused] by food alterations and additives, especially soybean products. Due to this, I've been forced into the dreaded and difficult task of searching for foods free of chemically synthesized or genetically altered intrusions.

This painful and frightening situation has been blessedly eased by Amazon's variety of products suiting alternate tastes and needs. Some of these products are helping me slowly regain health and flavor in my life by working around what I've observed and read about an increasing preponderance of synthesized additives and soybean GMOs which are impregnating more and more foods in the marketplace... with some of them listed under insane misnomers like \\"natural flavors\\" as discovered by people who have serious soy allergies [genetically modified organisms don't seem precisely natural to me].

The cherished blessing in this forced change in shopping, cooking, and eating is that food I'm preparing now is beginning again to taste like JUST FOOD, making my stomach growl like it hasn't done for a few decades!

As for my uses so far of the Just Veggies, it is a fantastic, flavor lush, light luxury snack. It also tastes great reconstituted and warmed in the microwave with water, coconut oil, cooked diced potatoes, fresh cilantro, and chopped green onions. I like Just Veggies best [the use seems most efficient] combined into a bowl of rice, quinoa, or noodles for added color, flavor, and nutritive value. I'm attempting to stretch the dried veggies by thinking of them like Just Roasted Garlic, more as a spice instead of a main dish.

Here's to natural flavor which comes from the food itself, or from spices or integrity enhancers added by an old fashioned cook,

Linda Shelnutt

I took a ton of time to decide on this seat. I am really happy with it. This is my second baby and since my son is now 8 we decided to get a new car seat. After reading a review from a mom whose husband crash tested cars and she highly recommended another Safety 1st Air Infant seat, plus going to 3 stores and comparing quality and comfort I decided on going with a Safety 1st seat. I decided on the Flutter version because of color and price. I was happy that the colors in person are more feminine than the picture. Our little baby girl fit in it comfortably and was nice and deep so there wasn't any head flopping. It also has little side bumpers for the head and her sides to hold her in place along with a pad under her body and legs. This seat also comes with the base which was not stated on the sale description. The base was very easy to install and extremely secure with the lap belt installation. Since my vehicle doesn't have the latch option I was concerned with how solid it would be. It can be used with the latch option too. There is a leveling feature on the base which goes by baby's weight and was very easy to use too. I am EXTREMELY happy with this seat, especially for the price.

The playard mattress fits the pack n play perfectly. Also, it's not too hard or too soft as some of the other reviews suggest. It's safe, but still much softer than the thin mattress that came with the pack n play.

That aside, we found out that it wasn't the discomfort that's been keeping our baby awake, but rather keeping her close to our bed, probably sounds or smells keeping her awake. We might've not completely need this mattress, but I'm still glad we got it.

I've never had problems when ordering Amazon Prime, or any Amazon shipped product, and I was so excited to try this coffee.  It arrived in great condition- except for the fact that all of the sealed packs were expired!  I promptly got my money back, but I would call and ask about expiration dates before ordering this coffee.

If I could give zero stars I would. This thing is junk. Constantly reads too low, tested it on myself when I had a fever of 102 and it was telling me 97... Useless.

Now I'm sitting here with my infant wondering if he's running a fever and I'm going to have to send my husband for a new one. Pain In the butt, I regret this purchase.

It was fine to put up in the wall but after two days up it started falling off wall even with following directions. Also the pieces that did fall off took off bits of paint. After reviewing the contents of the kit, I was very disappointed to find one single rennet tablet. It was so hard to see, I initially thought it had been forgotten. Compared to other kits available this is a very poor value. For about eleven dollars more, you can get a kit that with ingredients to make over seven times the mozzarella (30 pounds). The minimal ingredients, thermometer, gloves, and packaging can't cost more than five dollars, making this kit a terrible value.

The instructions are clear and easy to follow, but other kits have easy instructions, too. While I made excellent cheese with it, I will not buy this kit again unless the price drops significantly.

These are great for making juniper simple syrup: I boil equal parts water and sugar (or honey) with about 30 crushed-up juniper berries, simmer for 25 minutes, steep for 4 hours.  It makes a delicious base for homemade juniper soda-- just add a spoonful to sparkling water for a nice treat!
The bold coffees have a nice bold taste, but not overwhelming. All of the coffee choices did not have a bitter taste.
I tried these at a friend's place and had to order some for myself.  They arrived quickly, and I am pleased with the product.

Our 15-month-old loves this car seat! We have one for each car. She loves sitting higher and being able to see out the window. I love the extra side protection the Britax Boulevard provides, and my daughter is able to see around it well enough. She does have to lean forward a little bit to see out since she is still rear-facing. This doesn't seen to bother her. It was easy to install in our Scion XB and Toyota Tacoma. We didn't have to use a noodle or rolled towel to keep it level like I've seen others do. The straps are so convenient- they don't twist, actually stay open for me while I put her in, and are easy to adjust.  She has vomited a whole meal in this seat, and it was easy to clean. I did a lot of research prior to this purchase and chose this one for the extra side protection, great reviews, easy-to-use straps, and high safety ratings. There are other car seats available with cup holders, but that was not on our list of must-haves. Our family is so happy with this choice and would highly recommend this seat!

I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is tired of fighting with conventional crib sheets.  Before this sheet, I would literally have to REMOVE the crib matress to change the sheet. Now, with just a few snaps, the ultimate crib sheet is on or off with no sweat! We upgraded our single camera monitor recently because we are expecting another baby soon.  Unfortunately when we were buying our first one this monitor was way too expensive.  However, we just got a great deal on Cyber Monday purchasing this monitor for less than our old one (without the extra camera).    That being said, I LOVE this monitor.  Our previous monitor was a Lorex as well but this has improved many of it's flaws.    What I love:  1. The VOX function, many monitors didn't have this function and I love that I don't have to hear constant static in the background.  We have a sound machine running and it only comes on when my child is actually talking or crying.  I also love that you can adjust the sensitivity, I have a feeling we will be making it more sensitive when there is a newborn sleeping in the nursery.  2. Clear picture even in night mode my sleeping child is easy to see.  Big improvement from older model.  3. Two-way communication.  I kind of made fun of this one, but I have to say when I am moving my just turned two-year-old into a big bed in a month, I can see this being a great feature if he wonders out of bed.  4. Split-screen to view both cameras at the same time.  5. No bright LED lights on the hand held.  This was a big issue with the older model as well.  6. Light weight hand held.  7. Easy set up.  8. Knowing it is secure.  9. Absolutely no feedback from cell phones or other wireless devices!    What isn't so great:  1. It is hard to get the hand held just right into the cradle.  2. There is no way to set the hand held upright without cradle. However, I didn't love my last monitor's option either, I always felt like I was going to break it off and it wouldn't lay flat.  I think I would rather have this monitor that lays flat than one that can't stand unless you plug it in.  3. I think the camera function is kind of pointless.  I don't really know why you would want it but the camera isn't good enough for something like this anyway.      Why we stuck with a Lorex: We loved the VOX feature. Secure monitors. No cell phone feedback.

I put chia seeds in my oatmeal, in breads, and sometimes in yogurt.  I also use them to make my own version of an energy drink: a tablespoon of chia seeds mixed with half limeade (or lemonade if you prefer) and half water - delicious and refreshing, much better than Gatorade!

What we weren't expecting was the noise it made vibrating against the springs - as you put it under the mattress. Also, after the 30 minutes or so when it's about to shut off, it goes into crazy too fast vibrate mode that woke our baby up EVERY time. It was great if she was just falling asleep a little and we caught it before the shut off mode turned on. We wish this product stayed on until we turned it off.
Again, the product is as described in the product description - I just had high hopes that it would actually work for my sleepless child!

I just finished putting together my baby girls crib. I must say I am totally impressed. I am one of those types of people that tries to save money by buying used. So I looked for a used nice crib.
