Trying to stay away from all the GMO wheat, we've switched a lot of our recipes to spelt. This flour is ground much finer than the regular flour, so our first attempts turned out a bit more... flat? It seemed like the yeast was not strong enough to lift. So it's probably a good idea to use weight measurements (grams or the like) instead of cups.

Since it's so much, I split it into zip-lock bags and put it all in the freeze. It doesn't actually freeze together, so no problems measuring out how much I need and it won't spoil!

I usually don't write reviews but I have been so disappointed and frustrated with this product that I felt compelled to.

I know it's hard to find the perfect straw sippy cup that doesn't leak milk from the top of the straw but my son and I get sprayed with milk almost every time I flip the lid open. Milk also leaks from the lid. Unless you make sure to twist the lid onto the cup properly (which I have also found hard to gauge), milk will leak down the side of the cup and get all over your floor, table, counter, baby, etc. I have also found the sippy cup sitting in a puddle of milk on my table/counter tops multiple times, but again, I think a lot of straw sippy cups are just like that.

The weight at the bottom is a cool design concept but what's the point when you end up wasting just as much milk, if not more, from all of the leaking! For the price, I really do not think this product is worth it.

I use this product a lot, especially on grilled steaks.  I have learned to use it as part of a rub on my steaks.  I'll share what I do.    First I marinate the steaks for 30 minutes in a vacuum Foodsaver container, but a zip lock bag for 60-90 minutes would work.  (The vacuum opens the pores of the meat and lets the marinade better permeate the meat.)  Then I pat both sides dry and then add ground sea salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and then I liberally sprinkle Emeril's Southwest Essence and then hand pat them all into the meat so they all adhere to the meat.  Then I turn the steaks and do it again.    My Weber gas grill will always get to at least 600 degrees, and in the summer in Phoenix I oftern get over 650 degrees.  With a clean grill I simply place the steaks and close the cover.  I grill my steaks based solely on time.  Depending on the thickness it will be anywhere from 3-5 minutes per side, usually 3-3.5 minutes.  I open the grill, flip the steaks and close the cover again.  The flip side is usually 30 seconds less than the first side and once the timer goes off I remover the steaks and let them rest.  If I am grilling asparagus I grill them now while the steaks are resting for a total time of +/- 4 minutes.      By the time I get back to the kitchen the steaks will be rested and will be medium rare.    Like I said, the Emeril's spice is perfect for us on this meal and since we do steaks at least once a week in summer, we use this product a lot.
Bought several.  Good price.  Mix some raisins, Nuts or other some other ingredient plus use some whipping cream in your scones instead of water and you get great scones.  Will be buying more.

Was not impressed by how this product is built at all. Very cheap looking. Besides that the seal to prevent the milk from leaking does not work properly. A good strong black tea.  Has a good bite and stands up to the addition of milk.  Mixes well with flavored teas and provides an excellent blended finish.  Heartily recommended.

My son was born premature and was swaddled in this sleep sack by the occupational therapist while he was in the NICU.  I purchased the sleep sack once we got home once I saw how my son reacted to the sleep sack vs conventional swaddling in a blanket.  The sleep sack works (to me) better than conventional swaddling blankets and allows the baby to have room to move their legs around in their sleep (my son likes to do that and would get flustered in my conventional swaddling blankets when he couldn't move that much).
Is not stable when placed. One goo tug and it can fall out. Not happy at all. Do not buy it!!!

Tech that doesn't work is normally an irritant, in a baby monitor it is more than that. Works great for a short period of time and then will not connect at all. On the withings site a proposed remedy is to:
"Reset your baby monitor by the attached process
Remove the WithBaby app from your iPhone
Turn ON the Bluetooth on your iPhone
Connect your iPhone to your Wi-Fi network
Install WithBaby once again and follow the installation process"

After doing this repeatedly and getting at most 2 days of proper functioning, on a network with an airport extreme providing flawless connectivity to all other devices, I'm looking to invest in a device that works whether or not it has apple sequence styling.

...because I probably would not have bought this monitor and I LOVE it. It has all of the features that I did not know I needed. I can hear, see and feel if the monitor is going off. The sound is so sensitive that on the lowest setting, with her sound machine running, I can hear her breathing. I love that I can hear her breathing. The only issue I have is that the on/off button turns off a little easy and sometimes I don't realize I have turned it off.

I hate to say it, but I did not actually purchase this breast pump.  I thought breast feeding was going to be a cinch.  Then I actaully did it.  I was not very good at getting used to the pain.  When I came home from the hospital, a friend of mine had this pump in her attic from her child.  So I borrowed it and purchased my own accessories.  It was amazing.  I could pump and watch TV, balance the checkbook or read a book.  Then, I could still give my daughter breast milk.  Anytime my breasts began to swell, I would just turn the pump on.  Since it is electric, it is a little noisey, but not that bad at all.  I could pump while my daughter slept and it wouldn't wake her.  If my husband and I decide to have another baby, I am definitely buying this product for myself.  Compared to the pain from latching on, the price is nothing.

I purchased this for my new grand daughter. Had delivered directly to my daughters house. By the time I got to here home to assemble. Daughter already had it assembled. Everyone I know who is a new parent has one of these things.  They also have given up on it after a while. This thing is a great idea IF you have the ability/interest to spend time twirling what seems like yards of fabric around yourself AND a helper nearby to assist you with loading/unloading your infant. I had hoped this would be something I could throw into the diaper bag to quickly put on prior to going on solo shopping trips/errands outside the home. But no. I love the concept, but this is just too inconvenient for real-life use. BTW, I am a very short, petite person and the extreme length of this material made it impossible for me to put it on without having the tail ends of it dragging all over the floor...plus there was a lot of material left over that needed to be knotted up to keep from having it hanging in the way. A taller person might not have this problem with it. One last thing: I got this in the standard black color, and (in the day that I had it out of the box prior to returning it) it attracted all manner of lint and cat hair...definitely something you should be aware of if you have pets or are moderately housekeeping-challenged like myself.

I am converted ... never again will I bother making scones from scratch.  The 12-pack seemed excessive to me, but we're quickly working our way through it.  I don't really like plain scones, so we tried to get creative right off the bat.  With incredibly simple modifications, we've made cranberry orange scones, lemon scones, blueberry (Continental Mills has a few ideas/recipes on its website, too) ... And I also tried one reviewer's (JMce) suggestion for making more British-style scones, and wow - were they right.  Every iteration of this scone has been great.  And it's just the right amount for my Lodge scone pan.  What a wonderful mix.

It very hard these days to do the right thing for my family and the envorment when you are on a budget. So items like this that teast good and have a great price are a really wonderfull find. I will buy again and again.

My husband and I both run marathons, and have been training for fall marathons with our baby girl. When weather turned chilly and started to rain, we purchased this to keep her warm and dry. Prior to this we had just used the sun/insect shield, but got caught in a few unexpected rainstorms and ended up with a drenched baby. We have used this a couple of times, including through a good storm and she has remained dry. An added bonus is that the shield keeps toys and blankets inside the stroller, no more stopping to pick up objects pitched off the side! I hope to be able to continue running with her through the fall, even on chilly or wet days. It is difficult to put on the first couple of times, but gets easier with practice.

I've been using Frontier Spices and Herbs for about ten years now and i really like them. I started buying them at my local health food store and found the quality and price to be unbeatable - also you can buy in bulk for a great price if you use certain things a great deal in your cooking. I was thrilled to see that you can order just about everything they make thru amazon prime in the add-on program which is awesome. This is very finely ground pepper. It is peppery without being too overwhelmingly peppery. This last part is because some jokester posted a comment on my review that I did not review the product. So here ya go pepper fans! It's PEPPER!

The red heart-shaped plastic part snaps into the front of any Latch pacifier and has 2 functions 1) it includes the tiny button-activated heartbeat sound, and 2) it. Is attached to ~6 inch grosgrain ribbon with a clip on the other end. The clip which attaches to the baby's clothing to keep the pacifier from going astray, seems a bit over-engineered for the task. The round metal part flips back so that the plastic teeth are separated and when closed they have a very firm grip on the fabric. The ribbon clip is hand washable, and the heartbeat gadget seems to be sealed well enough to not be damaged by getting wet.

The heartbeat sound is exactly like what you hear from the ultrasound machine in the doctors office, so presumably it will be familiar to a newborn baby.

The pacifier is newborn-sized with a natural shaped nipple. The addition on the heartbeat gadget and clip makes it very practical and useful. The baby for which this is intended hasn't arrived yet, so we'll just have to see whether she will like the heartbeat sound and pacifier shape !

I've been fortunate to feed our 6 month old baby only breastmilk up until I became sick for a week and had to take medications. This caused my milk supply to diminish considerably. Out of desperation, I researched everything possible to increase my milk supply. These cookies seemed intriguing and with having a sweet tooth-I thought it was justifiable to eat these cookies. Let me first state the positive: these cookies are delicious! Now let me state the negatives: most of the cookies were broken into pieces-there was about 3 cookies that were completely intact. I'm not sure why they don't package these cookies differently to protect it from breaking. Second, they are expensive cookies for only 10 cookies. Third, there was absolutely no difference in my milk supply, which is the most important! Luckily, I read reviews for other herbal products to use and that gave me huge results with my milk supply. As much as I wanted these cookies to work, I wouldn't recommend this product.

I have eaten these since the 1970's. Some people who write reviews are pretty wacko. The size of the can and contents has never changed: 3.25 Oz. The size of the herring fillets inside the cans vary, as wild caught fish vary in size and shape. They do not contain \\"fish on a diet\\" as someone posted. A can may have 5 smaller fillets or one big one to make the can weight. I have NEVER broken the pull tab off. This brand is the only one which is really smoked (rather than \\"smoke juice added\\"). Herring are a managed global fishery which is not over harvested/pressured. There are plenty of them. They eat algae, plankton and small stuff, so they do not accumulate toxins like carnivore tuna and swordfish do. They are high in Omega 3 fatty acids. On a per pound basis, smoked salmon may be cheaper. Some people must think McDonalds only uses 4\\" square nets so they can only catch fish the right size and shape for fish fillet sandwiches. And someone else uses smaller nets to catch the fish stick fish.
Postscript: Walmart sells these for $1.36 a can! I grabbed all that were on the shelf!

Recently I have become more and more choosy with my coffee. I own a Keurig one-cup brewer as well as a traditional coffee maker.
For years, I have been using the same coffee brand ( med or dark, middle-of-the road priced) and it was affordable and it tasted just fine. Lately, I was lacking depth and body when brewing in the keurig( I have the cup you can put your own coffee in, which saves resources and $). It seemed like I couldnt' pack enough flavor into the little chamber to really have the right strength. The pre-packed, ready to use K cups were much better, but at 3 cups/day for me not feasible in the long run.
I read the reviews of the San Francisco Bay coffee ( fog chaser) and the price appealed to me and also what customers had described, so I tried it. Besides the much more affordable price and far more \\"green\\" packaging, I find the flavor fantastic!
Bold, yet sophisticated, not just strong- really pleasant flavor ! A very good choice at an attractive price!. These cups look different, but I like them much better with their filter-like body and 12-count bagging. Now I don't feel guilty when I indulge with more than 1 K cup. For loose coffee to put into the reusable cup I choose a def. dark roast like italian or french, which is very comparable to the Fog chaser's aroma.
it broke the 3rd time we used it.  too late to return - waste of money!  I should have bought the old fashioned jack in the box

I love popcorn. It's a fantastic and very flexible snack. I'm less a fan of microwave popcorn because I really can't tell what's in it, and it seems not only unhealthy but relatively expensive. Our household has been experimenting with different flavors for the past few years. Caramel corn is the easiest but sugary, and getting a cheese to stick to it is a bit of work. You really do need a powder, and something finer than the chunky shakeable parmesan so many of us put on our spaghetti. We have food allergies in the house as well, so we have to be careful with the ingredients.

Enter "Kernel Season's White Cheddar". I had high hopes to begin with - it meets our food allergies (gluten-free, no MSG), and it came in a large container (8.5 oz). The directions were a bit vague (sprinkle liberally), and I've still not found a "sweet spot" of how much to add. Sprinkling it by itself on hot popcorn isn't enough to get it to stick to the kernals, and you'll regret inhaling with a piece in your mouth (unless you like cheese powder in the back of your throat).

This product does work very well if mixed with some melted butter, though, especially clarified butter (skim the fat off the top). We've been trying to keep the mix close to 1/4 cup popcorn (before air-popping in the microwave), 1 TBsp butter, 3 TBsp Kernal Season's seasoning. Works gorgeously, and the cheddar flavor goes so well with butter I suspect this would make a very tasty mac'n'cheese. I haven't tried it in a sauce yet but I should.

Something that may seem small but is important to me is the container itself. It doesn't let the seasoning get messy. The lid is deep and seals tightly, and there's no fine grains of the powder spilling out into it when I take the lid off. That's important, especially considering how fine the product's texture is - I really did expect it to cake up around the pouring spout or get all over the place, and after three weeks (and probably a dozen batches of popcorn) it hasn't.

Bottom line, this is a tasty product that has many uses due to its fine consistency - again, it would work wonderfully in a sauce as well as a seasoning. I'm quite happy with it and wanting to try another variety.dozen batches of popcorn) it hasn't.

Bottom line, this is a tasty product that has many uses due to its fine consistency - again, it would work wonderfully in a sauce as well as a seasoning. I'm quite happy with it and wanting to try another variety.

I've been paying 2 bucks @ for 16oz bottles of a certain company's half-and-half product. but for a little more than 2 bucks, I can make a gallon of the stuff (ok, my version is obviously not organic or super-natural. but it tastes good enough and I can control the sugar content)

- 1 packet mandarina-tangerine kool aid, unsweetened
- 4 heaping spoons instant tea, unsweetened
- 1/3-1/2lb honey
- water to fill to 1 gallon

for some reason this feels nicer when it comes out of the fridge in an icy cold gallon glass jug. but it's also easy to get a plastic 1 gallon spring water from the store, pour out a cup of water, add ingredients, cover+shake, add water back to fill. I think it's the honey that rescues the mediocre instant tea, but obviously you can save even more money using sugar or other sweetener.

We've had all of the aforementioned problems.  Right off the bat one of the snaps holding the fabric sides to the armrests in the back broke.  No biggie- it wasn't sharp.  Our wheels turned in as well (like this / \) but we figured it was to make it easier to go over terrain like dirt and grass.  Nope- just a shoddily made product.  Our wheel fell off when we were at Disneyland (granted we did have the stroller for a year and a half, but we did notice the wheels at the store and asked about them- the sales person had NO idea why they were bent in like that).  Well, we called evenflo and they sent us a replacement rear assembly.  We put it on, but the wheels still turned in, although not as badly. It is now about 8 months later and the left wheel is about ready to fall off.  We are well under the combined 80 lb. weight limit so I don't know why we keep having this problem.  A few months ago the tray broke.  We did a quick fix with duct tape, then my husband was able to fix it (it wasn't easy- a screw on the inside fell out, but luckily he had a screwdriver extender that was small enough to fit).  I don't mind normal wear and tear (for exapmle, the black foam grip on the handle is torn, no big deal), but this is ridiculous.  So I will call and get yet ANOTHER replacement, which means I will be a week or more without my stroller.  Big pain.  I can't believe they are still selling this inferior product.  I like the stroller- it's not too heavy, folds fairly compactly, good sized storage basket, reasonably easy to maneuver, not ridiculously expensive, but with all the design flaws, I recommend another stroller.  Word to the wise: make sure you research a stroller before you buy!!!  Read the customer reviews- you'll be glad you did.  If I had, I never would have bought this stroller.

DO NOT BUY THIS SOUP, PERIOD!  I live in the Annapolis, MD, area basically the middle of Maryland Blue Crab Country...and the Wye River Red Crab Soup is simply a disgrace.  This soup is merely a low end tomato vegetable soup.  What's concerning is that "CRAB MEAT" is listed as the 3rd ingredient, when in reality I really don't think there is ANY crab in it...probably only crab seasoning.  I purchased 6 cans, which are expensive, to feed our family of 6 thinking it would be a nice, quick, & easy meal that the kids will love (and we all love REAL Maryland Crab Soup).  The Wye River is located on the eastern shore of Maryland...so the total soup name is a scam.  To say we were disappointed is an understatement.  To make this matter even more troubling, is that there is a "History of Wye River Crab Soup" written by Joe Bernard, and apparently it's his family's long time recipe, which I read before purchasing (so I guess you can say Bernard reeled me in!).  Either Bernard's family is clueless on the basics of food or this old time recipe was altered significantly to feed the bottom line of their pockets.  Importantly, the management of Wye River Foods should be ashamed of themselves for actually making and selling this awful product.  Given the fact that somehow they scammed grocery stores to find shelf space, I would encourage everyone to not buy anything from Wye River Foods located in Queenstown, MD.  www.WyeRiverSeasonings.com

I have tried this product (chocolate) and I liked the taste and the way it tasted when I froze it.  That being said, I think that many protein powders that you mix with a tablespoon or two of peanut butter will be yummy and will freeze well.  I normally check labels when I buy food, but I didn't when I ordered Protein Freeze. When I saw what was in it I wasn't thrilled but most of the time I can have a little bit of artificial sweetener and not have discomfort. I was ok with Protein Freeze and didn't have any trouble digesting it.  When I ran out, I debated reordering, but it seemed like the shipping (on the website) was expensive for what I considered a so-so product.   I went to GNC instead and asked for the cleanest powder that they sold, and the sales woman showed me \\"About Time\\", which doesn't have artificial sweeteners and had better nutritional numbers (lower in carbs and fats) than Protein Freeze.    I bought some and mixed in two tablespoons of peanutbutter with a scoop and a half of the powder and some water. It was AWESOME!  It's less awesome without the PB, but still drinkable  I didn't try to freeze the protein from GNC but I have a feeling it would be on-par or better than Protein Freeze.  So to sum up, I think Protein Freeze is good but not great... nothing special.  Additionally,  the whole idea of freezing or making a variety of things with protein powder isn't particularly original... just good marketing.  Here's a link to the About Time protein that I mentioned:  [[ASIN:B003BL6PMM SDC Nutrition About Time 100% All Natural Whey Isolate Chocolate Flavor 2 lbs]]

I was skeptical of this when I ordered it. It seemed a bit flimsy/not-sturdy in the pictures. When I put my baby in it for the first time, she was a but unsure of it and wobbled around quite a bit. I had to cinch up the straps all the way to keep her secure. Now, one month into having it, she is very secure and absolutely loves it! I haven't traveled with it yet, but will be next month. We bought it because we didn't want to add yet another piece of baby \\"stuff\\" to clutter our house.   It holds up well in the wash. I always air dry it (per the instructions). My only complaint is the color/fabric options. I bought the green/blue stripe to have a gender neutral color, but I would love to have it in a solid color: black, cream, or white, so it wouldn't stick out so much in our dining room.

I received these asa promotion from Smiley360 a product testing site and I am pleased with them. they are great for taking the kids out in the woods and also for when my son was sick they helped to keep him hydrated and he didnt throw them up like he usually does gatorade or pedialite

Just what the title says \\"Where's the Peanuts\\". Every box I have bought the peanuts are small and few and far between. It should be called \\"Old Dominion Brittle\\". Have bought my last box of this brand.

4 stars overall....definitely a solid 5 stars for its price. Mine arrived with some slight damage, but solely cosmetic.
No instructions came with it, but with only 6 screws and 4 washers, I somehow managed just fine. Once assembled, it felt very sturdy, very comfortable, and despite the damage to an area, a very nice addition to our nursery.

I received these as a sample in with some nuts (Praline Pecans) that I had bought through Costco but were shipped directly from Hoodys. These were soooo delicious. I am usually not even a huge a fan of dill pickles (which I thought these might taste like) so I didn't even try the nuts right away. This may sound odd, but the reminded me slightly of how a McDonald's Cheeseburger tastes. My husband concurred with that assessment. I think they are wonderful.
This item is beautiful it is really not made for all stairways just, my 10 month old grandson thinks he is the hulk and try to shake it off the steps but so far so good.
Bounced these strollers all around Hawaii and they held up well. For the cost, these strollers are light and super easy to travel with!

I purchased two of these (a friend's recommendation) for a trip to Maui.  Although it was a direct flight, the idea of chasing my 3.5 year old and 1.5 year old around the airport was enough to give me a headache.  Also, the kids had their own seats and we were bringing their car seats aboard.  The Travelmates were worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY.  The kids' car seats attached easily and we literally rolled them through the airport, security, and to the gate.  They were securely buckled in to their own familiar seat and my daughter even called the rolling around \\"a ride\\".  The handles have different height adjustments to work for short or tall people and there is literally one strap that locks in the seat.  They couldn't be any easier to use.  Also, they fold down easily and store in the overhead compartment on the plane.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the Travelmate, I think I could have sold at least five to other moms/dads who all asked me about them.

Yogurettes are the most exquisitely delicious candy in the world to me.  They are worth the 12 hour flight to Germany.  But buying them over the internet is a great improvement.  Absolute heaven for your mouth.  And practically health food with \\"yogurt\\" in them!

We love that we can buy multiple gates and connect them however we need to fit a certain space. We purchased two of them to make a larger area in our living room it has been a godsend keeping our twin babies happy and active in their large play area
Love this item you get a pop in your mouth and the salt is so good.  It is expensive at other locations this is a good deal.

I ordered these as a second pair when I was pumping at work. For sure these are different than the thicker ones that came with my electric pump, but for me they allowed for the same quantity of pumped milk and the same degree of comfort. The design of these is much simpler, so I can clean these with just a cloth, whereas I felt I needed to use the nipple cleaning brush to get at the little spaces in my original pair. When you're working full time and slogging through a sink full of bottle and pump parts at night, that little bit of saved time makes you feel good lol. Plus it meant I could wash these at work without having to bring the nipple brush with me.

The only weird thing about these is the neck is short and the diaphragm gets a little scrunched up, which is a puzzling bit of design, but it doesn't seem to affect the performance. Just makes me wonder if it would wear out the diaphragm a little faster (I used them daily for about 12 weeks and they were still working fine).

Also, as is mentioned in the product description, these will not work with the manual pump (they don't have the ring of plastic around the neck that the manual one connects to), so keep that in mind if you use the manual pump too.
We use this by itself sprinkled over salad, or with a little olive oil. It is very full of flavor, very satisfying to the taste if you like vinegar.

I use cloth diapers on all three kids, but still need a diaper pail for dirty wipes and the few disposable diapers that I do use.  I've owned and used this diaper pail for the last four years and it is my favorite all-around diaper pail.  It's hands free so you don't spread any messes and the large opening makes it easy to get the dirty things inside.  I line it with a standard \\"medium\\" size store-brand trash bag.  Actually I can fit more inside this diaper pail than in my more expensive \\"no odor\\" pail.  This diaper pail would also work really well if you used it for your dirty cloth diapers (I use cloth diaper pails for that, though).  As for the stinky smell coming out when you open the lid, considering what's inside, I think that should be expected, but it's only while the lid is open.  Otherwise, when the lid is closed, it contains odors really well.  I would definitely buy this again and I recommend it to new mothers.
My son loves these toys they are easy for him to handle and can be cleaned easily. Also good for travel. use room temperature or freeze them.

I have tried all of the organic sugars I have been able to find at my local coops, and Whole Food type stores. Domino has a superior flavor, and my baking results are always good.

Other organic sugars have given me trouble with consistency in how my recipes turn out. In addition they taste \\"sicky\\" sweet in puddings and the like.

I cannot recommend Domino Organic sugar highly enough.

I immediately contacted the seller after my first cup to commend them on their product and promptly order 10 more bags of coffee.  GREAT COFFEE!!!!

I've brewed my own tea for as long as I can remember.  My great- grand mother always brewed her tea and I've learned from the best.  I drink approximately 2 gallons each and every week.  When I saw this tea on Amazon and read the reviews online I decided to give it a try. And am I glad I did.  It is simply good, pure, unsweetened iced tea. I purchase this same thing from Solofill a year ago for a friend as a gift. Since it works perfectly in her K145 brewer I was sure it would in my K145 too. Not so. It leaks coffee all over & out the sides where the stream of coffee comes out. I have tried another reusable k-cup from a different company that works great. I even tried half as much coffee, still leaked and a weak cup (I like it strong) The regular K-Cups work good too so I know it is not my brand new brewer. Pretty top notch stuff! I just read an article about how many pesticides there are on other conventional teas, so I decided to go for something organic. Am a new to the Keurig k-cup subculture.  Migrated from a Dunkin Donuts drip coffee brewer to k-cup single serve method. Just ordered this tea for the first time, I drink copious amounts of loose leaf tea and this particular type has intrigued me for some time. I adore violet flavored or scented things, and this tea did not disappoint.

Delivery and Packaging: This tea arrived extremely fast! I ordered it on the twenty-third and had it by the twenty-fifth with no special shipping options. Packaged securely. The tin itself is lovely and snug.

The tea: I could smell the violet immediately, though my husband, who isn't as familiar with the scent, had trouble. It blends well with the scent of the tea itself, though I was disappointed to find no actual petals in it (the only reason I gave it four instead of five stars). Another reviewer mentioned it was weak, but I found following the recommended steeping time made an excellent cup of tea. I drink mine with no sugar or milk of any kind and found it to be floral and simple, not bitter or malty, with the aroma of violets persisting with every sip. I will absolutely buy this again.

My son really likes this gym. He did not appreciate it much when he was at the 0-2 month mark, but since he has been 3-5 months, he loves to kick and bat at the dangling toys and even press the keyboard buttons.
It has 2 sound levels, but we only use it at home on the lowest level. If we were in a noisey environment, the loud setting may be useful.
My only cons for this item are that, since he is rolling all over the place now, sometimes he gets his head stuck in the \\"Y\\" part of the stand. So far he has been able to get himself out of it; if not I would discontinue use of the toy.
Another thing that is kind of a peeve is that the stars start out singing the words to \\"Twinkle, twinkle little star\\", and then start la-ing and da-ing. It's almost like someone forgot the words or something. It doesn't bother me, but my husband thinks it is irritating.

It was really satisfying and I love that you get your coffee kick with protein. Also, I sometimes tend to have too much caffeine and this in a way prevents me from overdoing it. I like that as well.

Give them a try if you either do not have breakfast or just drink coffee or a shake in the AM. You won't regret it!

I got this swing as a gift at my shower and I absolutely love it.  My daughter is seven weeks old and she will only sleep in her swing at night, she definately perfers the cradle position. This tub comes with a newborn \\"sling\\" and three toys.  The sling was the perfect way to bathe our daughter while her cord was still attached.  We just put her in the sling (shown in the picture), wiped her off with a washcloth, and then were able to pour water over her head into the tub to wash her hair.  Around 3 weeks or so we were able to start putting her in the newborn side of the tub.  The newborn side has a back that is slightly reclined and the infant side has a back that is straight up.  Once she is able to sit up without assistance we will start bathing her on the infant side.  The tub has a little \\"hill\\" between the seats to prop her knees up so that she doesn't slide down.  It also has a small place behind the infant side where the three toys can be stored.  She's not big on the one that squirts water yet, but she loves the little one that sprinkles water.    It's a great little tub and had a pretty reasonable price when we bought it.

I have been using it for breakfast, and sometimes lunch, too, for over 6 months and have lost 42 pounds so far!  Am very pleased.

I bought this adaptor a month ago, and let me tell you, I read a lot of reviews and many of them of 1 star, but this is a 5 star product, it's less than 3 dollars, it looks a little cheap, but it works great, really great. I have the The New iPad (3rd Generation), and it works really good.

The first time you connect it to the iPad says \\"not enough power\\" or \\"not compatible, it's ok don't worry.

All you need is:

First, make sure your Flash Drive is formatted in FAT32 not NTFS.

Second, Install \\"iFile\\" from Cydia.

To use an external Hard Drive you can install \\"USB Mount SBSettings Toggle\\" also from Cydia.

Then plug in your storage device and open iFile, look for \\"Flash Drive\\" in the left side and it's ready to use.

First time I ever applied such items to a wall.  They came as advertised, with good directions.  There is also a customer help line that you can phone should you need assistance.  I did not need to use it, as it was quite easy to apply them after I read the directions.  If you order the trees, you will need two people to put them up.  They are very large and you need someone peeling the backing as the other person smooths it out.  Overall, I am quite pleased.  I will order from this company again.  It is also made in the U.S. so I was not as worried about chemicals like I may have been if it came from another country.

I was happy to find elbow shaped veggie pasta, after looking for some time. I have a picky eater who loves mac and cheese, which I try to health-up with pureed veggies, etc. (sometimes I even omit the cheese). But he's not keen on rotini or bow tie pasta--the only shapes I could find for veggie pasta--so I've been using whole wheat. These are a great alternative.

The taste and texture are more like regular pasta, if you or one of your eaters don't like whole wheat.

Bamboozles are my absolute favorite diaper. My mom gifted us with 4 to try right after we'd started using cloth on our newborn son and we've been using them since he was 3 weeks old. He's now almost 7 months and still fits into the small size of Bamboozles.     After 6 months of use (and twice-weekly laundering on an extra-hot sanitizing cycle & mostly line drying) they're still in perfect condition- the unbleached color has faded quite white and they have no stains whatsoever. The snaps are well-positioned and these diapers can go directly from your baby to the laundry pail; no fastening of closures or laundry tabs is necessary.    They are terrific for nighttime- we've never had a leak- and even the newborn blowouts were unable to escape this diaper. On top of it all, they're cute and really soft, even after line-drying. Even when the Bamboozle is soaked, my baby's bottom remains quite dry. I like to use them with a paper liner wrapped around the sewn-in doubler for easy poop removal. For such an absorbent diaper, they are pretty trim as well.    I should mention that they are slower to dry than any other diaper that we've used (including all-in-ones), but this has not been an issue as we live in a dry climate. If you want them to be super soft (the fabric fibers are almost silky when new), use the dryer rather than a clothesline. Line drying makes them a bit rougher feeling, though this will not affect their absorbency.    These work well with any roomy diaper cover- I prefer Wonder Wraps, but also use Imse Vimse and Bummis Super Whisper Wraps.

I was looking for an organic, loose leaf, black tea that is similar in flavor to the Lipton I have used all my life. I drink mainly black teas, both hot and cold, and prefer my iced tea "plain", with a bit of sugar. This tea is perfect for that. And it is definitely a higher quality tea, with full leaves instead of fannings. I use the Takeya flash chill iced tea maker, which works well. It has a very fine mesh infuser that works for even really chopped up leaves. You obviously don't need a "tea maker" (I have always just used a glass pitcher, water and tea bags), but the Takeya is a fun gadget. I like gadgets. :)

So, if you are looking for a good quality, "normal" black tea, in my opinion, this fills the bill. I will definitely be ordering more.
This is exactly what we needed to go with the Cosco Funsport Play Yard!!  It fits perfectly and our little Granddaughter sleeps so soundly and peacefully in it!  I would recommend it to anybody!!

I had about a good oz from my let down and the cup didnt leak at all. They are very comfy also. I use to have alot of pain after nursing/pumping due to rubbing against my bra. But now theres no pain. I cant even tell Im wearing them! With my padded nursing bra you cant even tell im wearing them. Best product ive bought as a nursing mom! This is not chili. It's soup.
If you are looking for chili, you won't find it this bag. To turn a pot of this into chili, pour out the pot, and make chili in the pot with a complete set of ingredients. Or don't throw out the soup... But you will still need a complete set of ingredients.

This is like my 4th buy of these bars from amazon.com These taste fantastic! I love eating these as a snack. These sale for $5.00 per box at any grocery store, so you're getting these at a great deal from amazon.com for a pack of 6. But a pack of 6 won't last very long.

The packaging was decent as expected from Amazon.com. Packed in a box, with bubble bags, and wrapped in plastic in the bundle so you know it's safe to eat these.

These are the perfect snack to eat if your hungry after dinner to maintain a stable diet. I always keep at least one in my purse incase I ever get hungry.

This is seriously the most bang for your buck in an exersaucer. I wish I would have found it before I bought his tummy time mat, because there is one included. He is one and still loving this, we are almost ready to transform it to the standing play station that it becomes in a addition to the bouncy-type seat. The musical features aren't too bad to listen to on repeat which is really important as baby discovers cause-effect with button pushing.  I highly recommend this one!

This is a fun little toy/teether.
The krinkle sounds keeps my grandson going back for this toy.
It came with a little teething ring that he realy seems to like to chew on.

I use this purely as a beauty product. Keeps my skin moisturized (both face & body). The small amount I use on my hair has allowed me to stop using any gel or other hair product for my curly hair. I also use it as a deep conditioner once or twice a month. Oh, & by the way, this makes me smell sooo good!

I love the Baby Bum Brush and love giving them as baby gifts! I am only giving 4 stars because I wish it came in a larger variety of colors... Maybe yellow, gray, or white.  I like to be able to match gifts to the baby's nursery.

It's a great product. Unfortunately, it reads I love Daddy but the description is wrong. If you order this product, the set you receive will read I love Mommy. Amazon was absolutely WONDERFUL in dealing with this issue with me. They went ABOVE and BEYOND in customer SATISFACTION. THANK YOU AMAZON, ALWAYS GREAT to work with you.
Both my daughter and I like the seaweed very much,  I make sushi for my daughter, she likes the seaweed. high recommended.

I have both the firefly and the turtle. Both have pros and cons. I prefer the turtle because of the large mirror on his belly. My newborn has been fascinated with this since she was a month old. The firefly mirror on the wing is too small to interest her even though she is now 3 months old. However, the tangling teether from the firefly should come in handy in another month or two. If you were to buy only one Lamaze for a newborn, I recommend the turtle for its nice size mirror.

I found these initially at a discount store.  I liked them so much as did my friends,  that I wanted another box.  Unfortunately, the discount store no longer had any.  Obviously, there was a BIG price difference.  The product is good, but the cost may make it prohibitive in the future.

This order was delivered very quickly and packaged well.  We have to have plenty on hand because we love it so much.  Robust flavor without coming on too strong.  You know you are drinking coffee.  Tasty.
I am using this turmeric in Golden Paste (turmeric, black pepper, water and coconut oil) to take as an anti-inflammatory for me and my horse.
When I opened the packaging I was surprise to find one of the best tasting cookie I have had in a while. Not only did it taste great, the texture was perfect and it was fresh.

Wonderful little toy... my 6 month old granddaughter loves the moving lights. I like that she can push the button, even though she hasn't quite figured out what it does yet (change the tune). It is easy for her little hands to grip and the colors and designs of the entire toy are very nice. The music selections are wonderful and a nice change from the traditional music we usually hear on toys for the 'under one group'. Well done Baby Einstein !
Product is actually made in China.  I called LA Baby to verify before I purchased.  They have yet to update the description.  This bed also comes with a 3" mattress.

This is a great product for the faucet where your toddler washes up.  Without it, he couldn't reach the water and I would slop water everywhere trying to help him rinse off.  No more of that.  Very nice.

We make it with chicken and coconat milk.
It taste so good and even our kid love it. It is good for every age.
Yum!  I add this to my coffee for a nice frothy cup.  I hate dull coffee.

Potty training is difficult enough without leaky training pants, which is just what these are. They hold virtually nothing, even when changed every hour, the littlest accidents leak right  through! My son just got through potty training last summer/fall which is where I came to know the Dappi brand vinyl diaper/underwear covers. They are awesome, holding so much I would put my son in tub to take them off. So when I came accross these Dappi Early Trainers, all in one pants, I knew they would be perfect for my 22-month-old daughter who is just starting her training. The Dappi vinyl covers were just amazing, so why would these, also made by Dappi be so different. The \\"absorbent\\" cotton lining is extremely thin, and even as the Dappi Early Trainers are a bit snug in the legs, there is leakage from there as well as up her back, through her clothing, they're vitually useless! I have had to use a \\"Pull Up\\" with the pants, since the only use Dappi Early Trainers have proven themselves for is a deterent against my free-spirited girl taking her diaper/Pull Up off (a favorite pastime of hers) and making even worse messes than she would with just the Dappi Early Trainer. So what's the point, this item is supposed to replace Pull Ups? Not for those in Early Training..maybe later stages!

I needed a medium-size blanket for traveling with my 3 year old...this one is perfect for that purpose.  It's large enough to keep him completely covered on his travel cot during naptime and at night, but not so large that it's bulky and inconvenient for packing.  It is lightweight and so soft...he loves to snuggle in it!  And the vintage plane design is super cute...just right for our plane-loving boy!  This was a really good purchase for us, especially at this price.
These snacks are also light and great and everyone should try them - they won't be disappointed.

I had the Evenflo medium flow nipples and thought I'd try these out since I was in need of fast flow nipples.  These nipples leak.  I wish I hadn't opened all three packages so I could return some of them.

I have been using Yacon Syrup for three months and I love it. My bottle was just finished when I received Living Natural Yacon Syrup. Yacon syrup recently became popular after it was featured on The Dr.Oz Show. The Episode that featured this product is called, "Find Out Your Metabolism Personality to Lose Weight"! He referred to it the â€œmetabolism game changerâ€.

The biggest changes that are decrease in my appetite and boost of energy. I donâ€™t eat as much food as I use to and I am more active. I also tend to drink a lot more water than I usually do but I realized it's because I was taking it too much. If you do, it will give you the feeling of bloating and gas production. It's like overeating on shredded wheat cereal. Regardless, I take one (1) teaspoon three times a day by itself and sometimes with my Cream of Wheat and Health Shakes.

I put it in my oatmeal, smoothies and I've used it for baking. The consistency is very thick and a dark brown-color like molasses. It has a smooth chocolate aroma. I really love the taste.

Results will vary on individual circumstances. I will recommend this products to anyone that wants to lose weight. However, I also do my workouts so you have to do some kind of physical activity and eat healthy to maintain the weight loss.

I received this product in exchange for an unbiased review. Regardless, I only recommend products or services I use and believe will be good.

This was exactly what I needed. I love that it had extenders so I could use it on my stairwell as well.  Although my 9 month old doesn't like it, mom and dad love the fact that we can just open to get through instead of climbing over it!!
These are a different kind of nut bar from what I'm used to, and I like them. The flavors are unique, and they are not too sweet. The flavors grow on you as you eat them.

This is the perfect single electric pump for on the go. The only thing I'm not crazy about (with this or with the double) are the petals. They're pointless. The milk gets trapped underneath it and it leaks all over you. That's the ONLY downside to this whole unit. If they were to make the petal cover extend longer and taper off in thickness down inside the flange it may not trap milk. Aside from that I love this product and it's manual pump pieces are great to have handy when the batteries die (after about 4 full pumping sessions).
It's a useful product. I use it for cooking, my hair, my skin, and even for getting rid of fleas on my cat. It works really well.

I obtained this coffee locally so it won't be listed as a Verified Purchase, but I had to review it since it's so good.

This is no joke: I will stop many times throughout the day to smell my bag of Kenya AA. I wish I could bottle the scent.

From aroma to taste, there's no comparison between Wollman and what you'd get at your local supermarket. As one who usually adds some sort of dairy to my coffee, I think Wollman's is better without. I've had the Guatemala and the Kenya and both are fantastic.

Highly recommended.

We had read some good reviews and some unfavorable reviews about this item, but we really like it. It took a little bit to install it, but now it is very easy to use. It is a great deal for the money and was rated highly by consumer reports.

My granddaughter loves her Angel Dear Blankie, Brown Monkey.  She calls it Lovey.  Because Lovey accompanies her everywhere, I ordered a second Lovey just in case her security Lovey is lost.  It's soft and durable...a reliable product.
I love this Coconut Oil!!  It smells great, doesn't irritate my very sensitive skin and I really think it makes my skin feel softer!  Definitely a re-purchase product for me!
6 month old really likes it and there is room for her to grow with it. Very comfy and sturdy.
they taste fine, fairly low in fat but Amazon doesn't ship them right.  They are useless as bits.

My boyfriend bought this for our four-month old since we wanted one that would stay cleaner and more sanitary.  This one has the plastic cover that folds like a clam shell cover the chewy rubbery part when she's not sucking on it but the problem is that when the plastic part is open it pushes the pacifier too far away from her face and she can't get a good hold on it in her mouth, so it almost always falls out right away.  I love the cute design on the front and the idea of the plastic cover but in the end the design does not work well for my baby.

I live in a techie house. Lots of WiFi, Cell Signal Extenders, etc. So I can't honestly say that something else might have caused the interference that I experienced with this model, HOWEVER, I imagine that living in a large city or apartment building that you'd run into the same problems that we faced with these monitors.

I wasn't able to use these for more than a week without giving up. While the packaging, design and features were great, the actual quality of the signal was not.

I do not recommend purchasing this product.
the resolution and audio are very good . The portability allows to take the system everywhere. The night vision is good.
Wow , i rarely eat peanut butter, but i must say that i would eat reeses peanut butter with chocolate, its the best tasting spread that I've had in a long time ,, I highly recommend it

Pack this and a dental floss for quick mouth cleaning after a restaurant meal.  I like the original altoids but the case was too big and a bit messy due to the powders. This one solve the problem, the portion is small then what you paid for but is well for worth the easier travel size and no more power mess, buy this from costco not here, costco is only like $8 something half cost of amazon $17 currently showing.  This probably not good for kids since isn't sweet at all, is has very strong mint tasted like the big brother despite smaller size. Basically quicker get you the mint without a lot of biting and travel friendly size.
I received a sample along with an order of coffee and it is OK but sure isnt my favorite. I wouldn't buy it again. I think the plain hot cocoa is much better.
as always this tea is my favorite and im never disappointed and this bag lasts a long time 3rd time ordering from this co.

I didn't realize before reading some recipes online that Grade B isn't worse quality, it is actually healthier.  It is harvested later in the season I believe.  So many of the healthy recipes I have read specify Grade B.  This product is good and at a good price.

Product is cheaply made and accompanying kid's board book is a waste of paper. We had high hopes that this would be a quality purchase. Instead, I'd like to pack it up and send it back already, and we just got it today. The velcro back opening won't stay shut. So, there's a gaping hole, with battery pack and cables easily accessible to the child. The 3-position switch inside has no "on/off" indicator, although the paperwork says it should. Reaching inside to set it is a bother, especially when you can't even know the setting. Further, the "press here" button on the monkey's hand that should work the electronics inside doesn't do so. Sorry to say that the product idea is far better than its execution. That said, the second book, the one for parents, contains good information on different approaches to potty training, and I would have purchased that alone had it been an option.

I used to love the Atomic Fireball jawbreakers as a teenager back in the Fifties. A package lasted a long time with a nice combination of cinnamon and red hot. Then they disappered into the mists of time until a friend found them in a specialty candy shop. I still like them, but the jawbreakers are bad on my teeth.    Then, last year at Wegman's, I discovered chewy Atomic Fireballs which have the great cinnamon taste and the blast of heat, but will not break teeth! In fact, they're much better than red hots or any of the other \\"hot\\" cinnamon candies. I fell in love with them all over again, and then Wegman's dropped them from their candy section!    Fortunately, we have the internet and Amazon and I can indulge myself freely. Thanks you Atomic Fireballs and Amazon! Highly recommended.    John

Works great on bottles and the little nipple brush is great! Also love the various colors that you can choose from. We've given these for baby showers, along with  a bottle of Vitaville Argan oil to the expecting mom for her itchy skin/tummy and stretch marks. There is no way of cleaning bottles without this, as simple as it is.

I did not like Betty Lou's Chocolate Walnut Nut Butter Balls as much as I had hoped I would like them. The flavor is not on the sweet side at all. I will eat them because do not want them to go to waste. I will just have to remember that they do contain healthy nutrients.   I put one in my organic apple-cinnamon cereal yesterday hoping that the cereal would sweeten them up a bit. I think I expected they would taste more like a granola bar but they did not.

This is a good size and protects the floor while my 9 month old learns how to feed himself. It's a decent weight, but I took off one star because when I rolled the high chair on and off of it it does not stay put in can be a pain to reposition.

These little 5 hour energy shots really work. They kick it in a matter of minutes and you don't feel groggy afterwards.The taste is good as well...you can refrigerate them, and drink them nice and cool. Only 4 calories and contains Niacin, Vitamin B6, Folic Acid, Vitamin B12, Sodium, and an Energy Blend that consist of Taurine, Glucuronolactone,Malic Acid,N-Acetyl,L-Tyrosine,L-Phenylalaline,Caffeine,Citicoline. Maybe can try mixing it in with a smoothie shake!

This is a nice green tea, but while it has a nice hint of jasmine in the bag it really gets lost in brewing so that this really just tastes more like a good green tea.  If that's what you're after I'd recommend this tea, but if you're after a more jasmine fragrance and flavor experience I find this one a little weak.  The Adagio Jasmine I used to order (now I guess listed as an Oolong by them) was much more to my liking, but it also was a bit overpowering to some so like everything it comes down to personal taste.

While I'm a chocolate lover and love dark bittersweet chocolate, this is just a bit much for me to imbibe on by itself ... however, it works extremely well in recipes and smoothies.  So if you buy it and find it's too much to use as a standalone snack, go ahead and give it a go in some of your recipes that call for chocolate bits, I think you'll find that combined with other things, the nibs provide a very nice and healthy way to get your chocolate in while providing your recipes with a nice flavor.  For example, Jason Wrobel has a recipe for 'Chocolate Pecan Crunchy Balls' that's out of this world.  Even though he's a vegan and I'm a primal/paleo eater, this recipe is frelling awesome (and I double the amount of cacao nibs in it too).  Give it a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.
I received a free sample of this product and I'm glad I did. My niece took it willingly and didn't complain about the taste. It helped clear her cough and congestion pretty quickly.

its really cute,the tow master tow in my opinion could be an eye hazard, i have to keep turning it straight so it doesnt hit his eye. i have wooden flooring but rugs and mats and the walker doesnt go over them. i removed the blue things at the bottom and now it goes over carpets. the back wheels are straight so the walker has to turn via the front wheels.i love that its a 2 in 1 so i guess thats why the back wheels are straight so when the kids are pushing the walking it doesnt slide and go in all directions.it doesnt fold so it would have to be taken apart. i found it a bit difficult to attach the right metal bit to the walker as it was too tight i had to unscrew the metal from the walker attach it then put it back together. i like it it isnt as easy as the walkers with all swivel legs but as its a 2 in 1 i understand why the back wheels are straight.

This rocker was purchased for my mom and she loves it.  It is a nice rocker that isn't noisy and provides a smooth rocking back and forward.  Cushions are nice neutral color.  Only complaint is that the seat cushion is thin and hasn't held its shape.  It has been used everyday for the last month by my mom who is only 124 pounds, and  the cushion has already lost its loft. Otherwise it was a wise purchase.

For me, Shock Coffee has a fine, roasty flavor. It certainly DOES give you a boost and a large one. I am an Arabica bean gal but I really don't taste the common Robusta bitterness. Not at all. What I do get is a full bodied start with a smooth finish. I really like it. The Shock-a-lots are awesome too!

At first, I just stared at this contraption like what????  After my initial confusion, this is the easiest aspirator to use.  One side goes on the outside of the kid's nostril and the other tube goes in your mouth.  Sounds gross, I know.  But everything is collected in the little pot and it works magically and it's quick.  Quickness is a key point on this when touching a fussy/sick kid's nose.  It cleans really easy as all the pieces come apart.  We've been using this with a toddler with sinus issues and allergies and it's made the process much easier and it's less germy than the bulb kind.  This item was provided for review purposes and this is my honest opinion.
A variety of flavors adds to the ease of preparing that all important first cup of coffee for the day which lies ahead.
Great quality and easy to use. I am really pleased with the quality of the product, it was easy to install and is durable.

This is an outstanding tonic water. If you drink premium spirits, you're doing yourself a disservice if you're not accompanying it with Fever Tree. The flavors are subtle and pure and enhance, rather than drown, the flavors of your favorite gin or tonic. The absence of a sickly sweetness is what makes this tonic most special, along with the mild notes of quinine and a bitterness that's just notable enough to work. The premium for this product is worth every penny.

Having tried it out with a number of spirits, I've found this works especially well with Nolet's gin. If you're going to spend $55 on a bottle of gin, you owe it to yourself to spend $1.25 on a bottle of tonic!

I stumbled across these here and I'm real happy I did.  The only other place I'd seen them was at Trader Joe's which I don't frequent.  These taste great and I am a chocolate snob.  (I'll also probably reduce myself to a muumuu and copious daytime TV watching if I eat as many of these as I'd like to...)

Maybe my expectations were too high after reading all the glowing reviews for this oil. It's a good olive oil, but I was not overly impressed with the flavor. It's clean and smooth, but I did not get the fruit and spice notes that other reviewers have commented about. I will use this oil for dressings and pastas, but for dipping bread, there are better options, albeit at higher prices. This is a solid oil for a good price but nothing to write home about.
Love Medela bottles. They are easy to clean and assemble and my baby has liked them from day one. Plus all the parts are interchangeable with all the pump stuff. Love love love medela.
These last for about a week after opened, they taste alright but not worth the extra price.  Would go to your local Whole Foods to pick up something better.

I like the low-fat availability of Peanut Butter! Flavor is good.
Easy to take with you in a small plastic container & add water when you are ready to eat it. Portable protein.
I have heard people say there are too many sugars in this product, but in comparison to jar pnut butter, it is the same.
We love good coffee and this coffee is one of the best we've found. So glad we heard about it from family members living in Canada.

The cookies arrived on time, and they were safely packaged in a refrigerator bag. The cookies taste amazing, the texture was smooth, and chewy, I could taste the peanut butter, and the chocolate chunks were a perfect addition to the cookie. Afterwards, I was pretty satisfied.  I highly recommend it as a snack, breakfast food, even a dessert. Although, I only bought it once the price was little bit too high for my budget, of course if with more room in my budget I would buy it again.
Build quality and design is excellent! The only cons: remote does not control sound separately, it's just able to on/off. There is a little noise picked from the motor into the speaker.

Both the raspberry and the mango Lipton Instant Teas are a hit with the many people I serve this to over the course of the year at a local homeless shelter and on the streets of Atlanta on hot, muggy summer days.
Very refreshing and no weird aftertaste.

So my Coconut butter came and was wrapped securely in bubble wrap. But the container was still slippery, like it had coconut oil all over it (which it did). I don't know if it came from \\"my\\" jar or from other jars a the warehouse, but it was a little annoying. I opened it up and it was very hard on top and a little brown. Nothing to worry, I figured. I put the jar in some hot water and let it soak for a bit and then when I opened it, it was very liquid for the top half of the jar and still solid at the bottom. I tried stirring it up to see if I could get it all to mix, but I really could not easily get the bottom stuff to stir.

I thought about letting it soak longer and then I started worrying that maybe the lid wasn't on tight and I had let water into the product and that is why it was so liquidy. I took a little bit of the liquid and put it in the fridge to see that it solidified and I was not worried about having added water...it was just the oil. Still, it took until overnight before the product \\"set\\" again. I don't know what it is like half way down in the jar (where it was previously fairly hard), but the top half is now very easily scooped with a spoon.

I mixed it up with some coconut oil and peppermint oil and honey based on a Nutiva recipe and made my own york peppermint patties (without the chemicals). They were heavenly.

Not sure what else I will use it for, as I think regular coconut oil is more versatile. But even if I used this only to make peppermint patties again, it was totally worth it. I did try it on an english muffin. I think I prefer the taste of smart balance though.

Great product, great taste, the only thing to remember is when you use virgin the coconut taste is there.  I love it so it doesn't bother me but places where I sneak it in, to those who don't like it, they notice! I use (not virgin) to make eggs, I do half butter, half coconut oil for baking cookies, exclusively to make tortillas, bread, and biscuits! Much better for you!

All the nuts were crisp, with not any stale or â€œoffâ€ ones in the whole can. They are not over salted which is a plus. Nor sure why, but these all taste pretty much the same except for the walnuts and brazil nut. I would probably order again.
Ate soursop in Guam, loved it.  Had forgotten about how flavorful it was.  Wish I could get the fresh fruit here!  Excellent service from retailer.

We used the prodcut to make a s'mores party favor for kids. Fortunately, I had read the available reviews and suspected that the quality might be an issue.

Purchased the bulk individually wrapped graham cracker because it was much easier to handle as we needed to make 100 of these favors. We opened one to see the condition of the cracker and it was brittle and not the quality that you would expect from the boxes purchased at a grocery store. The shipping and packing was fine so even if the package had been handled roughly in transit, it is unlikely that it impacted the quality.

First I will say that the stroller came looking just as pictured and it is a nice shade of blue. The stroller was very easy to put together on my own and now this is where my positives for this stroller end. There is really nothing else I like about this stroller. I own 4 strollers, this is the first stroller I ever bought that I felt like was a complete waste of my money. I bought this one because I needed a light compact stroller that I could easily take on the metro with us and that would still provide my son with a good canopy to protect him from the sun while we were walking around D.C. The canopy was awful, may as well not have even had one, the wheels on my stroller do not actually lock, that was another feature that may as well have never been added. My wheels are all wonky when pushing this thing so it was almost impossible to walk straight, I was fighting the stroller the entire time I was out, I assume that was due to the fact I could not actually lock the swivel action but even on my other stroller with swivel wheels I never have this problem. The seat seemed a little flimsy and I constantly kick this stroller when walking, I am only 5'4'' and none of my other strollers cause me to do this. I used this stroller on that one occasion and have never and will never touch it again, if I find myself needing another umbrella stroller I will try my luck with another one, this one is sitting in my garage until I take it to Goodwill.
We all LOVED IT!  The price was great and it is probably the best cocktail sauce we have tried in some time!

The wet bags work well enough as wet bags, but when it came time to wash them I regretted going with ones that had a magnetic seal. The magnets got caught on the inside of my washer, so now the area around the magnet looks frayed. This isn't a huge deal, but it's inconvenient. With all the other wet bag options out there, I would go with something without the magnets, because I never even used them anyway.

I bought this to use in my husband's truck so I would't have to shuffle my daughter's primary carseat (a Graco MyRide 65 that I LOVE) back and forth. I didn't want to spend the money on another expensive carseat so I did a lot of research and found this one. My daughter is BARELY 20 lbs and has been rear-facing in my car (she's 17 months), but since she is technically big/old enough to go forward facing, it seemed to make the most sense to purchase a booster seat that could be used until she is big enough for a saftey belt alone instead of another convertible that only goes to 65 lbs or less and isn't big enough for a large child. Anyway, I am no stranger to the LATCH system with this being my 3rd carseat personally and probably 6th I've installed (for family/friends), but this carseat's is by far the most difficult I've used yet. Just the location of the lower belt being so high makes it fairly difficult to get super tight, but by sticking your body weight & knee into the center of the seat and pulling with all my strength, I got it very secure (and I'm pregnant, so you can do it with some effort). The armrests are a bit flimsy and the drink/snack holder sits a bit tilted, but for the price, it's what I expected. Contrary to many opinions, I quite like the length adjustment in the front although it makes for a bulky strap. My biggest complaint is the chest clip...holy cow, that thing is seriously a challenge to get undone every time. If I had to use this carseat every day, I would go nuts. BUT if you have a child who can undo their own chest clip, this might be the seat for you because I know of no Hoodini child who'd be able to open this. Otherwise, the carseat seems comfortable enough (way more than my mother-in-law's Cosco) and does what it needs to!

Bottom line: You get what you pay for as far as luxury, but it does it's job! Beware of the chest clip though. Test one out at a store before you buy it to make sure you can tolerate that.

I have been researching cribs for months and love this style but since I can't see it in person I was wondering if someone could help with the color of the crib.  There are so many different \\"antique white\\" colors out there and I am trying to match a furniture piece I already have.  Is this \\"antique white\\" more of an off white or a true antique white (yellowish). The dressers can be painted but the top cannot which is more of an off-white than a true antique white.  Hope someone can help!  Thanks!!!

Bought this really early before my baby, around 3 months.  Now she's 6 months and starting to assemble.  I couldn't even get passed step one because the holes for the screws the match up!!!  Terrible craftsmanship.

I got this for Christmas and it is absolutely splendid! There is actually enough tea in each serving to brew a full pot, not just a single cup. I'm enjoying it so much, I'm going to order several more for other people as gifts!
This is solid lemon juice. Those who enjoy a good Lemon Squash occasionally will enjoy this product. Just add sugar.
Very clean and pure. I have been using it for both cooking and oil pulling and it works well for either application. Also just as a coffee addition. There is something to all this coconut oil talk.

I received this jar of French mustard in a broken state. Within minutes of leaving feedback and sending an e-mail I was sent a response, an apology, and a new jar. I am very impressed with the Frenchy Bee's customer service skills and will order from them again.

Product really lives up to it's name.  Wow - a great alternative to boring old water.  Feel like I'm at the spa when I drink it.  I'm definitely drinking more water now - and without the hassle of having to cut up fruit, etc.  Wish it were completely sweetener free, but then it probably wouldn't taste as good.  Thanks for a great product.

So I really like that this gate is a walk through and doesn't have to be screwed into the wall.  Beware, there are still quite a few draw-backs.  The first one is that it's difficult to install.  You twist and twist and twist all four of the touch points, and if you don't do it just right, the gate will be wonky or pop out of the wall.  My son has pulled it down several times because I cranked and cranked, but I still didn't get it quite tight enough.  Also, the two touch points on the bottom for some reason fall out of the gate when it's not installed, so if you're storing this gate or not using it all the time, it's super easy for one of those things to fall out in a closet or something, a toddler to walk off with them, and then never see them again, and then your gate is wonkier than ever.  This gate does not work at the bottom or top of stairwells well at all, but is pretty decent in standard doorways.  With stairs, it's difficult to get it level and tight between a banister and a wall, especially because banisters don't have a lot of flat space for the touch points, and secondly the step pedal often ends up not on a step, and so when you step on it, it can pull the gate down again!  It seems like now a gate that installs permanently would have been a better choice, but I got it for my mom's house so she can just put it up while we're in town and take it down for the rest of the year.

I purchased this thinking ti would be like peanut butter but it's hard. You have to warm or soak in water before using. Not sure what else I would do with it but will be looking up recipes.

In a previous review, I warned fellow customers about the possibility that meat could be grain finished and still be labeled \\"grassfed.\\" A representative of the company selling this meat then informed me that their meat is grass finished, and that they felt this was included in grassfed, even though regulations would allow them to more cheaply grain finish. I feel this shows they care more about customers than about just barely clearing the bar to satisfy regulations. Some companies are not so honest, and these guys should get props for that!

On top of that, this meat is competitively priced when compared to other online retailers. However, it is not competitively priced when compared to the wide array of grassfed beef options available to most people. Check around your local area, look for farms markets, ask butchers, etc. You will likely find grassfed meat at a fraction of this price. And you will be helping save the earth by reducing shipping long distances!

If in the end, you can't find other options, then (from my interaction), this seller is just trying to sell healthier meat, where as some are just trying to swindle as much money as they can with misleading labels. A+

This syrup is awesome!  I have a Sodastream and I use this as flavoring instead of the Sodastream brand flavoring.  The cherry lime flavor is bright and delicious.  It has real sugar instead of high fructose corn syrup or artificial/diet sugar and it makes a huge difference.  I don't even have to use a whole lot of it each time either.  It is just really good and really high-quality.  I use it for Italian sodas with half and half, soda water, ice cubes and a slice of orange and a cherry as a garnish.  Yum!

This bag would be good for any other purpose.. NOT a diaper bag. Other moms know you need to pack tons of just-in-case stuff in diaper bags. This bag was appealing to me because of the crazy amount of pockets inside. Well what I didn't expect was how tall and narrow this bag . So narrow that if you put something in each pocket. All of the pockets are touching each other and then there's no room to actually put anything in the large middle area. There are also pockets all around the outside, but again, they're not great. There are no zipper pockets anywhere on this bag. So basically the 2 days I used this bag, it was packed to the brim (WAY tinier than you imagine) and since it was so full, I couldn't zip it and was constantly making sure it was sitting upright because if it ripped over, everything would spill out of the middle or the outside pockets.
Also the quality of the fabric is not great. It feels very cheap and the straps are already starting to come apart from the bag (again, I only used it two days before I switched.)
Would NOT recommend this.

I love this necklace. It looks stylish but it is soft, flexible, and chewable. My baby loves it. The breakaway clasp is essential and I am glad they thought of it. The bronze color is fantastic and doesn't look like plastic.

I got so tired of having to leave my phone in her room to play her night time music so I got this I love that it's blue tooth and that I can play her music through it.  She also love the sounds that it's programmed with.

I really love these nursing pads and am so sad because they are becoming more and more difficult to find and when I do find them, the price is going up. They are very thin and comfortable. I have not had issues with them being visible or bunching--they conform to me pretty well. Overnight, if I move a lot from side to side, I'll wake up and they'll be coming out the top of my bra, but during the day I don't have that issue at all. I have had them become saturated overnight, but the plastic backing stopped from leaking out onto my nursing bra. I wear them with my nursing bra 24/7 and cried when I had to buy another brand when I couldn't find these in stock. As soon as it was back in stock I bought more and stopped using the other brand I purchased and hope to never have to use the other one again.

I normally do not write reviews for items purchased on line, but felt compelled to write one for Cafe Caribe. I read all the reviews before purchasing this item, but dismissed the negative reviews as unrealistic. One reviewer mentioned the flavor is akin to the smell of an ashtray; I know now this is not an exaggeration. The coffee bricks arrived promptly & well-packaged, but that was the only positive aspect.

Cutting the brick open, there is no pleasant fragrance familiar with opening other coffee cans or bricks from Bustelo, Pilon, Lavazza, Estrella, or Gevalia. Even Folgers coffee smells better by comparison. Cafe Caribe has an unmistakable cigarette smoke smell to it. The roast is medium, not dark; the grind is coarse and very uneven.

Bottom line, Cafe Caribe is cheap very difficult to drink even when masked with strong flavors and milk or cream. It might best put to use in seasoning new Moka pots then fertilizing the rose bushes. My advice is to save your money and spend it on Bustelo if you like Cuban coffee.

[[ASIN:B00060O578 Cafe Caribe Dark Roast Espresso Coffee, 10-Ounce Bricks (Pack of 6)]]
